Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: I was spending 5 days in NYC which included 2 days of work and 3 days of vacation so I was looking for an affordable, clean, safe hotel which was convenient to get to both uptown and downtown. This hotel fit the bill perfectly! As a woman traveling alone, safety is always a concern and I felt very safe at this hotel and within the surrounding neighborhoods even at night. The hotel itself was tastefully decorated, comfortable, clean and very quiet (even by Minneapolis standards!). The front desk staff and the doormen were helpful, friendly and welcoming. The complimentary continental breakfast each morning was fantastic, delicious and filling. The morning paper (NY Times & USA Today) were also a nice extra. The price for my stay was right on the mark, too! When I make my nect trip back to NYC, I will definitely include the South Park Hotel in my plans!

Reviews.Title: “average-ish rooms, great bar”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: my initial reaction to this hotel is why? it's a little out of the way, a little mediocre, surrounded by a little too many indian restaurants and a little meh. it's not that i don't get it. ok rooms and great prices with breakfast pull in the europeans. so it's not surrounded by times square, soho or the village...big deal. the rooms were honestly just ok. the bar was fantastic - great service and really friendly staff both days. the breakfast was euro style good. everything this traveller needed in pretty vast quantities. and the desk staff were very nice. i base a stay on the hotel for 60% and the rest (staff, etc) for 40%. so average is about right.

Reviews.Title: “Average Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwesth
Reviews.Content: Park South Hotel in many ways represents the average Manhattan hotel. You pay for location and location is okay for this Hotel. Subway station just round the corner, Neighbourhood is not great but ok as well. Rooms are a biot on the smaall side, so are beds, Interiour is worn, cleanliness is not above average. Staff is polite but somewhat limited in terms of helpfullness. Only thing that is really above average is the breakfast buffet. Plenty of choice, nice seating and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sandybeaches79
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how terrific this hotel is. Great location, complimentary breakfast with lots of selections, nice room, unlimited chocolates at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LDouglas
Reviews.Content: Stayed late Feb 2012 with my wife. Chose the larger room option which turned out to be a good choice as the inside rooms looked small. Our room was spacious but i could only describe the closet/wardrobe area as non existent,Small safe ,large bathroom, great bed and plenty of drawer space. The free wi-fi was spot on but the TV was not worth watching which was not an issue when you're in NYC.Location was spot on as the subway was on the street corner and eating places are aplenty,If you can reserve the larger room option at the the right price then i would jump at the chance - don't forget about the inclusive breakfast which was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Park South hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnCass
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park South Hotel in February with my wife and two boys (11 & 9) and had a great time. The hotel was very well located with only a fairly short walk to Empir State building and Times Square. All the staff were really friendly and helpful, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, and the breakfast really set us up for the day. As we didn't really adjust that well it was great to be able to get a coffee before 6am. We also ate a couple of times in the restaurant and it lived up to its reviews, hence the reason we ate there twice! I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: KRD123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March/April 2011 for 8 days while I was doing some work on my M.A. at the Metropolitan and Brooklyn Museums. I really liked this hotel. It was clean and quiet. The rooms are small, but such is NYC. I have stayed at several other hotels in Manhattan and they have always been the same size. The hallways (not the rooms) smell like curry, but they are in Curry Hill so I was not surprised. The best part of this hotel is the location. It is central to everything, and literally 1/2 block away from the 6 subway, which will take you to grand central or lower Manhattan to transfer easily. There are several places to eat and drink that are very close. If you like to walk, it is not too far to the TS/ Central Park area. I'm a mega-walker, so I spent almost all of my time on foot and had no problems getting around, and I saw so much more of the city. The staff at Park South were super. The front desk and door staff are lovely. Housekeeping was efficient and polite. The concierges that bring ice and room service are awesome. I was very impressed. NYC can be a stressful town, especially when you are trying to get work done. The Park South was a nice place to stay and accommodated my needs nicely. I got a really good rate and was very impressed with the service and location. I would say that this will be my first choice to stay when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Economical and POLITE”
Reviews.Author: smg608
Reviews.Content: Very quick visit to NYC , only one night. Made online res. with AAA discount and was able to get a beautiful room for under $140. Checked in early on a friday and was upgraded to a corner room, view of Chrysler Building. Every person I encountered was polite, helpful and always pleasant (remember this is NYC). I needed a driver the next day to NJ and they arranged all the plans for me, driver waiting at exact time needed. Breakfast buffet was sumptuous, fresh fruit, juices, pastries, deli meats and cheeses, and hard boiled eggs. The clientele was definitely a majority of foreign visitors, many languages heard. I will certainly return here for another visit, hopefully longer. The area has much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AlexH222_2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an enjoyable stay at PSH. The room, whilst relatively small, was clean and in good condition. The breakfast was good, with plenty of bagels, ham and cheese, plus other options. We regularly used the bar for the early part of the evening, and at $5 for a draught beer or glass of wine it was one of the cheapest places to drink we found. Staff where helpful and we were able to use the business facilties to go online and print off our online airplane confirmation. Overall a good hotel that we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex186403
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York, and we chose to stay at the Park South, after reading generally good reviews. This was a short break to celebrate the birthdays of my wife and daughter. We stayed in 2 Executive King rooms, which were spacious and spotlessly clean. The large beds were very comfortable. The hotel has retained much of it's original character and charm, unlike many of the alternative corporate style hotels that we could have stayed at. There is a small business room in the basement and you can use the computers and printers free of charge. The hotel staff were all polite and helpful with any questions that we had, including the owner, who was only too pleased to assist when I ran out of printer ink. Breakfast was served in the adjoining Black Duck Restaurant, which is very pleasant. The breakfast is included in the rate, and is of a good standard with plenty of choice for a continental style. We had dinner at The Black Duck on our last night, and enjoyed it immensely. My wife and daughter had the duck and I had the pan fried chicken. The portion sizes were generous and the quality of the food would have been difficult to find at that price in the U.K. The service was polite and discrete. The hotel is situated near the middle of Manhattan, in a mixed commercial/residential district and you can easily reach all of the main tourist sights. Whilst the subway is further down the street, we used taxi's for convenience as the cost over a few days was well worthwhile. The Empire State Building is literally a few minutes walk away, and on the clear day we visited the views were breathtaking. It is a quieter time of year to visit, but I was surprised that we managed to avoid any queues by arriving early in the morning. I would recommend this hotel, and if larger rooms are important would suggest that Executive King Rooms are booked, as these are good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location a wee gem”
Reviews.Author: mikejt
Reviews.Content: Hi we are just back from the PSH. The important thing to remember this is a mid priced NYC hotel and should be treated as such Unlike some reviewers we found the staff very friendly chatty and welcoming. We were lucky enough to be allocated a large double queen room which did have an inner view. The room was clean, beds comfy, and the bathroom as large as any NYC hotel . I would have liked coffee making facilities or access to a lobby coffee machine. The breakfast was excellent and gives you a great start to the day . Black duck was great for a late night drink. Yes we would stay here again but we would book into a similar sized room . Great location just off park avenue a few blocks down from Grand central station. Loads of quality or mid-priced and a macdonalds with in 5 mins walk. Fantastic Indian restaurants round the corner, Subway at the top of the road , Excellent location. We walked nearly every where . Thanks to all hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: maull
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park South 2nd to 6th March,we thoroughly enjoyed our stay,breakfast was fantastic a good start to long tiring days,and we managed to sit by the fire twice which was heavenly.We found the hotel a good base,the subway was very close and we used this once or twice,other than this we walked everywhere,we didnt want to miss a thing.Staff here were very friendly,polite and helpful,rooms were small but very clean.The bar was very welcoming after long days and bar staff made us feel welcome,they were excellent at their jobs and very efficient.We would definitely stay here again,highly recommend scrummy breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Cathy F
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, the staff were friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. The rooms were small but cosy and exceptionally clean and comfortable. The breakfast was superb, with plenty of choice. Great location too! I cannot recommend this hotel enough and would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Value NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdoug1963
Reviews.Content: My wife and i travelled to NYC Feb 18th 2012 for 5 nights and loved it. The Park South hotel is boutique hotel on E 28th street and and it has a subway nearby. The weather was really quite mild so we walked most places. On arrival we didn't feel that we received much of a welcome nor were we told anything about the hotel or where any of its facilities were.Our room did not have an information folder. We worked it out for ourselves. Our room was an outside facing room which was a good size and the bed, bathroom, etc were all good quality as was expected.The in-room safe was small so we hid our small laptop when not in the room.[ the free wifi was quick and always available] We noticed that the inside facing rooms looked smaller and tended to look onto an inside wall/courtyard? You may want to ask about this if it concerns you.The included breakfast was really quite nice, plenty of bagels,sweet treats ,meat,cheese,coffee,juice etc. I would imagine breakfast time might get a bit cramped in the busier months but they don't hurry you out .I would recommend this hotel as a perfect base for seeing the sights of NYC. Almost forgot to mention that our room had a small fridge which was a nice touch but not mentioned on the Expedia site when we booked our holiday. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mattymold
Reviews.Content: Stayed in quite a few hotels in NYC and this is one of my favorites. Small almost boutique, clean with delightful staff who always smile. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Maurice H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a large group 25 in total. The hotel was excellent for the following reasons. Staff were amazing they coudnt do enough to help, they were polite and highly informative. They were also super organised and checking in such a large groupe took 5 minutes. The rooms were lovely clean and presentable. The wardrobe space is minimal but if you are living out of your suitcase then it's fine. The breakfast was great, we even dined in the restaurant in the evening and the food was outstanding. I will definitely stay here next time I'm in new York as well as recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away”
Reviews.Author: sanfrandlle
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive. This hotel is in a great location at a very low price. Now, for the negatives. The rooms are small - I'm talking cell like. The room doesn't even really have a closet, it's more of a mini cupboard set into the wall with a few drawers underneath. No suitcase stand came with the room and with good reason - there's no room to stand it up! My suitcase barely fit beside the bed. And the bed, oh boy. I strongly suspect that if I ripped up the sheet and mattress pad I'd find a slab of concrete underneath. To top it all off, some genius put the fire alarm on the ceiling right above the bed. In the daylight it seems innocuous enough. At night it flashes like a strobe light, illuminating the whole room like a discotheque in Berlin. I haven't even described the food poisoning I got after eating a questionable looking slice of cheese from the free breakfast buffet. I'd avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst NYC hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: steffy25
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at my Nyc hotels and am not picky. First off, the rooms look nothing like the picture, they are dingy and dark. It was so noisy during the night with workers my boyfriend had to go out and tell the staff around 2:30 am to stop banging their things around. There was a huge fan outside our window that kept going on around every 30 seconds and was so loud and annoying. I called to complain and the hotel desk worker was very rude and did nothing to compensate. Any other time we've had a problem at the hotel they at least threw in something to make us happy. The TV was fuzzy and one of the pillows were stained. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: RS86
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park South hotel on Quikbook not knowing much about it. I got a great deal for a room with a queen bed, paid $151 total price. The staff was very nice. The wifi was free and worked great. The room was a little small but very clean and the bed was super comfy with great pillows. The hotel was very quiet which isn't easy to find in NYC. They had complimentary breakfast which was a nice touch. All in all a great value in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: sthmcr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early February. A standard double room cost around £250 for a Wed-Sat stay, so not too bad. This was my second visit to New York - and wanted something a bit cheaper than last time, but in the same area. The Park South Hotel fitted the bill pretty well. The location is so convenient for the subway and is within reasonable walking distance of many of the midtown sights. It has a quieter and less touristy feel than the area around Times Square for example, which really appealed. The staff were very helpful, the inclusive continental breakfast excellent, plus some nice touches like free wifi and free printing in the business centre. The room itself wasn't bad either. Small, and somewhat limited view, but in Manhattan that's pretty much the norm. There were a couple of maintenance issues in the room that weren't major enough to spoil our stay (loose and slightly cracked toilet seat, for example), but it would have been good if the cleaner had spotted them and flagged them up. There were other things you might expect like an iron and a safe. The bed was comfy and the room not too noisy at night. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again if in the area and in the price range I was after.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Susie20817
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel solely because of the location around the corner from a business appointment. I arrived mid afternoon and was very put out when I walked in and saw someone fast asleep on the worn furniture in the front lobby. I had pre-paid or I would have walked out then. When I walked into my room I almost had a panic attack - it was that small with a teeny window overlooking a brick courtyard. No closet, hooks on the wall. No dresser but a couple of built in drawers and a half-size desk and straight back chair and queen size bed rounded out the picture. I was going to work in my room ( free wifi but questionable security notice on the wifi) but decided that I couldn't stay in the room ( yes, I am a little dramatic). I went back to the front desk and told them that the room was not what I had expected and would not work. A bellman showed me two options and although the desk had initially told me it would mean a $50 upgrade fee, I must have looked pretty pathetic, because they waived the fee. The new room faced the street, had a king sized bed, and in addition to a small desk, had two worn but comfortable side chairs. On top of that -- three large windows with bright sunlight. While there were still nicks on the furniture -- the place was CLEAN and totally acceptable. I was only staying one night -- good thing -- the closet was about 6 inches deep. Morning complimentary full continental breakfast and then I was on my way. All is well that ends well.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel - a real find!”
Reviews.Author: Sam007Berkshire
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, location was ideal being within walking distance to many attractions and 50 yards to the subway. Excellent and helpful staff. The only downside was a small cupboard to store our clothes - too small for two persons. Our room was on the cosy side, but as we weren't in there very much, it didn't matter. We took our own kettle/coffee as sadly this is a service not provided in the room. The housekeeper was great, good attention to detail. The continental breakfast was included in the rate and was a good start to the day. The only thing I can say is that the choice was the same every morning, which for us was little limiting during our six night stay. Personal choice! There are some great restaurants nearby; pizza and Turkish with plenty of choice. The nearby subway is great, being on the No 6 line. We ate in the bar on our first night as we arrived quite late - a very warm welcome by the bar tender and was a wonderful start to our holiday. We decided to book a cab at $55 direct from the hotel to the airport, which meant we could leave when we wanted and not be involved in a round robin collecting other passengers from other hotels. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. We want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: seaskyhopper
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and the hotel is overpriced. The breakfast was OK. Very nice strawberry croisants. You can do better in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ShoeGalSITC
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Park South Hotel when visiting New York for work, as it is right around the corner from my office. My last stay was in December 2011, where I was in town for almost a week. As usual, the staff was super friendly throughout the time I was at the hotel - down to the woman who asked me how my stay was in the elevator when I was going to check out. A few things - prepare yourself for a small hotel room and bathroom. In true New York style, there really isn't a ton of space. On this particular visit, my room was extremely hot and stuffy. The bellhop who escorted me to my room informed me that he had just moved a woman out of that room a few hours earlier because it was so hot, but after turning down the heater and popping open a window, it was fine. I'm not too picky, so I decided to stay there, and if it got too hot, I would move. At first, it was fine, but in the middle of the night, it became unbearable. Needless to say, I spent the rest of my visit with the window open! The bathroom also is pretty tiny, and there's really no place to put toiletries. I spent most of my mornings placing my hairdryer on the toilet seat! Needless to say, I was pretty happy to get back to my spacious apartment in Mass. by the day I was supposed to check out! The location of the hotel itself is pretty good - with a lot of restaurants and conveniences closeby. There is a Duane Reed on the corner if you want to stock up on water and other snacks, and there are several fast food and nice restaurants on the blocks surrounding the hotel. The staff is great and has always been super friendly and happy to help every time I've been at the Park South. From watching my bags when I run down the street to get a diet pepsi or offering me extra chocolate at the desk, they're always upbeat and if anything is wrong, willing to work it out.

Reviews.Title: “Travel light if you're staying here!”
Reviews.Author: notjustbows63
Reviews.Content: Luckily, my husband and I were only staying one night at this hotel and so we each only had one small bag. We stayed in the smallest hotel room in NYC we have ever seen. The room was clean and comfortable with the freshest towels and bedding; but there is no place to put your clothing. There is no bureau and a tiny closet with 5 hangers the size of a small file cabinet draw. There is no place to put your luggage down without tripping over it. There are a few hooks by the door to hang your coats. The staff is helpful, pleasant, and professional. The breakfast is very good and the food is fresh. We would stay here again if we need to b/c of it's location, train station on the same street, and overall cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Chrysler Building!”
Reviews.Author: TundraPup
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Park South Hotel for a week. It's a lovely, old building with a charming lobby. The room decor was uncluttered and soothing and we found the beds to be quite comfortable and room to be a haven after spending a day in the hustle and bustle of the city. The showers had great water pressure and nice, hot water. Our room was quiet and although you could hear noise from the street, it wasn't loud enough to bother us - even on weekend nights. Having free wi-fi was an additional bonus. It just astonishes me how many Manhattan hotels charge up to $14 a day or more for it, so with the free wi-fi and breakfast I found the hotel to be an even better value. Another thing I liked was that the room had a safe that was large enough to accommodate my laptop computer. An unexpected and most welcome thrill for us was the view from our 7th floor window - we could see the top of the beautiful Chrysler Building. We got such a kick out of actually seeing it light up in the evening a couple of times and the lights turn off in the morning. The front desk staff and doormen were some of the friendliest I've ever encountered on my travels. They were a wealth of information on restaurants and what was available right in the neighborhood. From the time I called the hotel to make the reservations to the time we left - I enjoyed courteous, professional customer service. The hotel has a fitness center in the basement. Although not large, it was more than adequate and my daughter and I were happy to have it so conveniently located. There were sanitizing wipes for the equipment available as well as extra towels and a water cooler. It had an iFit compatible treadmill, bike and elliptical as well as a bench and free weights. The complimentary breakfast was quite good. There was a selection of pastries, breads and cereals, as well as fruits and boiled eggs. Juice, coffee and an assortment of teas was also available. My only complaint would be that the tablecloths at breakfast would get soiled between diners and were not always changed. I would think it better to remove the cloths altogether. Loved the location - the subway 6/green line was literally steps away from the hotel - just two stops from Grand Central Terminal - which made getting to just about any part of the city quite easy. The staff arranged for a car to take us to the airport - it worked out perfectly - a beautiful, clean car and friendly, professional driver. My daughter and I love NYC and plan on returning - we will definitely consider staying at the Park South Hotel again. I

Reviews.Title: “Really really good or really good depending on price”
Reviews.Author: Texasradio
Reviews.Content: For 185 special it was really really good. For 230 it was really good but then it starts to get in price range for other considerations. Location is heat right by sub. Rooms are small but look like a 230 a night place. Beds are great. Close to a few neighborhood bars. I have stayed there twice now. Price below 210 and I don't even have to think where I will stay on third trip.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay at the park south”
Reviews.Author: Pmg1975
Reviews.Content: The room was very simple, but a pleasant complimentary breakfast and the fantastic staff on the desk who helped me with a hire car that failed to turn up made it a wonderful place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: VoyageuseDeCanada
Reviews.Content: Before going, I looked at the reviews already posted on this site. I would say most are pretty accurate. But I will add a couple of my own comments as well. The hotel was clean and there was enough room for all 4 of us girlfriends. We did have to get strategic on where we put the suitcases and such, but we made it work and it wasn't as bad as I was prepared for it to be. For whatever reason, we consistently had 3 sets of towels with 4 of us staying. A little frustrating but everytime we asked for more, someone was at the door in less than 5 minutes. The breakfast was a good selection, but the dining room is small and if we went down later (9am-10am) there could be a pretty good line up of people waiting for a table. Sometimes we just zipped in, grabbed what we wanted and ate in the room. The staff were helpful and friendly. The location overall was decent as we were literally 10 steps away from the metro - green line. We walked to the Empire State building in 10-15 minutes and a cab ride in the evenings back to the hotel from wherever we were usually cost about $10. If going back to NY, I would look into other options just to compare. But, if this still looked to be the best option, I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect rooms, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Shaujen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights over new years with my partner. Hotel was very clean and the superior queen room we had was a great size for a new York hotel room. The staff were all extremely helpful and all questions answered or advice given when needed. The location was the best part of all. Right beside a central subway station, a few mins walk to the empire state building and other great attractions. Price was very relevant to the location, service and room. Only negative was the limited breakfast choice, but we only had breakfast there one morning so maybe were just unlucky. It definitely would not stop us staying in this hotel again or recommending it to anyone for their stay in new York city

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: Giovanna7
Reviews.Content: We travel to New York City every year during the Christmas Holidays and over the years we have stayed at several different hotels in the city.. This was our first stay at the Park South and we were very happy that we chose this property for our holiday visit this year. The Park South is a little distance from the bright lights of Times Square and Broadway but the nearby subway stations will take you Uptown or Downtown. The Park South staff is truly dedicated to making their guests very comfortable. The rooms are spacious and clean, A refrigerator and coffee maker are available in the room. A very ample complimentary breakfast is included in the room rate.. Also available on a complimentary basis is the business center located in the lower lobby level and it was very convenient for us to be able to print our boarding passes the day before our flight departure. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and will go out of their way to make their guests comfortable. We will defintely return to the Park South on our next visit to the "Big Apple".

Reviews.Title: “Clean quietly located hotel but missing something.....”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter have just returned from a 5 night trip to NYC for Christmas. We stayed at the Park South after a little investigation into reasonably priced and located small hotels in the city, which we eventually booked as a package with flights through BA. The location, although a little further out than some, is good and quiter than the more central midtown hotels; if you're prepared to walk or happy to get the subway then it's fine. If not then don't bother with this location. Our room was a standard queen and I didn't have any really high expectations, however tea/coffee making facilities in the room I did expect, particularly when any refreshments in the hotel were purely reliant upon the Black Duck Restaurant! The room was small with a lousy outlook but as with most visitors to NYC you are not there to sit in your room so we were happy with that. The bathroom was small but enough for myself and my daughter. The room and the bathroom were very clean with clean towels provided each day with a top up offered in the evening by house keeping along with a chocolate; nice little touch. We met 3 different doormen who all were very nice, polite and helpful. The desk staff in the main were pleasant and helpful but a couple of them seemed as though it was a little too much trouble to speak to you and had a very disinterested air. The breakfast provided in the Black Duck was good, and although the same everyday it was enough to kick start the day, particularly in a city where food is on every corner making one choice quite difficult! We ate in the restaurant on Christmas Eve as we were particularly tired from the previous days travelling and the days sight seeing so not up for doing much that evening. What I can say is that the food was OK, the menu is limited and I just felt that they were trying too hard to be something they are not. I also got the impression that as we were hotel visitors, we weren't terribly important and they were busy flitting round making sure everything was set-up for the evening for walk-in visitors. Our service that evening was provided by the barman; nice guy, typical friendly/approachable barman type. The other staff in the restaurant were non-descript with an air of over importance that I did not warm to. All in all I was disappointed as the reviews I read before eating here were good but the food was OK, nothing to write home about. I've eaten much better in a number of local UK Home Counties gastro style pubs and country wine bars. One of my biggest complaints is that the hotel does not have a nice comfortable central lounge just to grab a coffee and unwind a little after a day sight seeing and shopping before getting ready to go out again in the evening. Instead it just has a lobby with two sofas and the reception desk with refreshments only available after 5pm from the Black Duck or a local Starbucks. Also, if you stay on the 6th floor, watch out for the strong smell of curry in the mornings in the corridors to the lifts. This can only come from the Copper Chimney next door! Would not stay here again but each to their own I'm sure many a perfectly happy with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel is a good location”
Reviews.Author: Kofbrisvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights, whilst the room was very small it didn't affect us as we were out all day and most of the night so it was ok. The rooms are very clean and well maintained, the breakfast is good and enough to get your day started. The front desk are very nice and quite helpful. The restaurant options around the hotel are limited or maybe it was our preferences? There is a subway stop at the end of the street very handy for transferring updown and downtown although sometimes you may have to take 2 or 3 trains to get back, not a big deal seeing as they come every 5 to 10 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Team_DC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with two female friends. Room was a little disappointing. Sold as a superior triple but I couldn't see what made it a superior room. The carpet was rather old and had a large stain in the doorway and the decor was rather dated. The room had two double beds but was only set up for two adults - not enough hand towels for three people, only two tumblers in the bathroom, not enough toiletries for three people. Some nice touches though such as clock radio, fridge, bathrobe (but only one!) so maybe these were extras that made it a superior room? However, the room and bathroom were clean as were the bedding and towels. The shower in the bathroom was very powerful and always plenty of hot water. The room was at the back of the hotel so was extremely quiet. There was no road noise whatsoever and I never heard any noise from other guests at all - no doors slamming, no talking, no plumbing noises. The only noise was that of the air con units outside but that wasn't overly loud. I couldn't believe that we could be in mid-town Manhattan and not hear anything! The location is good for reaching lower Manhattan and areas such as Empire State Building and Macy's. A bit of a trek to the more popular areas such as around Central Park and Broadway but walkable. There was a subway station just a few hundred yards from the hotel though I never used it. The hotel amenities are good - gym, restaurant, business centre, luggage store room. The staf were extremely friendly and helpful - particularly the doorman who organised a return car to the airport for us. We booked it for 3pm but when we returned at 2.30pm the car was already there waiting with our luggage loaded. It was a plush car but only cost $10 more than the yellow cab we took from JFK to the hotel. Breakfast was just continental but there was a toaster. Good selection of breads/muffins/bagels and various danish pastries, fresh fruit, cold meats and cheeses, boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, juice, tea and coffee. Everything was replenished regularly. As breakfast was included in the rate, I think what was provided was excellent and of a good quality. This was my third trip to NY and I have always stayed further uptown (45th St, etc). Personally if I were to go again I would prefer to stay more uptown again though I would never be able to find such a quiet hotel. If I needed to stay in this area again, I would definitely be happy to stay at this hotel but would try and obtain a more up-to-date room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - Boutique Euro-Style Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: For New York, this was not bad. The room was decently sized - for New York. The bathroom was extremely small (you had to move to close the door). It actually reminded me of some of the small 3-star hotels I've stayed at in France or Italy, including the Euro-style buffet breakfast served in the Black Duck, the hotel's adjacent restaurant - that comes with the price of the room. Very centrally located on Park & 28th.

Reviews.Title: “I could just feel the bed bugs....”
Reviews.Author: Kerri O
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Staff is friendly enough. The bar is comfy and has decent food. BUT....the rooms need serious updating - they need better lighting...and the beds and sheets were terribly dingy and dirty. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: JacquesRavoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip with a group. The staff are very friendly, make you feel welcome and always helpful. The room I had was not big but convenient. Nice large bed, nice bathroom. The closet is too small though when staying for six nights. Breakfast is great, everything is there. The bar has a nice choice of beers and other stuff. Great staff there also. There even was live music on Friday night. The location is excellent. Close to a subway station and with plenty of restaurants and bars around it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: momtravels88
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the quiet and clean hotel. We arrived early in the morning before check in hours. Before stepping into the lobby, received a warm reception for their complimentary breakfast buffet. The staff was very helpful. Stayed for four nights. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: sally w
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by friendly, helpful staff and is in a great location about a 10 minute walk from Times Square. The rooms are small, but immaculately clean and the breakfast (included in the price) was very good. Lots of pastries, croissants, bagels; cereals; toast; boiled eggs, cold meat, cheeses etc. Coffee was decent. The only slight disappointment was the paper bowls and cups, but I coulkd live with that. My son ate an enormous breakfast both mornings! This is not 5-star luxury, but for the price I don't think you could do much better. We were basically looking for somewhere comfy to rest our heads after a full day of exploring, and this fitted the bill perfectly. I can't comment on the fare at the Black Duck restaurant as we didn't eat there, but the menu looked very appealing, if a little expensive. Staff were friendly and helpful, providing maps and directions, and assistance logging into the free Wifi. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South on business because it was within walking distance of my meeting. This is a boutique hotel in a great location in Manhattan. The staff is cordial and helpful and the rooms are small, as would be expected in this type of property, but nicely furnished. There were tons of places to eat nearby, from inexpensive bagel shops or taco places, to fine restaurants. Due to its small footprint, it's a no frills hotel, the lobby is tiny, there are no restaurants, but you can walk through the lobby to the Black Duck restaurant next door. I've stayed at more luxurious boutique hotels in NYC, but this was was fine for a short trip and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say small room?”
Reviews.Author: Oceansmith
Reviews.Content: Really small room. Uncomfortable bed. Poor AC. Maybe this is a good value for NYC, but anywhere else, this hotel would die a horrible death at this price.

Reviews.Title: “my place in nyc”
Reviews.Author: elisbzk
Reviews.Content: in a good neighborhood to get around the city. Half a block from the subway. Warm and comfortable. A very good breakfast at the Black Duck.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time...for a reason! great value yet very nice”
Reviews.Author: Dana F
Reviews.Content: won't be the last either. Great value, super location in Gramercy area, close to Grand Central. Small boutique hotel that has nice rooms, bathrooms, comfortable beds. We love the fact that a nice breakfast is included and served in the Black Duck restaurant right off the lobby. At night they have live jazz and a nice bar to enjoy... Look forward to the next time at Park South or NY hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Travels101
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Park South Hotel. Both times we had a king room at a reasonable price by New York standards. Last time, the Executive King was oversized. This time the Superior King was more than adequate. The rooms and common areas were exceptionally clean. Bathrooms are small but have all of the necessities and they are clean. Upholstered furinture shows some wear. The complimentary breakfast was terrific. Staff was very helpful and accomodating. Nice convenient location. One disappointment - since our last stay the hotel severed its agreement with the parking garage across the street which was extremely convenient to somewhere a few blocks away. No one told us this. We park across the street and paid A FORTUNE! That was just annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: enjoysabreak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights as a second choice. Wanted to stay in the Giraffe hotel round the corner having previously stayed there (another great hotel) but they were full. Was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my stay. The staff were friendly and welcoming, good breakfasts and plenty of space. There is a small terrace outside if you want to stop for a coffee or glass of wine. The room was spacious with a good sized bathroom. The bed was a bit harder than I would like but it was ok. This hotel is great value for money and would now be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A little hotel with a lot of heart!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple365
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC, trusted the reviews of this hotel, booked & wasn't disappointed at all. We asked for a view of New York & when we opened our curtains on the eight floor the Chrysler Tower stood in the background giving us a great introduction to NYC. Comfort within the room was good, bed was huge & lots of furniture, shower/bath was good,although the carpet could have done with a clean...was worried about bedbugs, pleased to say that no bites & no bedbugs detected. Staff were very co-operative & friendly..customer care was good here! Good breakfast in the black Duck which filled us up for the day ahead & returning at night to the Black Duck sat back & listened to some good live jazz, whilst drinking some good beers/wines. Looking forward to coming back to NYC & staying at Park South.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly run hotel in a very convenient area”
Reviews.Author: Majella S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in Park South Hotel and found it very well run with excellent housekeeping, great breakfasts (nice outdoor terrace for the sunny mornings) pleasant and efficient staff and very conveniently near 28th st, line 6 subway stop, will certainly stay there again and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great little neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: appo02
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and the Park South, and we were not disappointed. Primarily, we love the location -- it's in a real New York neighborhood (Murray Hill), not a touristy area, and the subway is 1/2 block away. For NY, the rooms are very inexpensive (under $250), are a good size, include amenities such as a mini-fridge, iron, and in-room safe, and the entire property is non-smoking. Rooms also include a very nice morning breakfast, with juice, coffee/tea, pastries/breads, cereal, fruit, eggs and meat -- a wonderful and convenient start to the day. We found the hotel to be clean and the staff to be very helpful. We'll plan to stay here again on our next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Will book it again”
Reviews.Author: MrTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: I would say that I got great value for the money. The rooms are big if you compare to other hotels in New York. The breakfast buffé had many different things, and it all tasted good. I asked for a quite room, and got one in the end of a long corridor, and it was completely quite there. No sounds from the streets, and no sounds from other rooms. The staff was very friendly and hepful. They printed google maps for me, and explained how to get to different places. They also booked a car when I had to go to the airport. I have previously stayed at 5 star hotels in New York, and they are fancier and more styled, but I would say that they are usually not worth the price difference.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nava A
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayd in N.Y.C for 10 days. We looked for a nice, reasonable price, central located place to stay in. This hotel fits our needs and much more... The staff was responsive and attentive, the room was comfortable and clean. (If you plan to stay long ask for top floor- it's quite). Brekfast was nice! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a short visit to NY”
Reviews.Author: krzw
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are very small, I love staying at this hotel. It is very clean, good buffet breakfast is included, nice workout area and great location - all at a very affordable price. I visit NY at least once a year and usually always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel for all New York Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: earthtravelller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as part of a Cunard package of flight/New York stay/transatlantic crossing back to the Uk on Queen Mary 2. Lovely small sized hotel in a quiet but central location, 10 mins walk to the Empire State and Macy's, a little less to the Flatiron, a little more to Times Square the main shopping area of 5th Avenue, Grand Central etc but also a subway a few yards from the hotel that took you wherever you wanted and was on a direct line to Bloomingdales, Central park or downtown to the financial district, Battery park for the ferries etc. Locationwise it certainly delivered There were many small shops and cafes in the immediate vicinity but this hotel provided a complimentary breakfast of bagels, croissants, toast, spiced bread, pastries, cereals, cold meats, cheese, fruit and yogurts so something for every taste. The room we had was overlooking an inner courtyard but as we only slept there we didn't mind and it was very quiet and away from the hustle and bustle, much appreciated after an action packed day. The air con was efficient, it needed to be as we were there the week of the big heatwave! Our initial impression was that the room was small (family room) and were a little disappointed but then again it didn't matter as we were only using it to sleep, although it was difficult to store all our cases and there is no full length wardrobe to hang dresses. These were the only minor downsides. The whole place was very clean and staff efficient and friendly, Reception knowledgeable and helpful re queries about getting around, sightseeing etc and Chuck the doorman always jovial and sorted out our transport to the Brooklyn terminal with no fuss and organised a fantastic large vehicle at a very reasonable cost. Would definitely stay here again, much more personal than the huge corporate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Much better now”
Reviews.Author: NormalTripper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. Until this trip my attitude was "Well, it's a place to sleep." This time my stay was great. The front desk people were helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Also, catering was top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, packed with amenities”
Reviews.Author: a_travel_monkey
Reviews.Content: I have to echo the many positive reviews about the Park South Hotel. I only stayed one night, but this was enough to experience some nice hospitality from the many staff who work there. So, why all the positive comments? Well, for me it offers a great package at a competitive price, and has some nice touches which enable it to stand out from other hotels in its price range, and even surpasses the services offered at some hotels in higher price brackets. The room I was allocated was a double double (room 821) which had a desk and chair, but no lounge chairs in what was a narrow room. The bed was comfy, and the decor is classic but not old fashioned. Unfortunately this room did not have a great view (not an issue for me), and was a little dark, with only 3 lights in the room, a ceiling light by the door, the desk lamp, and the bedside lamp. There is a safe in the wardrobe, empty fridge and ironing facilities if required. There was also a DVD player, a feature you rarely see in hotels. The air conditioning was effective, however, it is an old style system which was a bit on the noisy side, but at least you can control the settings. The bathroom was compact and clean, although some might find the sink small. The amenities included soap, body gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and hairdryer. Another feature you usually only see in upgraded rooms is a bathrobe. Whilst other places continue to charge for internet connection, this place offers free internet, both wired and wifi, as well as a business centre with free printing (although the PCs were a bit slow). There is also a gym on site. The free continental breakfast was extensive and something I really valued as a business traveller, enabling me to save time wondering the streets for something to eat. A complimentary newspaper is also delivered to your door. There is one final touch to mention, which is a turndown service. I have never experienced this before as I never stay in high end places, and I was initially a bit freaked when I realised someone had been in my room. Upon returning to my room at night, the blind had been pulled down, bedside lamp turned on and chocolates placed on the bed. Now that is a wonderful and surprising touch for a hotel which is in the mid-range. I've already recommended this place to colleagues, and will definitely look to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pete189541
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Midtown and close to a lot of sights. A hundred yards from the hotel there's a subway station with good connections to most parts of town. It's a nice place with a friendly staff and a good, though small, restaurant. The first night we had the worst room of them all near the kitchen, restrooms, and a noisy generator, which kept us awake all night! When we complained the next day, we were immediately upgraded to a wonderful room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “6th Trip to the City and this was the best hotel so far!”
Reviews.Author: snkrgirl
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviews say. This is a great hotel in NYC with a very central location. I can pretty much stay anywhere as long as it is clean and the staff is polite and accommodating. Park South is definitely the cleanest hotel I have stayed at in NYC and the staff couldn't have been more helpful! Used AAA to book and received a very reasonable rate. On top of that, having a free breakfast every morning is pretty much unheard of in NYC and this one is great. There is enough to eat that you could last all day without another meal until dinner. The subway is located right at the end of the corner and takes you to most attractions, shopping and restaurants in the city. I'm pretty sure when I visit NYC again that Park South will be the place for me to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location - Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sewven
Reviews.Content: The location is especially great if you like Indian food. This hotel is located in Little India. It's a nice walk to 34th street and 42nd street shopping. The breakfast was cold food but it included meat, cheese, cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, bagels, assorted sweet bread, cereal bars, yogurt, and juices and coffee. There is even a patio where you can sit outside to enjoy your eats. The front desk staff was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: jules0010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 4 days in July. It was the perfect location for our adventures. There is a subway stop a few steps away, that will take you close to a lot of the hotspots (Soho, Museum mile, Central Park, 5th Ave and Madison Ave shopping). We often took the subway to these spots and walked back. Since the hotel is on 28th street, it seems the center between it all. Seeing hotels in other areas, we were lucky. There are a lot of restaurants close by and yet the spot was quiet. The hotel staff were amazingly sweet and hospitable. Bag storage is free and done with a smile. The complimentary breakfast was very good, and although very busy, we still found a spot to sit. Breakfast included cereals, assorted bagels, pastries, breads, english muffins, assorted meat and cheese and fresh fruit/ fruit juices. The hotel is clean (though we were on the ground floor, refuse being tracked out left remnants/slight smell sometimes - I'm certain this isn't true of other floors). The beds were comfortable, the pillows were fantastic, the room was spacious. Free wifi works throughout the building. Some suggestions for hotel = full length mirrors and more lighting would be nice (again, not sure if this was just our room, but getting ready to go out sometimes proved interesting from lack of light/viewing angles). Suggestion for people staying = put the DND on the door if you plan on sleeping/being in the room past 9am. The cleaning staff start early! Overall, great location, great staff, clean/comfortable rooms. Exactly what we want when in a spot like NYC! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: jbarclay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park South for 3 days and 4 nights on a recommendation from my cousin and I can't say enough about the hotel. Of all the places we have ever stayed, this hotel has the best staff. They are always smiling and are willing to help with any request. The rooms are clean and are an excellent value considering a very good breakfast comes with it. And you can't beat the location. This will be our home in NYC the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sketsmth
Reviews.Content: Park South Hotel in NYC is located close to a subway stop that will take you everywhere you want to be in NYC. The staff was very friendly and helpful by answers ALL of our questions. The breakfast was good with New York bagels and fruit (and other continential bfast foods.) The room was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kevinocallaghan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family from June 27 - July 1 . Very well looked after by friendly hotel staff. Great selection of cold buffet breakfast included in price which kept us going during sightseeing trips. Nice bar attached to hotel which doubles up as breakfast room , always had our last drinks of the night here with bar/resturant manager.Booked double/double roooms which were very spacious and a queen room which was slightly smaller than anticipated . Rooms well looked after during our stay. Hotel well located and close to subway station. Staff willing to give tips on eating and sightseeing. Only annoying point was noise from air conditioning unit outside. Very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel...”
Reviews.Author: UnTjus
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, good value for money. We stayed at this hotel in may 2011. The location of the hotel is great, nice breakfast. The rooms with the queen size bed are very small but clean. The decor was updated. A lot of noise from the aircondition outside especially on second floor. There is no places to keep your luggage in the queen size room and the cupboard in the room is so small it can only hold 2-3 shirts. The toilet was so small you barely could keep you ...... inside the toiletbowl :-)) Nice staff and thanls to Chuck, the doorman for good service. Great restaurant in the hotel. Very close to subway 28. street and in walkingdistance to 5. ave...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jakcs
Reviews.Content: My husband was scheduled for surgery in Manhattan, and I needed a safe, clean, affordable hotel for myself and my 21-year-old son. Not wanting to spend a fortune on an expensive hotel, I asked friends and colleagues for suggestions. A colleague recommended the Park South Hotel on East 28th St. I had never heard of this hotel, but decided to try it. With a AAA discount, I was able to book a room for $189/night--a great rate for NYC. The room was clean and nicely appointed, with free wifi, cable, and a private bath. The staff were very professional and courteous, even asking us if we needed anythhing special since we were visiting a patient in the hospital. We could not have been more pleased. If you haven't been to the Park South Hotel, give it a try. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: cjgraham82
Reviews.Content: I can't get too excited about the hotel but at the same time there isn't much to complain about. The room was clean, not that big but not cramped. The breakfast was good - lots of pastries, fruit and cold meats - and the bar had some charm to it. The staff were perfectly fine. As for location, it's a quietish area for Manhattan, though if you're like and appreciate decent bars then you'll be going to other parts of town. Even the price was pretty average. All in all, nothing to shout about but it certainly does the job. .

Reviews.Title: “good choice in Murray Hill”
Reviews.Author: letsplay2
Reviews.Content: Park South is a good choice if you want to be near Madison Square park and Herald Square. The suite is a large room with a pullout couch, no closet. Really nice complementary breakfast. Some of the standard rooms in the hotel would be better classified as "maid's closet." Make sure to arrive early and ask for an alternate if they assign you to a closet!

Reviews.Title: “phenomenal first time in nyc”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkieGR
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, even though we were part of a large university group from Toronto arriving before check in time, the hotel was extremely organized in labeling our bags with names and room numbers so that we didn't have to do a thing. All inclusive breakfast was the highlight. Room was simply furnished and very functional, nothing more than that was needed from us. View from room wasn't great since we were on ground floor but we didn't need one anyways. Very clean and well kept hotel. At night they had live music playing in the breakfast/dinner area and it was a very romantic atmosphere. The staff were polite and always willing to give advice on tours and other sightseeing places around nyc. Location of hotel was not too bad with a fairly easy access to subway and close to empire state building and very quiet neighborhood. Best thing: amazing breakfast Worst thing: location (which again wasn't so bad)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, small rooms, but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: BobHLeverett
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in June 2011. The hotel is on 28th Street between Park and Lexington Avenues. One can reach the hotel from Grand Central with a walk directly down Park Avenue. This will take you 10 to 15 minutes, depending on your pace. The lobby is modest, but the check-in was efficient, pleasant, and offered little Hershey bars. Two adjacent elevators serve the hotel and this arrangement is adequate for all but the most busy times. There is an eating area off the lobby that serves the buffet style breakfast that comes with the room charge. Breakfast has a good selection of items, cereals, fruit, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, various danish, bagels, coffee (regular and decaf), and a selection of juices. Everything is simple and perfectly adequate. There is no limit and you can enjoy yourself. In the evening the same area becomes the Black Duck restaurant. I ate here one night, and had the duck. It was good, cooked right, and had plenty of flavor. I would rate the duck dinner as 8/10. Things are ordered one at a time, with the duck being about $25. Salad was extra, spinach, and also good but a bit routine, perhaps 6/20. Service was pleasant. It was a Tuesday night and no reservation was needed. There are two or three tables on the street, but most tables are inside. There is a bar that serves just about anything. The rooms are on the small side. Mine had a double bed, with about two feet to spare on each side, with perhaps 4 feet between the end of the bed and the wall. The bed was very comfortable and came with 4 regular pillows. A small desk was present with a good light with two intensities. There was a mini-fridge. The room had three small drawers and a half-closet - adequate to hang shirts or jackets, but a full length dress would have to be folded. There was no rack for a suitcase, but the top of the desk could be used. The bathroom was very clean and of good size and everything in there worked fine. There is air conditioning with two settings, two fan settings, and heat settings. It was 95 and humid most of the week and the air conditioner kept the room comfortable. It has the same problem many of these do - when the air conditioner cooling turns off, so does the fan so the noise level fluctuates. When the fan alone is on it is continuous. Internet is available. My room did not face the street (most don't) and was well insulated from the outside noise. This was one of the quieter hotels that I have experienced in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larpool
Reviews.Content: On arrival we could not get to the reception desk because a film crew were making what appeared to be a porn film , the hotel must have rented the reception to them . We were shown to a terrible squalid room and only after considerable argument we were upgraded , the room was nothing like what was advertised on Hotels.com and the receptionist blamed hotels.com but the porter said it was always happening . The upgraded room was fine and breakfast was good but be very sure about what you are going to get !

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SBHOregon
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy, clean, and friendly small hotel centrally located in MId Manhattan. It is 1/2 block from the 6 line which is only a couple of stops from Grand Central. There were plenty of places to eat within a couple of blocks of the hotel, including a bakery next door, a little grocery store at the end of the block, and a McDonalds at the other end of the block. We never ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant, but the menu looked really good, though expensive. The service was wonderful whenever I needed anything. (Other than you had to ask room service for ice, as they had no ice machine available) The morning free breakfast was enough to get you going: cereal, pastries, bagels, breads, sliced meats & cheeses, yogurt, fruit, snack bars, coffee and juice. Our room was a King on the first floor. The room size was adequate with a small desk and two chairs, but the closet was tiny and short. Luckily, we had no suits or long dresses that needed special care, as there would be no room for those. We hung our jackets from the drapery rod. The toiletries were very nice and replaced each day. The room was very quiet, but the view was of the gravel courtyard and an air-conditioning unit. We had to keep our drapes closed while in the room, as the other rooms were easily visible - no privacy from the windows. We walked to many areas around the hotel and always felt safe. Booking was easy through their website, and if you watch the specials, good deals are available. We booked for a little over $200 per night, which we felt was an excellent price considering the quailty of our stay. We would would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay but Not what Room described”
Reviews.Author: Btrtrvl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It was close to the subway and we could walk uptown or downtown also. Check in was easy. The desk staff was helpful with questions we asked. We had an inside room looking at another buidling, and it was very quiet. The room was very clean, but extremely small. We only had carry-on suitcases. Larger ones would not have fit in the Superior Queen we were given. The room description when we booked said that we had "unbelievably comfortable...beds....copierfax on working desk." Also said "robes". We did not have a comfortable bed nor did we have a copierfax on working desk or robes...just one and there were two of us. The bed did not seem like it was queen size. which we have in our own home. We only had a bed table on one side of our bed and no reading light or table on the other. We did ask the front desk if our room was superior queen and she replied "yes". Breakfast each morning wasvery good to get us on our way. Nice bar to have a drink at night. We were in New York and happy and did not spend any of our day at the hotel. We would stay here again and recommend it, but not if you wanted to spend any time in your room. I

Reviews.Title: “The Dark Side”
Reviews.Author: Exspecto
Reviews.Content: Darkest room ever. Good thing there's a hardware store down 28th. Street with a large range of flashlights. Had to order in an extra lamp, which the friendly, obliging staff brought in right away, but this made a very small very dark room into a somewhat lighter but smaller room. Did I say the room was dark? And after maybe three PM, at least in May when we visited, the (dark) brick wall outside the room gets even darker. One of those strap-on-to- your-head battery-operated lamps would come in handy. Or a miner's helmet. Superior staff at reception desk. The baggage handler/car wrangler ("Chuck") is efficiency and courtesy personified. Nice breakfast and nicer breakfast room which morphs into a bar/restaurant later on. Cozy lobby and entryway. Well-designed baths. Everything tidy and clean on account attentive and thorough housekeeping personnel. Can't gripe about the room rates, because New York prices have become stratospheric at every hotel we investigated. This will have to be our last visit to NYC until rates go down. I wasn't exaggerating about the darkness. I've been in smaller rooms; rooms so small you had to leave your carry-on out in the corridor (Southampton, UK), but this is the global low-lumens champ. So far.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Bill”
Reviews.Author: Northy_9
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a perfect position for all the main tourist sites, the subway is only 100 yards from the entrance of the hotel, and when you've had a long day this was worth it's weight in gold. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful - we had a problem with the rooms safe on day 3, but after reporting it an engineer turned up within minutes.The breakfast was a basic continental style, it was in good quantity and plenty of choice. The hotel room was small but very adequate for our needs, we were surprised that there was no coffee or tea making facilities in the room - a first on my travels. The only problem I had was on checking out - I wanted to pay my bar bill by cash, unfortunately the hotels and my figures differed by over $20, the reason was because I'd tipped the barstaff on the night and then after leaving the bar they had included another tip on the overall bill - I asked the receptionist to show me the slips which I signed at the bar, and guess what they couldn't be found ! She then asked me to leave it with them and they would just charge my credit card when it got sorted out - sorted out with me not being there ? I asked to see a manager a resolve the problem before we left, but there was no manager in the building, In the end I paid in cash what I thought I owed and told her to get the manager to phone me if there was a problem. 'If you've enjoyed your stay here, I don't see what your problem is sir - surely it's a small price to pay' is what the receptionist said ? I'm not mean - I just don't like getting ripped off. Overall a brilliant five day stay - spoiled needlessly by not using a little common sense. The Unfortunate outcome was that despite my protests - on returning home the hotel had indeed charged my credit card for the differance. If I had any tips to pass on - I would suggest that you make full use of the subway, it's so easy to get around and saves your feet - and try and book your trips out before arriving, it saves so much time waiting around for tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: NRT
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel in a fantastic location. I found the service is very friendly and welcoming like you would expect at a small hotel. They also include breakfast in the room rate, which I think is pretty rare for NY hotels. It seemed to me they cater European tourists judging by the other guests I saw at breakfast, which could be one reason they include breakfast. The breakfast itself was nothing special (cold buffet with pastries, bagels, etc.), but it was fine for me. The rooms are by no means luxurious, but they are clean and comfortable and seem to have been renovated in the recent past. The room I had was actually pretty spacious by NY standards. You can order room service from the hotel restaurant, which is a nice benefit. Overall, the Park South is a good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: deruo
Reviews.Content: We got reservations here through one of those "name your price" things where you don't know where you'll be until the card is charged. What a pleasant surprise. No, its not a disco masquerading as a hotel (Hotel Empire, are you listening?) , the rooms are on the small side, but the staff were very nice, it was QUIET, the place was clean, I didn't see any bedbugs, free wi-fi, and breakfast was included. Perfect! I'd definitely stay here again. If for no other reason but to check out some of the curry places nearby. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to Flatiron District and the Empire State Building, green subway stop right outside the door, making trips to Soho and downtown easy. Free breakfast every day was fantastic. Our room was typically New York small but had nice boutique style finishes. Service was good, however on our last two nights they seemed to forget about us, with no turn-down service being provided. Not a big deal, but we did notice as they had done this on the first four nights of our stay. Laudromat is also close by, which was handy for avoiding exorbitant hotel laundry service fees. Overall, great value - I don't think we would have found a better hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a find in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: susiegigi
Reviews.Content: Just happened onto this small hotel in lower Manhattan. While a little off the beaten path, this older facility offers a European style continental breakfast each day that kept us satisfied until dinner time! Small but very clean rooms. Definitely would stay there again. Keep your eye out for bargain rates, too!

Reviews.Title: “Update - two stays later, still very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: diane2134
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park South twice since posting my first review in June 2010 - once in room 807 and once in room 705. Both are great rooms (classed as Executive, I believe) that look out on E. 28th Street with a view of the Chrysler Building. I want to add a couple of comments to my original review. First, although the rooms faced the street they were not at all noisy. The double-paned glass shut out almost all street noise. I know this because when we opened one of the windows, we could hear normal NYC horn-honking and so on, but not otherwise. Second, during our most recent stay we ate at the adjacent Black Duck restaurant for the first time and were very happy with it. The Park South had given us vouchers for a free glass of wine on check-in, so the total bill was only about $40/person. The atmosphere and service were excellent and the food (arugula salad, halibut, pompano, a fruit-topped cake dessert) was all good. Finally, I recommend investigating Kalustyan's around the corner from the hotel at 123 Lexington if you're at all interested in exotic foods. The place is a real trip into the past with its endless shelves of spices and its two nice older gentlemen dispensing Near Eastern delicacies like mujadarrah (a lentil dish) in the upper-floor deli. As always, during this recent visit the Park South manager (Christiaan Aldoy), the assistant manager Diana, the regular doorman Chuck and his helper Jesus, and others such as Melvin and Shelley were all very helpful. It was reassuring to see so many of the same staff members who were there during my first visit three or four years ago . . . a good sign. To sum up:- the Park South is still my first choice for a comfortable, reasonably-priced stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Seagull70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business. The standard rooms are pretty small and dark, but they are clean and quiet with no traffic noise – a bonus for a good night's sleep when you are on a business trip. The bar/restaurant area is a welcoming place for the solo traveller and the food is of a high standard. Breakfast is included, and the selection and quality is very good for this price range. The location of the hotel is convenient for the subway, but it can be quite difficult to get a cab at busy times – Park Avenue or Lexington is a better bet, but it may mean dragging your luggage with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanDG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located between Park and Lexington Aves. and is located about a half block from the subway which makes this hotel a great home base. The room size and bathroom are small, but who spends alot of time in a room when you are in NYC. The hotel was every clean and to us that's more important then room size. The closet is very small and 3 draws for storage was a bit tight. The breakfast buffet is nice and a great way to start the day. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. I'm a bargain hunter and if the price is right, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: astleWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: nothing negative to say about hotel at all,great breakfast great staff ,rooms were really clean ,think we had a bargin from what i have seen of other new york hotels ,would go back anytime and reccomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! This is my hotel of choice when going to NY”
Reviews.Author: travelandlove61
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Clean and close to subway. The price was unbeatable. The breakfast was delicious every morning. Staff was super friendly. My second time staying at this hotel. Do not think there is another hotel in NY that can beat the price and the quality at Park South. Definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean quaint and reasonably priced manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: movedsouth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in to the Park South hotel and it is a very nice hotel at a good price. Our room was clean, small, but had a comfortable bed with a small but clean modern bath. It was quiet and located near some nice restaurants. We ate at Coppolas around the corner and they had excellent Italian food. There are many Indian restaurants in the neighborhood. The area was safe to stroll at night. I would defnitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lulu49to
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect because I wanted to be within walking distance of Union Square and the entrance to the No 6 line is at the end of the block. The atmosphere of the hotel is very welcoming, staff are helpful and accommodating and the complimentary breakfast is perfectly adequate - in fact better than I expected (I especially appreciated the real cutlery/crockery and hot milk!) i asked for and received a very quiet room. The room itself is adequate for a short stay - too small for 2 people - and the cupboard space is very limited. Aside from that, the bed was comfortable, the towels plentiful and the shower pressure was good. It is excellent value for money and a nice place to return to each night after the intensity of the city.

Reviews.Title: “NO BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: RuthieRunner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Park South a half dozen times and will continue to return. Great location (1/2 block from subway) within walking distance of many great restaurants even though it has a great bar and restaurant attached and free continental breakfast is satisfying. Very clean rooms and welcoming staff. I would recommend Park South to anyone visiting NYC. Best of all NO BED BUGS! I am returning in 2 weeks and have to say, as a single female I feel very safe at the Park South.

Reviews.Title: “Overall affordability in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtv28
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the value of this place. I did travel for business only so I did not spend a ton of time at the hotel. It was a few blocks from my office. It was mostly very quiet with the exception of a few noisy garbage trucks but that's what you get in the city. I would definitely stay again for cost and convenience. The bed was on the extremely firm side so sleep was not flawless. But that's probably my only complaint and not enough to deter me from staying again. Size of the room was generous for NYC standards. I did get "bumped up" or so they claimed.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: JfromDC4801
Reviews.Content: Roomy, esp. for Manhattan. Well-located in Murray Hill, easy to get around. Very pleasant and well-appointed. The rooms ARE as pictured in the website. Nice breakfast. Friendly staff. Free wifi throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: missmc123
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel a lot for the price. It is a great value with rooms around $135 or so. It is very convenient, a half block from the 6 train and lots of restaurants around. The room is small and basic, but there is good free wifi and a really nice breakfast in the morning. This is the hotel I choose over and over when I have business at NYU dental school.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: regisyoung
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to NYC last weekend for my birthday. He was able to get a great deal on Travelzoo for a room at Park South, but I was unaware that he had called the hotel the day before we left to arrange for a complimentary upgrade. I loved the look of the hotel. It was built in the early 1900's so it had a lot of character and charm. It wasn't your typical chain, which we really liked. The room was large for NYC and had a view of the Chrysler Building. The bathroom was a little small, but that wasn't a problem. Loved the bath products and the room was very clean. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. It was served in the Black Duck Restaurant which was attached to the hotel. Breakfast included croissants, bagels, cheeses and meats, hard-boiled eggs, fruits and some of the best coffee I've ever had. A nice plus was that it was served until 11:00.
