We had a meal in the restaurant on Monday night and it was delicious. I had shrimp cocktail and the most delicious clam chowder and my husband had scallops. Yummy! Saturday night we listened to live jazz and enjoyed some drinks in the restaurant. We spent a lot of time there. Partly because it was so cold while we were in New York, but also because it was such a relaxing place to be. Everyone we came in contact with in the hotel was so nice and professional. The location was perfect. Right around the corner was a French restaurant, Les Halles owned by Anthony Bourdain. I got escargot and I do believe they were the best I've ever had. My husband had the steak, frites, and salad special. I had a bite of the steak and it melted in your mouth. Around the other corner from the hotel was another French restaurant, La Petite Auberge. We were a little disappointed in the food, but the chocolate mousse was to die for! All in all, this short vacation was one of the best ever. A big part of the reason why was because of our hotel. The best compliment to the hotel is that I'm planning a girl's trip to New York in October and I'm already making plans to stay at Park South. The thing about New York is that it is so addictive. As soon as you leave you start planning your next trip. It's the greatest city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant warm friendly hotel in the centre of everything !”
Reviews.Author: berr24
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second trip to the park south hotel in manhatton ! I can not rate this hotel highly enough , it is a small boutique style hotel with the friendliest and most obliging staff I have met. It is excellent value for money centrally located right beside the 6 subway station and within easy walking distance of new Yorks many attractions and shopping areas. The staff are fab so warm and accomadating , I first stayed three years ago and the majority of the staff are still the same which to me speaks volumes for a place , when I return to new York I will definitly be staying in the park south again

Reviews.Title: “We would return to Park South”
Reviews.Author: BuckHorse
Reviews.Content: First the pros: only 1/2 block to #6 subway; smaller hotel than better known chains; location has neighborhood feel; staff accomodating & friendly; very decent contintental breakfast; nice toiletries. The cons: small room & bathroom; not enough light in room & lobby; no robe as listed in amenities (no big deal to us, though); bathroom floor could have been cleaned every day. Comments: Think the room was probably typically NYC hotel size; we usually stay at the larger chain hotels in NYC (Hyatt, Marriott, Hilton) & I think their room sizes are traditionally larger anyway. We liked that it was a smaller boutique type hotel so had a nicer feel than the larger ones we're accustomed to. The 1st night we had a problem with our heater. Called the front desk, & maintenance came in 8 minutes or so and quickly fixed it. We found a couple of nice French restaurants in the neighborhood that we could walk to: Les Halles & La Petite Auberge. During our next stay I think we'll upgrade to an executive room for more space.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly, clean and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: HumanRace
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel tucked away from the madness of holiday crowds but close enough to every touristy place you want to go. The double-bed room was spacious and clean. The breakfast room/dining room has a warm/cozy feeling to it. The breakfast included bagels, pastries, meats and cheeses, fresh fruit and juices, yogurt, boiled eggs, coffee and tea. There was enjoyable live music on Saturday night and a muted James Cagney movie playing on Sunday night. There's a small library/balcony on the second floor and a free business room on the lower level where you can access the internet. There is no concierge desk but all staff are easily and readily available to answer any questions. Staff was very friendly and made the stay memorable. There's a subway station just a few steps down the street. Utilize this to access the city readily and economically. If you take cabs, the fares aren't so bad either; $11 + tip to Time Sq., $35 fare to LGA. We didn't have a chance to walk the surrounding neighborhood since we were there mostly for the holiday sights. It's certainly not a glitzy/ritzy/action-filled part of town, but this is what I appreciated about it. It was like "going home" every night to the room. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: woodstock91
Reviews.Content: The extensive breakfast spread included with the room rate is a real plus. My room was quite comfortable for my needs. I would have liked to have a luggage rack, however, and the coffee maker referred to by other reviews wasn't part of the amenities in my room. I was not bothered by noise from other rooms, at all. The location is excellent. Very easy access to almost all of the rest of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Good location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Travels101
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weekend nights. The room was clean and sufficiently sized but certainly not large - and we were upgraded to the executive king room size. The bathroom is very small but fits one person just fine. The hotel was centrally located to everything we wanted to do - SOHO, Little Italy, Central Park, Museums, NYU, Midtown Manhattan. Easy access to subway. Convenient and reasonably priced parking just across the street. Wonderul jazz music in the bar at night. Breakfast was just OK but free is free. The staff was always very responsive to anything we asked although we did not ask for much.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staying at Park South”
Reviews.Author: Wimmel
Reviews.Content: I came with my 10-year-old daughter from Holland to this hotel. Despite the fact that my travel agent messed up the reservation they set me up in a nice room until everything was sorted out. The staff was extremely friendly, and concerned. The hotel is located in a very nice neighborhood, close to a subway station and every creature comfort one could want. The room itself was good, functioning airconditioning, fast, reliable and free WiFi. I would certainly come back there on my next visit to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jd4795
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in NYC in October is not full of deals, unless you're willing to take a bit of a chance, to play it safe and ensure a nice long weekend, we booked a room at the Park South Hotel. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean, the bed/pillows was very comfortable, and the staff was great in our limited interactions. We were on the side of the building, 6th floor which was very quiet. The location is fantastic. The 6 train is on the corner of Park and 28th to uptown/downtown treks are quick and mid town and the east village are easy walks. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is almost worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: LynnFarmingtonCT
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small hotel in a terrific neighborhood section of NYC (Murray Hill) with the 6 Subway line a block away. Not far from Grand Central and Empire State Building. Rooms are all right. Bathrooms are a little small. The hotel staff is okay, not the friendliest bunch, but they also weren't rude. Though I will admit, a friendly, outgoing staff does make a huge impression! The best part about the stay was the free "continental" breakfast. It was fabulous. In addition to regular continental fare, it included meats and cheese tray and croissants. That was enough for us until dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “loved it loved it loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelinlady23
Reviews.Content: Came to NY with my daughter wanted to see a Yankee game and tour around the city!! We arrived at the hotel around 1030am and we were hoping for an early check in. We dealt with Diana at the front desk- a real sweetheart she told us to go have some breakfast (which was complimentary) and that she would see what she could do for us about an early check in since check in time is really at 3pm. The breakfast was great it had everything from muffins to cold cuts even hard boiled eggs!! The breakfast staff was very friendly and accomodating. After breakfast we went back to see our new friend and she worked her magic within the hour we were able to check into our room and get ready for our city adventure. The room was the superior room with 2 beds. It was a nice size nothing huge but spacious enough for our visit. We were really only going to be sleeping in the room. We planned to be out and about most of the time. We stopped by the desk one more time to get some information which included a map, directions and a bit of convincing that the subway system was not scary or complicated. Our new friend came through once again and along with some laughs she also had excellent restaurant recommendations and the best shopping routes as well. Whenever we walked back into the hotel we were asked how our day was and it was a really nice feeling to know that the staff recognized us and cared. We were very pleased with our experience and loved the staff. Everyone at the front desk was so pleasant. We will definitely go back to this hotel and highly recommend it! If you want to go somewhere where you are not just a room number then this is where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Come on the guestroom isn't that small!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirly1
Reviews.Content: We had requested a king bed thru the ThankYou Network, but the king bed rooms were all booked at our stay when we checked in. A very nice, competent front desk agent Tamara was so helpful by checking us into our queen room early as our plane had arrived early. She even called us on our cell phone while we were out shopping and waiting for the room to let us know it was ready for us! We stayed in a 3rd floor room and it was not a bad size for the 2 nights that we were in NYC. We don't stay in the room that much anyway so cleanliness, hot water pressure, bed comfort, quiet, and working a/c are the most important and Park South had all of that and more! Agreeing with the other Tripadvisor reviews here, we also enjoyed the delicious very extended continental breakfast every morning in the hotel's restaurant The Black Duck. Even the service in there was superb, with constant replenishing of platters of cold cuts, hard boiled eggs,crossiants, danish, bagels, etc. One great waiter brought me deli mustard on request and the next morning brought the mustard to our table without me asking! The doormen were also helpful and when we need directions, they were always giving us advice! We will def be back again!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel with one (and a half) caveats”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: Of the different small mid-priced hotels I've tried in New York, this one worked well for me: quiet block in a convenient location and attractive neighborhood, clean and nicely furnished room, all the crucial amenities (working AC, free wifi, coffeemaker, robe, toiletries), plus an excellent bar-restaurant and (as a bonus) free breakfast. I have two caveats which correspond to earlier reviews. First, the standard rooms (whatever the hotel may call them) are tiny even by NY standards, and if they face an airshaft they may be too claustrophobic even for a single traveler. Count on paying for a bigger room (not really a suite), which in my case was lovely, with upper floor view of the Chrysler Building, a desk, armchairs, etc. The smaller caveat is that some (but not all) of the younger desk and lobby staff could use some professional training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that needs a new manager”
Reviews.Author: MikeLentini
Reviews.Content: We reserved a King Superior room for 3 nights. When we checked in at 2pm, they said the King room we reserved was not available, and to come back in 1 hour. At 3pm, they said all they have is a queen std. This room was soooo tiny, the size of my bedroom closet back home. Ok for s single, but way too small for 2 people. 3 other couples we were traveling with checked in later that day and all had issues with their rooms, A/C not working, room too small, etc. After 24 hours of complaining, the manager finally was told by the bellhop to put us in a better room. At least the bellhop understands customer service. The manager didn't seem to care. They moved us to a King suite. If I ever stay here again, I would only book that type of room. Location was great, and they have a real nice bar area with a Jazz band. I left my laptop power cord in my room when I checked out and after 3 phone calls, I finally gave up trying to get it back. They refused to send someone down to the room to look for it. They referred me back to the manager. like that was going to help..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: kitspence
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Park South when the hotel we originally booked wasn't available. Great location near the #6 subway. Friendly staff. Room was ready when we arrived. Free Internet. Good breakfast. Clean and quiet. Rooms are not huge, but certainly adequate. Had a fridge in the room. They checked our bags for free for the day when we checked out. Overall great value.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AmericanCareerExpat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because my family lives in Gramercy Park, a couple of blocks away. I found the rooms to be too small for my daughter and me to be comfortable. I was in transit, from home abroad to summer home on the West Coast of the US and there wasn't enough room for the luggage in a Superior room. The staff was as helpful as they could be and the breakfast was above average, but we'll have to find another accommodation for the future. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “good breakfast and fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmore81
Reviews.Content: the rooms were comfortable and true to ny standards, tiny... but the hotel makes up for it, with its free business center (handy for booking concert tickets etc) and great breakfast! the location is fantastic! and on friday evening you can have a cocktail on the terrace with live jazz! again, loved the location. can walk to madison sq. and next to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAW
Reviews.Content: We took public transportation from LaGuardia to this hotel. There is a train stop very close to the hotel. The hotel is in a good location in Midtown with lots of Indian and Middle Eastern restaurants nearby. We took the train everywhere and it was a short ride to all the tourist spots so it was a very central location. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast that's included every morning is the of the best we've had with lots of variety. The bowl of Hershey chocolates at the desk everyday was a nice welcome back at the end of the day. The rooms are VERY small. The pictures make the room appear bigger than reality. The bathroom is tiny. We had 4 people in a room with 2 queen beds and there was very little walking room after the space is taken up by 4 suitcases. The rooms are updated and clean and the beds are very comfy. Don't plan to spend much time in your room! It's a good value for Manhattan, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location; friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: diane2134
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park South four times over the past two years, both with a traveling companion and alone. The rooms I've stayed in are 301, 521, 621, and a handicapped room looking out on 27th Street on a low floor, which we were upgraded to when the hotel wasn't full. The Park South is my first choice of hotel in New York City for the following reasons. 1. Value. I've always paid between $200 and $250 for a double-bedded room, a little less over Christmas. This is about the best you can do for a good hotel in New York City. There is a free breakfast, which is excellent (and very unusual in the city) that includes good cold cuts, bread, bagels, fruit, hardboiled eggs, juice, and coffee. There is also free Internet. 2. Location. It's half a block from the 6 (Lexington/Park Avenue) subway line, which isn't the best line, perhaps, but it's good for visiting the Metropolitan Museum of Art and you can transfer at Grand Central-42nd Street to virtually all the other subway lines in the city. There are also MANY good restaurants within a block or two, including La Petite Auberge, an old-line French restaurant, and Dhaba, an Indian restaurant, both just around the corner at 116 and 108 Lexington Avenue respectively. There's a wine store across from those restaurants and another one on Madison and 28th Street. From some of the higher-floor hotel rooms on 28th Street there is even a view of the Chrysler Building. To the west, Madison Square Park with its greenery is very close at Madison and 26th. Taxis are very easy to get in this area (Flatiron or Murray Hill) as well. 3. Ambience. This is a smaller hotel with only eight floors and the service feels personalized. During my own stays I found an assistant manager named Diana to be especially helpful. The regular doorman (from the islands) is also great. The free breakfast is served in the hotel's charming Black Duck restaurant, which is on the ground floor and has large floor-to-ceiling windows open to 28th Street. It's nice to sit outside to have breakfast on warm mornings and equally nice to sit inside by the fireplace in chillier seasons. 4. Comfort. I've always found the beds to be extremely comfortable and have never been troubled by noise except in room 301, which is next to the elevator. In my experience, the rooms have always been kept very clean and the heating and cooling has been effective. (The windows open a few inches, which isn't always the case in the city, and it helps.) In the winter when the hotel wasn't full, we were even able to get a coffee-maker and a DVD player put in our room. There is a loft-like space above the lobby area that functions as a reading room and DVD lending library. That said, there are a few drawbacks that may bother some people and may account for the relatively low price of this hotel: 1. Many of the rooms are quite small and the ones around the central courtyard are also rather dark because they look out on other rooms in the hotel and don't have an open view. There is a lot of variation in room size even among rooms of the same price class, for example "Executive." I would recommend asking to see alternate rooms if you are dissatisfied. It makes a big difference in comfort, for example, if you have adequate counter space in the bathroom to lay out your toiletries, and if you have adequate closet space to hang up your things. In general, the closets I have seen at the Park South have been quite small and most of the time you have to hang your clothes facing you rather than hanging at right angles to you as in a normal residential closet. 2. Also, the refrigerators in the rooms aren't really refrigerators. As the hotel's resident "engineer' (a charming man from Montenegro) sheepishly admitted to me when I summoned him to my room, the condensers on the refrigerators have been disabled so the units are glorified iceboxes at best. The staff will deliver ice to your room, but the ice bucket is too large for the refrigerator door to close, so it sort of defeats the purpose. 3. The entry to the hotel is a bit of a challenge because people checking in have to navigate themselves and their luggage down three or four stairs to the lobby level and desk. I understand from the manager that a doorman is supposed to help with suitcases, and there is a mechanical lift, but in my experience sometimes the entry isn't manned. Not a serious problem, but I thought it should be mentioned. All in all, I think this is a wonderful hotel offering great value and a personable, helpful staff and I hope that it stays that way forever!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowDavyMac
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC, did not know what to expect but can honestly say we were delighted with this hotel. We arrived at 12 noon but they had two rooms ready for the four of us. Staff at reception, the bar/dining room, concierge could not have been more friendly or helpful. The rooms are not huge but, its NYC, your only in to shower and sleep, why do you need huge rooms? Spotlessley clean, air conditioned. The hotel is moderate size so we felt there was that personal touch from staff sometimes lacking in the larger chain hotels. Location was great, subway 50 yards along 28th Street (Line 6), midtown, handy for both uptown and downtown, 15 mins walk to Times Sq, 5 mins to Empire State building. Hotel also includes breakfast in the cost which is extremely rare in NYC. Again, no complaints, buffet style, plenty on offer. If we go back to NYC, and we surely will, then i will have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pavel S
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to NY and I'm so glad I chose Park South to stay at. It's right in the middle of Manhattan and you get everywhere you want in just few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Never let's me down”
Reviews.Author: Silvercj
Reviews.Content: 3rd time I stayed here - and I will come back. The location is unbeatable (28th between Park Ave and Lexington - within 10 min walking distance to Empire State). Away from Times Square where it can get hectic and with recent closures, a bit complicated. The subway is 1/2 block away and the 6 line takes you up to Bloomngdales and Guggenheim and south into Union Square, Little Italy and Chinatown. The room size is ok for NYC standards, as rooms are in general tiny in this town. My room faced the courtyard - not really nice to look at. Nice surprise: recently they offer free wireless! The bathroom was impeccably clean and the bed was good to sleep in. The comfort is really nice for the price. If you get a room around 200-250$ (which is low for a medium standard in NYC), you are doing well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. What's great is that breakfast is included for all guests. Love the bagels. If there is a group, then you might run into problems getting a table in the morning, but usually the wait is very short. I usually recommend this hotel to friends. BTW - Anthony Bourdain's "Les Halles" restaurant is around the corner on Park Ave.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the really ugly”
Reviews.Author: Live-only-once
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that we travel a lot and my expectations are pretty realistic. If you are picky about your Hotels then this is not a good choice, specially for stays over a couple of days. We paid about $200/night during spring break. Hotel location was good in terms of underground and walking access to places of interest such as Times square, Soho, etc..however, the front view of the Hotel is a parking lot and the street is not that great. It's not a nice clean quiet street by any means. The standard rooms are VERY small with a alley/ wall view. The executive rooms are definitely larger but not huge. The largest and most expensive rooms face either the front street or the back. Both very noisy with traffic, trucks, garbage pick up, etc. The noise is buffered by a very loud air conditioning/heating unit when it works. We happen to be in New York during a hot spill and we suffered through 5 sleepless nights before the unit was fixed for our last two nights. The beds were not comfortable for me. I'm not sure why? Just not very comfortable so I woke up with back achs. The bathrooms are very small and our toilet over flooded twice..yucks. The breakfast was continental. Okay but not extra ordinary. We never ate at the hotel restaurant so can't comment. Nice Indian food around the hotel area, both fast food and sit down dinning. The desk people were simply okay. Not extreamly helpfull and nice and not really unfriendly. Just there. I'm not sure why I was set on this hotel. The website is somewhat deceiving. I guess I wanted the small intimate hotel experience but on 2nd thought I would have been better off with the Sheraton NY at a better price. I know I would have at least eliminated the noise and bed discomfort, and yes, the toilet mess. Having said all that, we didn't let the many negatives upset us. We enjoyed our stay in New York enormously and laughed off our choice of Hotel. The toilet business was pushing it a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy and Will Return”
Reviews.Author: travelmh
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel 2 hours before check-in with our two children ages 6 and 8. The staff was extremely helpful, and had a room ready for us to check in. There is a very reasonable parking lot directly across the street for $19/day for 24 hours. The rooms are small, but VERY clean, modern, and comfortable....and no one should go to NY with the intent of staying in their room. Modern updated bathrooms, clean linens, comfortable beds, free WIFI. The continental breakfast was great with plenty of choices for the kids, great coffee. We checked out on Sunday, and they held our bags for us until we were ready to leave later that afternoon. Only 1 block from the 6 train and very convenient to the West Side (where we wanted to stay). I will be coming back to this hotel the next time we travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Discovery”
Reviews.Author: snowpeas
Reviews.Content: Because our first choice of hotels was booked, and finding a comparable hotel was becoming a problem, we reserved rooms at Park South Hotel. It advertised a high rating with a reasonable price. We were pleased with our visit. On weekend evenings, jazz ensembles performed in the restaurant/bar. The music was excellent, the seating was intimate, and the performance was free. No ordered drinks were required, although those served were delicious. The musicians were approachable and personable. Instead of venturing back out after a day in the city, it was a delightful treat to sit back and relax in a room that opened up to the street. Unlike many hotels that remove their continental breakfast by 9:00 or 10:00, Park South offered a complimentary breakfast until 11:00. The food was fine, and we especially enjoyed sitting at one of the tables on the small patio outside to watch the people passing by. A small balcony, which extended over the lobby, provided an interesting assortment of hardback books to borrow or peruse. The desk staff was remarkably helpful, friendly, and witty. They recommended restaurants within walking distance of the hotel; they provided requested information about other nearby places as well. Our room, however, was elongated and cramped, with poor lighting that cast shadows even in daylight. A room without a view, tall brick walls outside the window blocked the sun. The closet was too small to accommodate a suitcase, and no luggage stand was available. No television listing was provided. But those were our only complaints. We would definitely stay at Park South Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great priced hpotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: bonhoff37
Reviews.Content: having spent and absolute age trying to find decent priced accomadation in midtown manhattan we finally came across the park south hotel , 128th & park. we have just returned from our first trip to this great city and it was A+ all the way with this hotel. -great location -friendly staff -nice decnt breakfast -decent price the room we had was a queen room and was fit for 2 , snugly. but we werent here to stay in our rooms, but instead we were here to roam the city by day and night and this great hotel met all our needs. i would give this hotel a 5 outta 5 and made this holiday for us, although the beautifull weather helped! if you read a bad review of this hotel it says more about the reviewer than the hotel in my honest opinion. when we come back next year we will be staying here . thats the best compliment i can give the place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, classy”
Reviews.Author: MattG78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for us. Everything was very clean. Bed was a hair on the firm side, but would rather it be too firm than too soft or sagging. Pillows were so good we are going to order a couple! Staff was very helpful with questions and allowed us to check-in a couple hours early. The breakfast was definitely better than the average continental fare. There is a subway station steps from the entrance. I highly recommend this hotel as it's just the right balance of value and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: DasHans
Reviews.Content: Prefect hotel in central Manhattan, NY. Including lovely breakfast a lively atmosphere and walking distance into NY. I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised!”
Reviews.Author: ByScott
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Much more than I would have expected for the great rate we got! From arrivial to departure the service and attention was terrific. Upgraded at check in,great parking and dining advice. All was above expectations. Our upgraded room (king) was very large and spotless. The bathroom was also spacious and very clean...trust me I always look for dirt in the bathroom...I can honestly say no signs of dirt anywhere! I really loved the coziness of the hotel and would come back to stay again with my daughter. Also really loved that it is in more of a neighborhood.... not as "touristy" as Time Square. Easy to walk just about anywhere...although it was 8 degrees when we stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value - Very positive stay”
Reviews.Author: Leesburg_VAWilson
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel. Everything is on a small scale but clean and attractive and the location is fantastic. The sheets are soft, the beds comfortable, rooms are quiet, and the bathroom in our room was small but modern. The hairdryer is located in a little bag that hangs on the back of the bathroom door along with a bathrobe. The front desk staff and bellman are friendly and welcoming. The hotel offers a voucher for an indoor parking garage down the street, which was a terrific value for our one night stay. The surrounding area is nice and we felt quite comfortable walking around. Breakfast is nothing fancy but has a nice selection - hard boiled eggs, a range of pastries and cereals, bagels, yogurt, apples, organes, bananas, juices/coffee/tea, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Carmenlilly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park South Hotel for a week. After having stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hotel with huuuuge rooms at my last new York trip to NY, I was a little shocked about the room size of the Superior Room of the park South Hotel, but tiny rooms seem to be standard in New York. We had booked the Superior Room which seems to be the standard room. It had a queen bed and was big enough for the 2 of us and 2 big suitcases, even though there was not much or hardly any space left on the two sides of the bed then. The bed was comfy, not too soft luckily and big enough for two (standrad queen size). There were enough pillows and blankets. What bothered me most was the light in the room - it was far too dark. It had two bedside lamps - not very bright, a desk lamp and a lamp on the ceiling at the room entrance. there was no ceiling-lamp in the main room. The light was too dark for reading and made the room appear even narrower. We helped ourselves by turning the desk-lamp upside to the mirror so that there would be more light. The bathroom was bg enough with sanitaries such as shower gel, soap, etc. They didn't have a shower cap but I asked for one at the reception and got one immediately. Additonally there's a blow-dryer and a bathrobe and of course fresh towls. The light in the bathroom is a little too dark for putting on make-up, but well. The room also had a flat-screen TV and a fridge - not a minibar !!! The room was on the backside with view on a wall, but since we were on the 6th floor there was still enough light during daytime. The "closet" including the safe is in-built in the wall and very small! Walls are very thin too. The absolute positive thing about the Park South Hotel is that breakfest and wireless internet is included in the room-rate. Breakfest is available daily until 11.00am at the hotel-own restaurant "The Black Duck". The Breakfest buffet includes ham, turkey-breast, salami, several kinds of chees, bagles and other bread, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, juices, etc. We also had dinner at the Black Duck once. Food was excellent. The one waitress (who was luckily not assigned to our table) seemed totally uninterested in working though and wandered around with crossed arms and not one friendly smile. Pricing was ok for a "better" restaurant. The menu - including salad or soup of the day, a choice of 3 main dishes and a dessert cost 35 USD p.p. (not including drinks). There's also a gym and a business center at the hotel. The staff at the Park South Hotel was generally very friendly and helpful. Free newspapers were delivered to the room daily. The best about the hotel is the location. It's next to the subway station "28th street" of the 6 train. It's 6 blocks from 34th street where the Empire State Building, Macy's and plenty of other stores are located. It's 2 subway stations from Grand Central Station / 5th Ave. where you can also take the "S" shuttle to Times Square (or walk). It's also just 4 subway stations from Soho (Bleeker Street). Nearby to the hotel is a Duane Reade where you can get everything from drinks, snacks, magazines, sanitaries, drugs, etc. There is also a Starbucks just one block away, a McDonalds right at the subway station, a pizza place called California Pizza Kitchen 5mins away, etc. Generally I would recommened staying at the Park South Hotel and I would stay there again as an alternative to the Grand Hyatt (eventhough not comparable). Room rates are quite high, but that's the same for all hotels in that class and Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful except the size of the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kls118
Reviews.Content: If you are by yourself or staying with just one other person, this hotel is a great choice. My husband and I both said that we would absolutely stay here again..... as long as we were by ourselves. We stayed here for 2 nights over Thanksgiving with our 1 year old and 2 year old and the room was WAY too small for the 4 of us. The room we stayed in (611) was not much bigger than the Queen size bed that was in it. However, room size aside, the hotel was great. It is located very close to the Subway on the 6 line. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby was nicely decorated with leather couches and fresh flowers and the attached restaraunt is very nice. They served a great breakfast with croissants, bagels, juice, yogurt, fruit, etc. And for the price, it was FABULOUS! We found a deal on the internet where we only paid $139/night. However, NYC kills you on taxes: $12.34/night State tax with $8.17/night city tax and a $3.50/night Occupancy tax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: arblueyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with 2 double beds. The rooms were quite small but there were just 2 of us, so our luggage fit. We had an interior room so our window faced a brick wall but it was very quiet. The beds were pretty comfortable but had great pillows. We were happy with the cleanliness of the room. The outside of the hotel is very cute with twinkle lights & small shrubs around the entrance of the lounge. The staff was very friendly - there was always a doorman to open the door for us. :) The continental breakfast was excellent: pastries, muffins, cheeses & meats, hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, english muffins, juices, coffee, all served in the spacious Lounge. Our first night we had a drink in the Lounge & while it was pretty expensive, the atmosphere was lovely as we sat on a couch next to the fireplace. The location of the hotel was fabulous! The subway was only a half block away & very safe to walk around in. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Park South is fine.”
Reviews.Author: Boss57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park south for 6 nights from Nov 6 2009. The hotel was absolutely fine for what we wanted. The room and entire hotel was clean and the service was good. In an ideal world, I would have liked the room to have been a bit larger and to have paid a bit less. However, the bottom line is that the Park South delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would stay here again - but only at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Park South Hotel for 3 nights in March 2009. I booked this hotel after searching hours for a hotel room that was reasonably priced and didn't look like a college dorm room - you wouldn't believe how many of those are in New York! I chose the Queen Superior room - the website I booked the hotel on had an offer on this type of room for €380 for 3 nights, in hindsight had it been full whack I may have continued my search. I can't say I was disappointed with the hotel, the room was lovely, very clean with a comfortable double bed and nicely decorated. It's small but I was travelling alone so I had plenty of room, had I been with my partner it may have been a little cramped - and this room was supposed to be bigger than the Standard so God only knows how small those rooms were! The location was absolutely fine - it wasn't too far from Gramercy or Chelsea, and the hotel was right beside a subway which is great when you are lugging back a ton of bags from Macys to your hotel room. The breakfast was lovely, with a selection of eggs, cold meats, toast, cereals, juices and pastries to choose from and 2 free newspapers delivered to my room each morning was a plus. My room did not face out onto the street so I didn't have a problem with the noise, and slept soundly every night. Contrary to other reviews, I felt it was a very quiet hotel! I also found the staff to be really friendly, and helpful with directions too. I did have a couple of minor problems. Upon arrival I discovered that I didn't have a mini bar, just a fridge - after well over an hour in a shuttle bus I was desperate for a bottle of water - and the bar wasn't open until the evening, so I had to go and buy a few bottles in a nearby mart. It wasn't a big deal but it was an grievance at the time as I wasn't feeling well on arrival. The fridge then froze the water in the bottles. Another issue that bothered me with the hotel is that they don't book shuttles for you, they recommend a particular service and supply you with a phone number but as I had been used to this being done for me in other hotels it was slightly annoying. And unless you are flush, don't order room service. A fish cake with a glass of wine set me back $30! But these were only minor complaints, it was a nice hotel and one I would recommend to travellers. if I got the right price again I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but I'll try something else next time”
Reviews.Author: NestExit
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with husband and two teenage daughters. On the plus side: really good proximity to Village, Union Square, lower Fifth Ave shopping, Upper East Side for museums, and great to be half a block from subway station and Duane Reade. The breakfast was just fine. Really liked the Indian restaurant one door east of hotel. Did not eat at Black Duck. On the minus side: room on second floor facing street was large but very noisy from traffic and pedestrians. Buy ear plugs if you get this room! (They helped a lot.) No coffee maker in our room. A bit more dingy overall (hallways and lobby) than I had expected; sheets not too high grade, mattress okay, pillows very good. Not enough washcloths for the four of us in the room! Not sure if I'd stay here again--though if I got a very good rate I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and explore”
Reviews.Author: tungsak
Reviews.Content: Good size room, bigger than average hotel room in NYC but don't expect suburb suite big kind of room. It's adequate for two people to feel comfortable enough with private bathroom and very very clean which is crucial. The most important thing is location, smack right in front of subway, within walking distance to almost anything, plenty of good restaurants if you don't care for the Black Duck next door adjacent to hotel lobby, theater three blocks away(Loew 15 Kips Bay), shopping area is five blocks down on broadway or six blocks west on 34. I like to spend my evening in Madison Square at Shake Shack. If you're not planning to spend your time in NYC sleeping in hotel room, I highly recommend Parksouth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: irishchic26
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient location, very good restaurant, rooms clean but small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: GeezerTourGangGuide
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Park South Sept 14-17, 2009. Checked out hotels on line and found this to be best fit for us. Great location, very accomodating staff. Booked Superior Queen and although smaller room than normally would have on vacation to southern resort on par with NYC rooms. Very clean, very comfortable bed, all amenities you would want in hotel room. Breakfast was much better than a continental breakfast and plenty of options. Ate dinner at Black Duck and was pleasantly surprised with how good the food and service was, wine was a bargain price compared to other NYC restaurants. Front desk staff very helpful. Last day checked out and stored our bags with the concierge came back retrieved and were on our way home. Subway very close by and that is the only way to get in and out of Manhattan, otherwise you pay an arm and a leg to take a taxi and I am sure you are no faster than subway. Would highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay there on another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: rlromero
Reviews.Content: We just got back from NYC and we stayed at the Park South for 3 nights. The room was very clean, the bedding was comfortable and good quality and you get a free breakfast every morning. The breakfast was good that included pastries, bagels, bread, fresh fruit, cereals, etc. It was always great to start the day with a light breakfast. The check in was good and prompt. I would recommend though to pack some bottled water and soft drinks as when we went to the nearby store (some pharmacy) it was not too cheap. I also went to restaraunt.com and found that you could purchase $25 gift certificates for their restaurant "Black Duck" at a fraction of the price...look for promotions. The black duck was my favorite hangout at the end of each day. They would have their fire place on each night and I would sit in their comfy chair with my feet up on the ottoman drinking a glass of wine. It was superb to be able to prop your tired feet up at the end of the day!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. This isnt a 5 star hotel, but a quaint small hotel in a good location. It was easy to get to Manhattan as the subway is literally on the street corner.

Reviews.Title: “Beware,Is this hotel going broke ?”
Reviews.Author: Ivanhoes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and comfortable, but thestandard rooms are on the small side. However, I amended my booking to arrive earlier than planned, sent 3 emails well prior to the cancellation period stipulated to confirm that my original booking had been cancelled, phoned to confirm same, and yet then they charged me a no show fee !!! Now they are refusing to refund the no show fee, saying they have no record of a cancellation despite my providing evidence of a reply from them to one of my emails requesting confirmation of the cancellation !!! Dealing with Park South over this matter is akin to dealing with a bureaucracy in 1950's Soviet Russia, they either do not reply tp phone calls/emails or give the most inane reasons for their actions. My experience with entities that are reluctant to refund legitimate monies claimed is that they are probably about to go broke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan1954
Reviews.Content: We had a Superior Queen room, which was a good size. Free internet. Wonderful breakfast is included and served until 11am. The Black Duck Restaurant is attached to the hotel....great for sitting outside and people-watching. You can catch the subway on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price/quality ratio + great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Balderk
Reviews.Content: Nice convenient location for exploration. A N/S bound metro was nearby, and we often walked to an fro. Especially the walk sout through Gramercy to The Village is very nice. It was also very quiet for NYC. Our deluxe room was fairly big for NYC and the bathroom had a lowrise tub. Plenty of space for luggage without making an obstacle course og ones room. It also has a good and plentiful breakfast in the attached restaurant. All in all a great place to retreat end reload. And it actually resembles the photos :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, happy with this find”
Reviews.Author: geanii
Reviews.Content: OK, so they are not joking when they saw rooms are small dont take to much luggage with you, it may not all fit, but the location was great, close to Empire State Building. Room and bathroom was clean and breakfast was great, very abundant and open till 11am so if you happen to sleep in there you may still get some. Internet was free, and quite fast. We got a great deal on expedia and was not expecting anything flash, but we were more than happy especially since most of the time your out exploring the City. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for My Needs”
Reviews.Author: stephallen28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park South a couple times now for business and all and all I like it. The location, for my needs, is perfect. I also like the fact that it's a smaller boutique hotel, the WiFi always works and the staff is really friendly. They have a great bar/bistro with a good wine selection and some some comfy chairs and tables that are open air to the street, weather permitting. In the morning a European breakfast buffet (included) is set up in the bar/bistro area and this is another thing I like. After traveling, the last thing I want to do is stop at another place - even for a coffee. I can just go downstairs, have an enjoyable breakfast and read the paper or watch the news before heading off to my meetings. I received a complimentary upgrade this time which was terrific. However, I will say I noticed my room had some wear and tear on it - a chair really needed to be reupholstered and there were some mold spots on the bathroom ceiling. Other than that though, it was very clean and charming and the bed was extremely comfortable. I would definitely stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, for the price”
Reviews.Author: sammidford
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, small room, but clean and comfortable. Not in the smartest part of town, but it was pretty handy for public transport links (about 100 meters to the nearest subway). It wasn't too far to walk to Chelsea/Soho Lots of resturants/cafes/diners nearby. Decent breakfast. Staff were pretty friendly. For the room rate it wasn't bad. Rooms in NYC seem quite expensive/small. I consider the Park South to be reasonable value for money. I think I would book elsewhere next time, just to be in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “A lot fo room (for improvement)”
Reviews.Author: ALIEN-EYE
Reviews.Content: First of all: what they called "superior" rooms all face a brown brick wall. There is no view unless you get upgraded, which may or may not happen. The rooms are seedy, smelly, small and rather unconfortable. The TV set has bad signal. The location is OK. Nothing interesting around it, but close to other, more interesting areas. The people at reception might be friendly or not, depending on how they got up that morning. Same with butlers. There is a business center in the basement (3 old computers with Internet) but to get in you need to ask somebody to come down with you. If can get something else for the same money, I wouldn't recommend this Park South until they get a major overhaul both in infrastructure and staff attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: McHighTower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest that we could find, were we didnt have to share a bathroom. Our room was tiny, just enough space to put our luggage. The bathroom was ok, a small bath with shower and it was clean (just as the entire room). Breakfast was very simple, but it was ok, i didn't expect much of it. The receptie was kind and quick. The location was great! We walked to Times Square everyday in 30min - a great walk! The only thing that bothered me was that house keeping kept coming earlier, at some point the showed up before 9, we didnt even leave our bed yet! But this was easily helped with putting up the 'do not disturb' sign. Overall, it was a small room, average hotel, but great location!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: traveling_sister
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price which was around $200 with fees and taxes. We supposedly had a "superior Queen" room, but I think superior = regular. The room was tiny, but after reading the reviews I expected that and it is NYC after all. What I liked alot about this hotel was that it must have been newly renovated so everything was clean and fresh. The quality of the room fixtures and bedding was excellent, and it was very tastefully decorated. We probably saved $200 a night be accepting a smaller lobby and room. Otherwise, it was top shelf. The Black Duck next door, which you access through the lobby, is great for a meeting place before going out, having a nightcap and they have a terrific free breakfast there. The coffee's great and the pasteries are fresh. If we were to stay there again, and we probably will, I will ask for a room in the front or on the right side of the building so we don't look out at a brick wall. Even if it costs a little more, the rates are still reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting lower manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CTDave75
Reviews.Content: The Park South is situated at 28th and Park, an easy walk to Greenwich Village. My wife, teenage daughter and I shared a Superior double room. The room was on the smaller side, but the beds were comfortable and the room was clean and quiet. The showerhead produced a deluge of hot water. We parked the car a couple blocks away on 26th and 2nd, and walked or cabbed our way around the city. We had a very good late dinner at Craftbar and had a pleasant walk back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location, but rooms are quite small”
Reviews.Author: bogobogo
Reviews.Content: I realize it's NYC but we had a room with 2 doubles and there was just enough room to maneuver around the beds. No place to put your bags or luggage out of the way. You'll probably get more space with a one queen or king. The closet is half the height of a normal closet, just tall enough for dress shirts. And no shelf space to put your toilettries in the bathroom. Otherwise, the hotel is decently priced, very clean and in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “New York Gem”
Reviews.Author: GeordieNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 5 nights from 25th March. Got a rate which included breakfast of $120 per night plus tax, from Expedia. First impressions were good, nice front of hotel, friendly and quick check in and clean public areas. The room (320) was long and narrow, decent sized bathroom with good toiletries and plenty of clean towels. No view (so what, we were there to look around the city and not stare out of a window all day), the carpets were clean, but the ceiling had some water staining near the window, but for the price we paid we were still well satisfied. Beds were comfortable with nice clean sheets and 4 soft pillows. Breakfast was continental with a selection of 4 or 5 meats and various sliced cheeses, plus a selection of pastries, bread and also bagels. Try the deli next door for excellent bagels and sandwiches if you fancy a change. Overall we were very pleased and would definitely return as the location is excellent, with the subway just 50 metres away at the end of the street. We used the free internet access on a few occasions, so it was a welcome extra. There is a small gym/ work-out room but we did not use it. Contrary to some other reviews, all of the staff in the hotel were excellent, friendly went out of their way to help. All in all, a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Steph35YorkPA
Reviews.Content: I was in town to see a play and was swayed by other reviewers that this was a nice hotel. We had a double room which was really quite spacious for NYC and a flat screen TV. The hotel gave off a clean feel. We arrived at the hotel around 2:30 am and the gentleman at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful in making sure we had everything we needed. It was the perfect place to lay our heads for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort and cleanliness at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a very last minute weekend getaway to NYC and was pleasantly surprised with my choice. The location on 28th street between Park and Lexington Ave was nice. There is a subway station right on the corner of 28th and Park Ave serviced by the 6 train, which made getting around a breeze. The hotel itself was exceptionally clean. The rooms of course were a little on the small side, but that is to be expected in a major city. They were still comfortable enough and spacious enough for two people though. A nice perk was the complimentary breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, which is Zagat rated.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for great location!”
Reviews.Author: Matsubokkuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park South Hotel for 3 nights at the end of June 2008 for a short stay in New York. I was given a superior queen, room 701. I was very pleased with the room. The bed was extremely comfortable and I had excellent sleep throughout my stay. The bathroom was clean and the towels fluffy and lovely. I found it a luxury to have a bathtub and the bathrobes were a nice touch. There was a safe in the room (built into the wardrobe) which I used a few times. I am not sure how secure it was but it seemed robust enough. At least I trusted it. A highlight of the hotel was the free internet access, which was invaluable to me as a way of contacting my family. Yes, the rooms are fairly small but given that this is New York, I think it was reasonable and I did not feel cramped at all. (admittedly, I was alone in this trip but I think even with a partner, it would not have been a problem, provided that one doesn't have loads of big suitcases) I especially liked the little touches in this hotel, the chocolates on my pillow each night, the really good bath products (Baronessa Cali goods that smell gorgeous) and the free newspaper delivered to my door each morning. Breakfast was tasty and there was a big selection of various food. Even fresh fruit was available (which I was craving after so many heavy meals during my stay!). All in all, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It's location is fantastic (within walking distance to the Empire State building and only steps away from the subway)! Also, I'd like to add that although I was a female travelling on my own, I never felt unsafe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Tangent11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of our honeymoon as it was the most reasonable price we could find in Manhattan for a hotel. We paid $209 for the night and booked via Quickbook. All the usual amenities were included, there were even robes provided. They had some really nice toilitries too. There was a safe provided in the room. Room was very small but what we expected for a central Manhattan hotel. Breakfast was a good choice, continential style, and included in the price. Would stay here again unless I found a better deal elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, Park South delivers”
Reviews.Author: fxavier
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Park South four or five weekends, and the hotel has never failed to deliver a clean, good room, good service, and a great atmosphere for a very reasonable New York price. Our most recent trip was just a quick overnight, but check-in was quick and easy. The hotel gave us a complimentary room upgrade and the room was fine. The international atmosphere provided by guests from all over the world simply adds to the ambiance. The Park South is a real find in a city with exorbitant hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel that is also affordable”
Reviews.Author: kouklina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park South Hotel for a friend's hen weekend in NY (Easter 2008). We had had a hard time finding a hotel over the Easter weekend, and were relieved to find a three-bed room that was not expensive. We thought the affordable price would mean we would get less quality in the hotel's services, but we felt really lucky once we got to the hotel and realised it exceeded our expectations. It was clean and its beds were very comfortable. Our window overlooked the backyard, so it offered no view and the room was indeed small. There was barely room to open the suitcases of all three of us, so we had to take turns to open them and get our clothes. We were pleased that we opted for a bigger room instead of the even smaller cheaper ones (I can't even imagine how small they would be). The staff were very helpful and always answered our questions with a smile (on the night of our arrival, we asked them for a cup of camomile tea (no kettle in the room) for one of us that wasn't feeling very well and they brought it to our room in a few minutes. Breafast was a treat. We could fill ourselves up before starting a heavy day of sightseeing around NY, the buns and bagels were amazing, and the coffee was really good! The sitting area where breakfast is served is really pleasant, it is used as a restaurant in the evening. One evening, we were feeling really tired after all the day's walking and we decided to have dinner there. We were not at all disappointed! The food was beyond what we had expected and the nice atmosphere with the jazz music playing in the background was very relaxing... Overall, we were very pleased with Park South Hotel and it will be in our options

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room and staff didn't care”
Reviews.Author: katiekates
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on priceline. It was listed everywhere for about $400, we did the name your price bid and got a room for $199. Unfortunately we felt like they gave us the worst room in the hotel. It was on the first floor located between the women's restroom (used by the restaurant and bar patrons) and the staff entrance to the kitchen) and it smelled like body odor and there were several hairs in the bed. Until about 2am we heard the bathroom toilets flushing, women talking in the bathroom, and heels clicking on the tile floor. We called the front desk and asked to switch rooms and they said they were full there was nothing they could do. The noise finally stopped around 2:15am when the bar and restaurant cleared out and no one was using the bathroom next to our room. Then at 6am the kitchen noise started. People were bringing trays of glasses on dollies into the back entrance of the kitchen that were clinking. Staff were taking breaks outside of the kitchen and talking right outside our room. So we slept from about 2:15am until 6am. When we mentioned this to staff upon check out, we were told they would "look into it" but wouldn't do anything else. We had a horrible experience there and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Number12Stunna
Reviews.Content: My wife's parents flew in from Japan for a week. The last weekend, we booked a room here. We asked specifically for double beds. We called to confirm the week prior. They did not have the request down but assured us it wouldn't be a problem. We called the Friday before the weekend to confirm again. They again didn't have the request and therefore the room wasn't ready. Again they assured us they would have a double bed room available. Saturday night came, we had a full day in NYC, and of course, when we showed up, they didn't have a double bed room as requested. We saw the trainwreck coming but it was too far along to try to find another hotel. What's worse, the management took the tone of "Oh well" and didn't even reduce the rate or try to compensate us for our inconvenience. My wife's parents are comfortable in separate beds, didn't get them, and had to fly out to Tokyo the next day. Thanks, Park South. Epic fail and a loss of a potential customer.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in the busy city!”
Reviews.Author: jred27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business over a five day period and I was very comfortable. Although continental, the breakfasts are excellent. The hotel clearly caters to Europeans and other foreigners, and the service is excellent. I had the most amazing chicken dish at the hotel restaurant, which by the way, is worth every cent! I look forward to staying here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Compact!”
Reviews.Author: Carpe-Dium
Reviews.Content: Small but busy hotel. On one of the higher floors. Not much or a view from the window, but for the price the room was great. Having been to New York a few times we know you can pay silly money for absolute trash. This was not the case here. At $250 a night it was not hugely cheap, but any less than that in NYC and you will more often than not end up in a dive! Clean bedding and shower, which is VERY important. Nice flat screen in the room. Comfortable room and continental breakfast was complimentary which is very usefull to fill your stomach before hitting the shops!! In the ‘Indian Curry’ neighbourhood, so if you like Curry then there are many great places (restaurant or simple cafes) within walking distance. Great place to set up camp for a shopping trip in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: sametmail
Reviews.Content: We booked a room but when we arrived at the hotel we were told that there room will not be available because of an unexpected illness of the person who should had been evacuate our room. We were sent to another hotel around the corner, that offered us a SINGLE ROOM instead of the SUPERIOR QUEEN we ordered. We had to go back to the Park South hotel and get into an argument so they can understand that this is NOT ACCEPTABLE. No apologies or compensation were offered. Only after a harsh argument, and another hour of waiting they finally found us a solution in a hotel a few blocks away. We were never been treated so miserably by a hotel. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “good find”
Reviews.Author: technosimon
Reviews.Content: good location,small rooms with bath.fridge,safe.clean,good staff. some noise from outside air con.New York hotels are expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: tk63
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but okay for a few nights. Stay away from the rooms on the 1st floor as they are near the AC's and very noisy. Excellent continental breakfast and friendly and helpfull staff. Business centre has 3 pc's and good fast internet connection. Location is great; just a minute from the subway entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Park South Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenMomCincinnati
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights at the Park South Hotel and was very pleased with my stay. The staff was professional but friendly and always helpful. A continental breakfast was included, and it was wonderful with a wide variety of breakfast foods. An added bonus to the continental breakfast was that it was available until 11 a.m. every morning. The room was smallish, and my only criticism of it was that it was very poorly lit. There were only two lamps in the room, and they were not very bright. Of course we didn't spend too much time in the room so this was just an inconvenience, not a major complaint. Our room did not have a full size closet but rather a combination half size closet and chest of drawers, but this wasn't a problem for me. Someone who packs a lot of dresses or skirts may have found this more of an issue. The room was always made up, and all supplies and towels were replenished regularly. There is evening turn down service, including chocolate on the pillows. The hotel is conveniently located near the 6 subway and is easily accessible to anywhere you want to go. There is complimentary ethernet in the room, and there is also a business center with computers and printers available. All in all, Park South is definitely someplace that I will return to on future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: swiviol
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at Park South for two nights, but it was very nice. The rooms are decent, and big (as compared to other NYC rooms) ... bathroom kinda reminded me of a one-person bathroom at a restaurant, but was clean and neat. Complimentary breakfast was a nice plus too. Location is great, very close to the E. 28th St. subway.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Be_Switzerland
Reviews.Content: I loved the Park South. I stayed here for three nights and even though I had booked my room for 189$ for the first night and 269$ for the two following nights, they gave me the cheaper rate for all three nights (incl. breakfast). On my last day, I asked them to please order a taxi for me to bring me to the airport in the evening - and upon returning to the hotel, they had actually booked a small limo for me for 50$ flat to JFK. Very nice. Admittedly, the rooms are a bit small. I don't need much, though, as I don't spend much time at the hotel anyway. The rooms are very clean and well furbished, with flat-screen TV. There's little storage room, but as I was travelling by myself, that didn't cause any problem at all. The room was quiet and the location is just perfect. It's only a few steps to subway station (green line), between Lex and Park is great anyway and it's also a very good starting point for a stroll around the Village and Soho. There's a Duane Reade and a Starbucks literally around the corner and there are several restaurants and shops nearby. I will definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't amazing...”
Reviews.Author: hobyan
Reviews.Content: This wasn't our first choice of accommodation. New York is New York though, and hotel space comes at a cost and is also booked up early! You just have to put up with it! Check in is pretty all over the place. The staff are hit and miss. Lovely door man - scrag reception lady. It seems as though they think they are running a five star hotel?? Our room wasn't ready on arrival(we were quite early), so they were happy for us to leave our luggage and go get some brunch. We returned a while later and it still wasn't ready, so we just waited in the lobby area. Whilst sitting around, I did see several clients waiting around to be attended to while the lady at the front desk chatted on her mobile. Not acceptable in my opinion. When we finally got to our rooms, we literally could not fit through the door. It was a shoebox (but i kept reminding myself this is new york!). With our suitcases in the room, we could not get in and out the door! The air con was broken and the room was extremely stuffy and hot. I tried to open the window, but it can only be opened a small amount due to a stopper fixture. I told them the next day and they fixed it that afternoon. The front wheel of the bed was broken, and was so noisy every time you moved around. The mattress was also extremely hard, to be honest i didn't have a good nights sleep. Bathroom facilities were fine - but no space to lay out make-up, toiletries etc. Girls, bring your own hairdryer, as the one provided is rubbish. Felt like only 10watts. Surprisingly the shower was powerful and spacious. Internet is provided via a cable in the room. Wireless isn't needed considering there is no room to move around. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant - why would you when you have so much choice? I personally would stay at the Bowery or somewhere nicer next time - if you're used to bigger rooms and more professional service. But if you're a last minute traveller like me - then park south hotel will suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, professional service all the way!”
Reviews.Author: momto3beautifulgirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park South Hotel in NYC from June 12th through June 15th, 2008. I booked via Quikbook.com, which I recommend as no prepayment was required and there was a reasonable cancellation period. We have young children at home, so flexibility is always a must! Note: this trip was me and my husband only, to celebrate our 16th wedding anniversary. We arrived about 3pm and were immediately checked in and informed we'd received a free upgrade from the Superior Queen room I'd booked to a junior suite with a king sized bed...yeah! So I cannot speak to the size of the superior queen, but this room was MORE than spacious, and had all the amenities we'd been expecting. There was a small issue with the cable/wireless internet when we arrived. No big deal, by the time we returned to our room later that evening it had been resolved. The temptation is always for me to get off track and describe my entire trip when writing these reviews, so I apologize in advance if I slip! Suffice it to say that the hotel truly was an oasis in the middle of a very exciting, busy and exhausting long weekend. When we arrived back at our room we'd always pause at the front desk to ask for ice to be sent up, and once the actually beat us there! Any requests/needs we had were always handled politely and quickly. On the last day we found our 9am flight had been cancelled due to a ground stop out of JFK. We rebooked for that night , then slept in (RARE treat with 3 kids!) until 11:30. I'd asked for a late check out but they were full that evening and so could not accomodate us, however did stow our luggage so we could have 6 more hours of fun in the city, and recommended a great car service which we used , and I would highly recommend this route if you plan on transporting from the airport via cab anyway as its only a few dollars (literally) more and SO much nicer an experience. Well, that's all I can think of. If you have any questions feel free to ask! I think, as it was my first time to the city , that it was a wonderful choice. Great value for the money in NY for sure. I can highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travels_from_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park South Hotel on the last night of our week-long visit to NYC, because our original hotel could not accomodate us for an additional night. So, our perspective is just for one day's quick visit. Our double room was long and narrow, and we had to use the second bed for luggage, since there was no place to put it otherwise. Lots of NYC hotel rooms are small or weirdly shaped, especially in the smaller hotels in older buildings, but we were OK with it, since we weren't in the room much. The room was very nicely decorated, and the bathroom was as well. Everything was very clean. As far as location, Park South is pretty much in the middle of nowhere but close to everything, as the subway station is at the end of the block. It would be a 10-15 minute walk to Grand Central. We would stay there again on nights when the the rates are lower.

Reviews.Title: “Great value option for NYC”
Reviews.Author: andiw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nites - definitely great for the price, (booked online thru a booking mega-site) tho' small, even for typical NYC "small". Super quiet, nicely appointed, (recently redone?), staff for the most part exceptionally nice and helpful. Great location (Murray Hill). Subway stop same block. In the heart of "Curry" Hill - plenty of Indian shops and restaurants right there. One of the best gourmet food shops in the U.S. half a block away - Kalustyan's. Two of us in a double room - no place for suitcases, closet isn'tfull length tho there's a rack of hooks behind the room door for longer items (like pants, dresses); air cond. worked great - we were there during a heat wave (mid 90's) and really needed the a/c after being outside during the day; bathroom small but efficient - okay shelf space; decent continental breakfast - good coffee (important for some of us, tho there's a Starbucks a block away). Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: STL_Teacher_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park South over Memorial Day weekend 2008. The room, which we were told was an "upgrade," was like sleeping in a box, it was barely 10x10 with a bed, bathroom and a desk w/chair, and that was it, no closet (hooks on the wall,) and barely room to pass each other walking around the bed. I wondered if it was because we got the room online (through Hotels.com) On the other hand - - The room was clean - Breakfast was excellent (and included in the price - There was a room available with free internet access on their computer - The subway was less than a block away So, although I was irritated with the size of the room, everything else about the place was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ahtsguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South Hotel for two nights during the Memorial Day weekend and had a pleasant experience. As others have noted, my room on the eight floor was small but comfortably furnished, with bed linens, towels, bathrobe all of good quality. The bed was also quite comfortable, and the free Wi-Fi and morning newspaper a plus. (The only negative was a non-functioning mini-fridge, which would have been handy if I could have figured out how to plug it in or turn it on; I'd have tried to do so if I had stayed more than a couple of nights.) Continental breakfast was basic but well-stocked with essentials such as dry cereals, fresh bagels and muffins, some fruits, yogurt, sliced ham and chesse, cereal bars and juices (coffee was a bit weak, however.) I didn't dine at the hotel's Black Duck restaurant, but did have a nightcap while listening to a jazz trio after the theater on Friday night. The hotel is well situated in the Murray Hill/Flatiron district, which I enjoyed exploring; a highlight was Madison Square Park, a total gem with a dog run, sculpture lawn, cafe tables and benches, etc. about 5-6 blocks from the hotel. I also enjoyed a tapas dinner at nearby Pamplona restaurant, which was surprisingly empty on a Saturday (perhaps due to the holiday weekend). The #6 subway is a mere half-block away, but I chose to walk for most of my excursions as the hotel is in such a convenient location. Overall, I think the Park South is good value for the money and I'd certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: pio35364
Reviews.Content: After much searching, decided to stay at this hotel due to the recommendations on this website (price, location, quality etc) We were not disappointed. This hotel does have small rooms, but we asked straight away if we could move and the hotel were only too happy to oblige. Second room gave us more space (it wasn't huge) but it allowed us to be more comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful (at our request gave us coffee maker, allergy free pillows, booked taxi back to airport) nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Restaurant was good and reasonably priced (ideal for a meal after a hard days shopping) Subway station on the corner. Hotel also very clean, bed, towels etc. The bed was very comfortable, although the rooms did get quite hot (air-con fan heater never seemed to help much) Views from rooms not much good but this was never really an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Easter holidays”
Reviews.Author: hjslisbon_Portugal
Reviews.Content: Very good location; great staff; great breakfast; excellent restaurant (live jazz on fridays evening); small double rooms (best chose a twin)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love the Park South”
Reviews.Author: mrstorre
Reviews.Content: Disappointed! Website makes guest rooms look comfortable, when i walked into our room I felt like it was a cruel joke! Not exaggerating when I say it was walk-in closet sized. No room to walk around the bed, the mini fridge door could not open all the way because space was so tight! The bathroom was terribly small too - no space for toiletries. No real closet in the room - there was cabinet with a 5 in rod sticking out towards you because there was no fitting a hanger in the traditional way. Trendy though, and okay area. Wouldn't stay again for more than $100

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff need an attitude check”
Reviews.Author: farstar22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times when my best friend came to New York on business. The rooms vary widely in size, from tiny to large but are tastefully decorated. The housekeeping staff do a wonderful job, as do the dining room staff at breakfast and dinner. Unfortunately, the front desk staff don't seem to have learned that haughty and condescending service went out of fashion in New York sometime after September 11, 2001. On my last visit, a simple request for minor assistance at the front desk was met with indifference, inaction and discourtesy. Fortunately, dining room staff jumped to my aid. I recommend that the management invest in a basic "interpersonal skills" course for the front desk attendants, they are a dime a dozen in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet hotel - great HQ if you're planning to be out a lot”
Reviews.Author: absolutlycat
Reviews.Content: Nice clean little hotel. Quiet rooms, good cleaning and desk service. My boyfriend and I stayed for a week in early december. The room wasn't large but was comfortable and clean. Our safe broke four times while we were there but the handyman managed to fix it each time. Our view was of a brick wall across the courtyard but we weren't really in our room enough for that to matter. All in all, a cab anywhere in town cost less than $10, the hotel felt safe and was in a great neighbourhood for bars and you can walk to attractions like the Empire State Building and so this would seem like quite a good bet if you're visiting to shop or look around. We'd certainly stay again if we went back. For restaurants try Blue Smoke (jazz and a great bar open late - the food is brilliant) nearby. Try and see something at Madison Square Garden and try to make it to 11 Madison Avenue to eat - great service and a wonderful wine list.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: carola
Reviews.Content: Park south is a fantastic hotel. Great double bed room, nice staff, breakfast included and subway just a few steps away. I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzyjono
