Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights just before Christmas in a Superior Double Double room. PLEASE NOTE that all Superior rooms have a view outside - of a brick wall. If you want a City view, then opt for the more expensive Executive Double Double. That said, the room was still great - average size, warm, clean, great bathroom, bath robes, TV, fridge etc. Breakfasts good - great range of fresh bagels, pastries, cereals etc. Never ate in the Black Duck Restaurant, but went in there in the evenings for cocktails and a listen to the Jazz Band - great bands, great staff. Overall, we thought the staff were all really friendly and helpful too. However, my friend also stayed here a couple of weeks before, and she had a different experience! Nice central location - not far from the Chrysler, Empire State and Fifth Avenue etc. Great Indian restaurant next door to the hotel -Copper Chimney - recommended. Also, great Tapas not far from the hotel - Barna. From hotel, turn left onto Park Avenue, and then left again for about 200 metres. Restaurant is on the left. We loved it here - great food, atmosphere, wine, staff and food! For yellow cabs, from the hotel, turn right onto Lexington Avenue - easier to flag one down here than directly outside the hotel. Any other questions please e-mail me, and I would be happy to help. Top things to do while visiting New York: 1) Statue of Liberty - an absolute must - make sure you pre-book a free Monument Access Pass off the Circle Line Ferry Website for entrance into the statue (pedestal only, but still absolutely amazing! - if not just for the views, then for the museum!) 2) Empire State Building at night - wow 3) Grand Central Station - fab 4) Walk in Central Park - beautiful 5) Ground Zero 6) Trinity Church - beautiful 7) Cocktails in Trump Towers (on 5th Ave) 8) Rockefeller Centre If you think you're going to go and get a load of bargains though - think again! Bloomingdales, Saks 5th Avenue, Macy's etc - extremely expensive! That said, have a fantastic time, and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: deirdre565
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in midtown manhattan. Its a great place for the price you pay. The rooms are fairly small (like most other hotels in New york) but very comfortable and clean. Spend 5 nights here with my mother and had a room with two doubles. The bathroom is very clean with a very nice bathrobe to use and lovely soap products. the complimenty breakfast is very nice as well. The black duck (restaurant/ bar) is alright but very dark and serice at the bar is not so friendly. Overall a nice place to stay, not a hilton but a decent 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovemaine
Reviews.Content: My boss and I stayed here twice within the span of a couple months for two tradeshows we exhibited in. The hotel was very convenient (we could walk from the Javits each day) and clean and comfortable as well. The rooms, while typically NY small, were decorated tastefully and felt very clean. A major perk was the free continental breakfast, with a great selection of food choices. We found the staff to be quite friendly and the overall experience was a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LC_01
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in November 2007. Our main reason visiting NYC was for the shopping so we were looking for a clean, well-presented hotel in the hub of it. We got a lot more! The hotel was superb. It has an art deco style, large reception area with comfy sofa and chairs and a fitness room in the basement. Location is great too, about 10mins from the Empire State Building and the subway is approx 1 minute from the hotel, which goes both uptown, and downtown. We were fortunate to get upgraded on arrival and stayed in room 407 on the fourth floor. The room was very good; medium sized and nicely decorated. It also had super King size bed, large plasma TV on wall and a clean, modern bathroom. The hotel also provides you with a hairdryer, bath robe, ironing board, iron and coffee machine. There is a heater and air con unit under the window too. There were two downsides to our room. One, that we were facing the street so the view was semi-ok (car parking and front of hotel) but it was also very noisy, especially on the first night, which was a Saturday. The rest of the week was a little quieter. We decided to not ask to be moved though (more a case of having to re-pack then un-pack again). Secondly, there is a small Indian restaurant next to the hotel and as our room was on the street we could smell this some nights, as the window would not fully close. Again, we were just too lazy to switch rooms. (my partner would like me to point out that he couldn't smell anything though!!) One of the best things about the hotel is that breakfast is included in the price. There’s a great selection of teas/coffees, muffins, croissants, bagels, fruit toast, yogurts, cereal and fresh fruit. We tended to pig out, as you then really don’t need to eat until about 2pm! Breakfast is also served 7-11am, which is handy as you can have a lie-in still. The staffs in the hotel were very helpful too. We had a slight discrepancy with our bill but they resolved the issue quickly and efficiently. The doormen are also very polite and knowledgeable. Other things to know: Hotel is approx 30-45mins from Newark airport, depending on traffic. On a public holiday give yourself about 1-½ hours though, just to be safe. The hotel also has a restaurant but the food is quite specialised and wasn’t to our liking. The atmosphere is lovely though; one end of the restaurant has a log fire and armchairs, which is very cosy. Overall we were very happy with our choice and would stay here again and recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Park South- solid hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: forkfan22
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night trip to NYC for Thanksgiving weekend and stayed at the Park South hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby, hallways, and common areas were very clean. The continental breakfast is a great plus to your stay (if you're not going out for a meal)- bagels, coffee, cheese, muffins, pastries, various meats, English muffins, juice. The rooms were larger than expected (for New York City). Our only complaint was that the bathrooms desperately need an extra shelf!! My two friends and I couldn't even keep our toiletries bag in the bathroom. The beds were comfortable, but a bit firm for my taste. I think the best offering of the hotel is the location. You're literally one block from the 28th/Park Subway stop on the 4/5/6 line. Go uptown, downtown easily- it's great! I will definitely recommend the hotel to others and plan on using it for future trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience from budget travelling husband and fussy wife”
Reviews.Author: MountainLakeTree
Reviews.Content: We had some trepidation when reserving Park South Hotel given that its price was $100 + a night cheaper than well known hotels with good reputations and at the same price level as hotels with lousy reputations. But our visit couldnt have been better. Even though we got a room next to the elevator, we could barely hear it. The staff was respectful, though not fawning (an attitude I would not expect from a self-respecting). The room was not tiny, just small and certainly was well appointed, with a touch of class thrown in to details like the bedpost and the terrycloth robe. The complementary breakfast pasteries were great, a cut above what one expects for free breakfast. I loved the neighborhood, quieter than midtown, but in walking distance to it, as well as longer walks to the Village. I loved Anthony Bourdain's Les Halles restaurant around the corner (quite affordable) and the fun indian emporium a few doors down. All in all a great, affordable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room issues”
Reviews.Author: nyc23456
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South Hotel for one night, and was put in a room right next to the elevator. The noise level was rather high, so I called the front desk and asked whether I could be moved to another room. The answer was "NO", and the recommendation for dealing with the situation was to "walk to the corner pharmacy and get yourself earplugs". I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, absolutely no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Baiailing
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a friend and past guest of the South Park Hotel for recommending this place to me. It was fantastic. The room was big (king bed) perfectly clean and very quiet. We even had a view of the Chrysler Building from our window. The wall mounted flat screen TV and the chocolates left on our pillow each night made our room a very inviting place to come home to at the end of each busy day. Free broadband in the room also facilitated a great stay. Ashley from the front desk was a pleasure to deal with over the phone from Australia. She put us on a waiting list initially for a room and then called back as promised to confirm availability leading up to our trip. The bar/restaurant in the hotel is a happening little place too! I'd read some scary reviews about various NYC hotels online but the Park South in Murray Hills, NYC was delightful. I would definately stay there again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok yes Rooms are small .... but overall not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: Elisa_B
Reviews.Content: Yes well you can gather from the other posts that the rooms are small. And yes its expensive to get accomodation in New York so I suppose you have to just deal with it - I am not used to paying so much for a room and it not being 100% to my satisfaction but I cant whinge about it because you either pay ALOT to get a great room or pay an Average amount and get a basic room - we obviously chose the latter. Anyway, we stayed in a double room as there were four of us - two couples. We manged it OK, but probably next time we would get two seperate rooms or find a hotel with a bigger size as we could hardly fit all four of our cases. But - the good points - the room was clean, the breakfast included was good, the hotel has a great little restaurant (the steak was to die for), the location was excellent, can walk to most attractions or a short cab fare. I cant say that I would stay here again, I would try somewhere else But if you are not concerned with room size (i.e. you are on business) then I would recommend this hotel. Also a great indian restaurant next door - Copper Pot from memory and the Mexican as well next door are both great eats !

Reviews.Title: “Park South Oct.22-25 Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: noka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park South for 3 nights in October. We arrived at the hotel early, and checked our bags and explored/had lunch till 3pm check in. The room, 1 Queen bed, was very clean, bathroom spotless, desk, chair, flat screen tv and fridge. There were coat hooks behind the door and a small narrow half closet to hang shirts and below a set of narrow drawers for items. Also in-room safe. Comfy bed with down bedding and pillows, side lamps and a clock radio. My room was small, and no where to put luggage, should suggest to add a luggage rack/stand so it is not on the floor, otherwise, its all you really need in NYC. Provided breakfast, basic bread/toast, muffins, bagels, croissants, hard boiled eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, cereal bars, coffee/tea, etc. Staff was friendly and courteous, doormen were charming and the frond desk ladies were sweet. Good location, off of Park South near the # 6 subway line to uptown/downtown, lots of restaurants and takeout. Very safe area to be in. What i was very impressed with them, and if i could give them a 10+ is for their customer service. On our last day, we checked out, checked our bags with their storage and proceeded to do last minute shopping and sight seeing, had a great time cramming in the last bits, until we got to the subway to buy fare, i reach into my bag and my wallet, with EVERYTHING is gone. We raced back to our last purchase store, no luck, nice for them, we got to use their phone, but who do i call? I called the hotel for help/advice. They advised us to go to the police and file a claim. And allowed us to use their fax/phone numbers to receive any info regarding our situation. When we got back to the hotel, they received copies of our passport and social insurance cards, that we left at home, and had our family fax over to us. Allowed us to use their front desk phone to contact our travel insurance/ visa card to get some cash wired, and the hotel agreed to give a cash advance against our visa card that the agent had reissued for us. Also they helped us find a new flight to get home, considering during all this we missed our flight home. I believe they really went out of their way to help us any way they could, And we had already checked out, so really, we were no longer guests! Honest, decent, genuine, considerate, helpful people! When i go back to NYC I'm staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Hiramg
Reviews.Content: Im taking the time to review this Hotel, i saying only one thing.. its the best , its a small comfortable hotel located only 15 steps of a subway station in 28 street, the rooms are spectacular and clean ,staff and security great , the continental breakfeast was the best one I have ever seen in a hotel !! I recommend this hotel to everybody dont look for other options. AHH forgot the price excellent for the city of NY.

Reviews.Title: “Park South: Good value for the money in Murray Hill”
Reviews.Author: fussyguest
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Park South for 2 nights in September. We booked our room through Priceline and got a reasonable rate. Breakfast was included. Check in was efficient, we had been upgraded and found the room (#419) to be large, immaculate, contemporary and stylish. The bathroom was very small (the blowdryer is kept hanging in a bag on the back of the bathroom door because there isn't anywhere else to store it!), but it was fine for the two of us for a few nights. Smallish "closet" built in the wall with 4 drawers beneath it; the hooks on the entryway wall were a nice addition. Our bed was a king, the mattress and bedding were great....Again, everything was very clean and appeared to be relatively new. Our room was very quiet. Breakfast was basic continental...there were hard boiled eggs in addition to the bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, etc. on Sunday morning. The doorman offered to store our luggage on Monday after we checked out of the hotel while we visited MoMA: This was great for us. Everyone we dealt with in the hotel was professional (check-in, doorman, housekeeping). The neighborhood is filled with restaurants (we had really good Indian food one night and had great barbecue at Blue Smoke one afternoon), there's a small store on the corner for really good sandwiches, coffee and bagels. The general vibe is friendly and safe. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KYP2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park South in mid September for 3 nights and I would highly recommend this hotel. The location was great with the subway nearby. The room is clean and the bathroom is modern and clean with excellent water pressure. The bed is comfortable. I can't comment on the size of the room as that was the first time I have been to New York and the Park South was the first hotel in New York that I ever stayed in. I also found the hotel to be quiet. Though fully booked, I couldn't hear the people next door or above us. I would stay in this hotel again the next time I am in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperLekker
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the Park South (I've stayed there twice) was good, and I would stay there again. The location is great, with easy access to midtown and Union Square, a subway line practically outside and a Duane Reade just on the corner. The staff are helpful and friendly, and the chocolate at reception is always a nice touch. They offered car service (unprompted) when we were checking out and minded our cases with no problems at all. Rooms are a bit small and on both times I've stayed there I've had no view, other than the usual NY view - onto other buildings. I hear that there are views of the Chrysler though, so maybe you'll get lucky... As a result of this the rooms are dark and the lighting in them leaves a lot to be desired - this is probably my main gripe. They were very clean though and the fridge is very useful. The AC is noisy but efficient. Breakfast is great, and we didn't have a problem getting a seat although the restaurant is small. The first time I stayed here my employer paid as I was on a work trip. The second time, I paid. The location (right in Murray Hill) does it for me, it's just great. As there are a lot of business people staying here regularly it means that the staff are a bit nicer - they know that there's a chance you'll be back. It also means no 15 minute waits for the lift as a giant tour group takes over an entire floor. The intimacy of it combined with the location make it a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Park South was more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: PollyA
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August. Our room was on the third floor and had 2 double beds which were very comfortable. The room was not spacious but we weren't in it much apart from when we were in bed. I did think the noise from the air con would be annoying but it didn't bother us which was good as it was necessesary to have it on as the weather was hot. Most points have been covered in other posts all I can add is I would recommend this hotel to anyone like us who is on a short break in New York and just needs a hotel as a base. I did a lot of research on hotels before our trip as value for money was paramount and we certainly had that. We had a brilliant time in New York and I am glad we stayed at the Park South Hotel. I booked this hotel through Quickbook.

Reviews.Title: “not all tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: statestripper
Reviews.Content: Not every room is doll sized as one reviewer mentioned. My wife and I have been 3 times in the last year and the more familiar you become with the property and the staff the better your stay becomes. Ask for room 209, very quiet and large and near back door with ez access to rest of this fabulous neighborhood location.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in nyc”
Reviews.Author: szlwzl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had a great time - the rooms are small but then they always are in NYC. The rate was very reasonable at $209 + taxes per night which includes breakfast - almost unheard of in New York hotels as far as I can tell. The location is very convenient to both subway stops and main drags for cabs etc and there are a lot of restaurants on 3rd avenue just a block away which never disapointed. I would thoroughly recommend this place to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: OzinPos
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the attitude of the front desk staff at the Park South Hotel. It has always been my experience around the world to find hotel staff to be happy and effervescent - this bunch were lack lustre and flat. Overall, the room we had, though small, was well furbished and clean. The restaurant/bar downstairs had loads of nightime atmosphere, particularly when the jazz singer and her ensemble played. It was nice to return in the evening, plop down in a cosy chair with a cosmopolitan, to chill-out before dinner. It felt like we were in a jazz den, all deep red furnishings and dark wood. On check out please check your bill thoroughly as we were charged twice for the same phone call. This could happen anytime anywhere, but the front desk staff were adamant that they were right and we were wrong. In the end, after consultation with a supervisor, they acquiesced. In the end, it's all the little things like a "Smile" and a "Hello" that make all the difference to one's overall experience. Unfortunately we barely experienced either of these two simple gestures here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MEBr
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Park South Hotel and it was a wonderful stay. The staff throughout the property was friendly and helpful. A great bargain for the location, with good amenities and looks of the hotel, and only 1/2 block from the 6 subway line. Although the room was very small, it was not shocking by NYC hotel room standards. It was clean, nice linens (bed and bath, with a bath robe) with a flatscreen tv, and tiled bathroom with nice toiletries. The room air conditioner worked fine. The breakfast was amble- cold sliced cheeses, meats, hard-boiled eggs, cold cereal, yogurt, sweet breads, plenty of coffee and juices. The property has a very nice restaurant and bar on its premises; a nice plus was the live jazz on Fri and Sat nights. We were housed on the 8th floor, facing the alley, so it was quiet. We had traveling companions who stayed on the 2nd floor facing the street, and they complained about the noise - oh well, to be expected, so bring the ear plugs if you're on lower levels. I would recommend staying at the Park South and will book my room (on the upper floors) when I return to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Although I have visited New York City annually for more than 10 years, this is my first NYC visit (and review) since joining TripAdvisor last summer. I like to try a different hotel (sometimes more than one) for each visit. Hotels have ranged from luxury--St. Regis (3 times), Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, Pierre (while a Four Seasons), St. Regis Club at Essex House (while a Starwood), Peninsula--to "chic/designer"--Mercer, Chambers, City Club, Shoreham, Tribeca Grand--to "good value and well reviewed" --QT, Lucerne, Library. The Park South belongs in this last category. The hotel is located on E. 28th St. between Park and Lexington, an area I've never stayed in between Murray Hill and Gramercy Park. The Empire State Building is within walking distance. The subway stop for the 6 train is 1/2 block away on Park. Note: if returning to the hotel by subway, take the local 6 train only; the 4 and 5 express trains don't stop at 28th St. This area seems to have a large Indian population which is reflected in nearby shops and restaurants. A McDonalds and a Duane Reade drug store are on the same block. Note: Park and Lexington have some restaurants, but 3rd Ave. one block further east has many more. The front desk staff do everything--the usual front desk duties plus concierge duties, DVD check-out, room service orders from the adjacent Black Duck Restaurant. Everyone I encountered was competent but not particularly friendly. I was given a room on the top (8th) floor, and judging by the fire escape diagram on my door, it was the smallest. I was neither surprised nor upset, given that I was travelling solo for this trip and also booked through a discount website based in NYC (Quikbook). My room looked exactly like the photos posted by "redhead 73" on 3/28/06. My room was right behind the small elevators, but I heard no noise. Despite its size, the room was decently equipped--DVD player, small flat screen TV, fridge. The window was large enough and the space between buildings wide enough to let in a decent amount of daylight. The bathroom was tiny, had a shower only with weak water pressure, and the temperature of the water from the sink was highly variable. The closet was small--3/4 length with 3 drawers below. The rod was a foot long at most. There was no real space to store luggage. The previous guest seemed to have spilled beer on part of the mattress and carpet, as this area reeked and was damp. It took awhile and several attempts for housekeeping to address the issue, and the odor did not completely disappear. On the posivtive side, the hotel offers a car and driver (fees involved), free internet access (in room with your laptop or in the nice business center), a free DVD library, free newspapers (USA Today and NY Times but not Sundays), and a free expanded continental breakfast in the Black Duck restaurant. The breakfast is set up on the bar and offers a wide variety of carbs--toast, bagels, muffins, danish, croissant, cold cereal--and some protein--cold cuts, cheeses, hard boiled eggs. It is offered 7-11am and is always crowded. It was here I discovered that most of the other guests seemed to be European, taking advantage of the strong Euro and the August holiday. The restaurant is open for dinner nightly and did not seem crowded the times I peeked in. The menu is seafood oriented. I did have room service one night. The front desk took the order and a waiter delivered the tray, but without the usual room service amenities like salt, pepper, flower, water or bread. At least there was a napkin and the food was tasty. All in all, although some of the other "good value" hotel I've stayed at were in more vibrant neighborhoods (Times Square, Upper West Side), I would book the Park South again without hesitation if I got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Simon_the_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several New York hotels over the past years. Our most recent stay was this past Labour Day weekend for 4 nights. South Park offers very clean new modern rooms. Our room had a quest size bed (very comfortable), night stands on each side of the bed and a desk with a chair. There was a fridge below the desk. The closet was build into the wall with 3 drawers, and hangers for suites, pants etc. A safe and an iron were included in the room. Bathroom had all the amenities you will need. The hotel offers a very nice upscale continental breakfast with a selection of juices, toast, delicious pastries, cheeses, cold meats, fresh fruits and of course coffee. Service was excellent. All in all an excellent stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....But Doll-Size”
Reviews.Author: ABComo_Italy
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 3 nights after 25 days trip aroun US and Mexico. The hotel is clean, nice, located right close to the underground (n° 6 - Stop 28th), with an included breakfast but....the rooms are too small, really small and without a real wardrobe !!!! If you have a big luggage and you are able to fit it , you have two solutions: walk on the luggage or jump over it....that's up to you!! Don't believe to the hotel website: photos don't correspond to reality (we saw 3 rooms)!!!! I'd suggest it for a one night stayng or if you travel without big luggage. ANTONIO B. - COMO -ITALY

Reviews.Title: “thanks, but no thanks”
Reviews.Author: tiredmomboston
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were only able to take one night away from our 2 young kids. Hoping to stay out late enjoying the city and sleeping in. We were told that the hotel was sold out and that we were given an upgrade. With the excitement of being away from the kids and we overlooked the one reason why we needed to get away in the first place. We had a late dinner and did not get back to the hotel until midnight and slept around 2. Unfortunately, our dream of sleeping in was short lived. at about 6am, we were awakened by bright sunlight coming through the skylight right above our bed...4 hours of sleep...we mentioned to the front desk when we checked in that we both looked forward to sleeping in, over and over we said this, but they did not accommodate us in anyway. the front desk staff was not professional and the room was dirty...this is how we knew that we indeed were not upgraded. the room was dusty, the cabinets were filled with junk, shoes, booze, etc. and the fridge had mayo, and other used products. Over all we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattypw
Reviews.Content: A nice, moderately priced (for New York) hotel. The room was quite small with absolutely no closet space but well decorated and comfortable. The bathrooms were nicely decorated. The complimentary breakfast served each morning is quite nice; I'd call it an "upgraded continental". If you stay on a weekend, be sure to reserve one of the hotel's packages detailed on its website; the couple next to us at check-in paid $40 less than us in total AND one dinner at the hotel restaurant was included in their package! We asked to be switched to the same package as them, but got the disappointing but expected, "No, those packages need to be reserved in advance..."

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in New York!”
Reviews.Author: cippie75
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in New York for one or two nights and this hotel has been the best where I stayed so far. The hotel is centrally located, with everything within walking distance, some very nice restaurants situated nearby and the subway stop in the same block. Everything at Park South was great, the room was totally clean and state of the art with LCD TV, firm bed, luxury sheets and duvet, excellent towels & toiletries, free (wired) high speed internet, morning newspapers (NY Times and USA today), and marble bathroom, the staff were friendly and very very competent and the continental breakfast was very good. Can say enough good things about this hotel. One minor thing is they sell out quickly (smaller property), but I would definitely stay there anytime I come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, but very nice all the same”
Reviews.Author: ExcelWiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights last week. The room was small, bordering on too small, but it was clean, very well decorated and very quiet. The bathroom amenities were quite nice. The bedding was among the most comfortable I have ever enjoyed in any hotel. There was free wired internet access in the room with a very long cable provided. The free continental breakfast was very complete and well-presented. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. All in: a solid 3*. I would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel south of midtown”
Reviews.Author: eobri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park South hotel over New Years and were quite satisfied with our stay. It was the only place I could find for anything close to that price($200) and it met our needs nicely. As you approach the hotel, you have to come in off 28th Street. That might not be obvious given the name is “Park South”. It isn’t really on Park Avenue at all. However, it’s not hard to find. The area around the hotel isn’t impressive, at least for a tourist such as myself. Compared with staying in midtown, there didn’t seem to be a lot of activity in the area. There is a drugstore and a Mcdonalds on the corner. It's right next to the subway station, making transport very quick and painless. Check-in went smoothly and we got a room with two double beds. The room seemed fairly clean and was spacious. I had read complaints about a small room but we didn’t find that to be the case at all. It was a nice place to rest up between site seeing. The bedding was very comfortable and adequate. No complaints about the bathroom either. Like I said earlier, this was a nice hotel and I really don’t have a lot bad to say about it. If you are looking for a budget option that is relatively well-located (since it’s right next to the Subway), I would certainly think this is a reasonable option. They serve a very good continental breakfast in the morning in the restaurant downstairs. They had some good pastries and a lot of fruit. That can really save you on breakfast so we tried to take advantage of it. Not anything like the cheap ‘donut & coffee’ breakfasts that you might be used to at most places in the US. No hot food like waffles or sausage, however, if that is the sort of thing you are hoping for. Overall, I think this is a good hotel in an okay area. If the price is right, I would recommend it. For us, it worked out perfect for NYE!

Reviews.Title: “Quick & Easy New York”
Reviews.Author: dncrbetty
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through non-major website, but when I checked in there were no problems and my price was honored. The rooms are very small, but very neat and extremely clean. Toiletries and towels were abundant, but our bathroom fan was not working. My only complaint was that my booking led me to believe I could get a smoking room, but when I arrived was told that no hotels in the area allow smoking. I paid under 200 for one night but there is plenty of parking close by, which makes it great for a quick NYC stay. I'd definitely go to Park South Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tandem40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay for a weekend. We stayed one night only and were very comfortable. We will definitely stay again. The breakfast is very good and served in an atmosphere which is cozy and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Speaking from experience”
Reviews.Author: MissPf
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying in the Park South over 20 times in the past 4 years and for me it's a home from home. Helpful and friendly staff, clean, bright rooms and a good value breakfast. The area is full of great, cheap restaurants and the store on the corner is open 24 hours and is full of great snacks, beer etc. The Black Duck food is excellent and it is all round a great hotel for the cost (Cheap for NY prices). Admittedly the rooms are not huge but this is New York..space is at a premium and if you want a football pitch, you pay. And anyway, if you are in NYC..You should be spending 20 hours of your day enjoying the greatest city on earth. And for the person below who suggests the subway 3 seconds walk away isn't convenient..get a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Bankrobber
Reviews.Content: Some reviews of this hotel state the rooms are small, I found a queen bedded room fine for two of us, the bed very comfy, nice modern decor, immaculate bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries. Very quiet at night, complimentary breakfast more than adequate to start the day - $239 + taxes booked with hotel. Located on E28th and Lexington Ave makes a good base for exploring NY. There is a metro station 2 minutes from the hotel - only 2 stops from Grand central terminal, making the connection from Newark to the hotel easy using the coach USA service running every 15 mins and takes around 40 minutes($25 return). Empire State is 15 mins walk as is Macys. If you have 5 days or more, you can walk most of Manhattan - you see more this way. The hotel is in the Rose Hill area and seems safe at night - my average walk back from 5th Avenue around 12:30am. One tip to avoid Broadway late at night between 28th and 36th streets - 5th Ave feels a lot friendlier late on. If tempted to stay in Times Square remember very noisey and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Go there!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPhoebe
Reviews.Content: We headed over to New York at the beginning of May for a short break of just under a week. Having never been there before and therefore not knowing exactly what to expect, we did an awful lot of research to try to find the right place to stay. Even though we knew that most of our time was going to be spent sight seeing, we still wanted to stay somewhere spacious and comfortable. After having read an awful lot of hotel horror stories about tiny rooms, noisy locations, rodent infestations and worse, we opted for the Park South hotel which from all accounts seemed to be ideal. And we were not disappointed. The location is perfect for sight seeing with all the major attractions within walking distance. If you're not feeling too energetic, the subway station is about 100 yards down the road and cabs are easily hailed from Lexington or Park Avenue. There were a few street traders down the street from the hotel but we didn't notice any "street walkers" as another reviewer mentioned. The area felt very safe (safer than London in some respects) and it was also surprisingly clean. The hotel itself was modern, clean and comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor at the back which although I was initially disappointed at not having a view of the Chrysler building - I was more grateful for the peace and quiet. New York is noisy and coming back to the tranquility of a quiet (and nicely air-conditioned) room after a day's sightseeing was a welcome relief. The room was enormous with a queen sized bed, armchair and still loads of room for our suitcases and shopping bags. It did lack a bit of hanging space as the wardrobe was bizarrely tiny but we managed. We had local newspapers delivered every morning which was a nice touch and also the complimentary breakfast was fantastic. Rather than the usual dried up croissant and wrinked apple you normally see, the hotel laid out a full buffet including every type of bagel you could imagine (watch out for the onion ones - not good for breakfast!). Good coffee too. The staff were very friendly but unobtrusive which was ideal - nothing worse than "in your face" service. If you needed anything they were there but you hardly saw them otherwise. We ate at the hotel restaurant, The Black Duck on just one evening which was very pleasant - the food was lovely and reasonably priced and the atmosphere relaxed. Apparently they also organise Jazz Sunday Brunches which, when we were there, appeared to have been brought forward a few hours to the Saturday night. We caught the tail end of it after a night out and had we wanted to develop hearing difficulties, we would have gone clubbing. Turn it down! It think that covers everything - we would definitely go back there on our next visit and have already recommended it to friends who are flying out there in July.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CarlNova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South in December 2005 when I went to NYC to attend a Conference for work (at the Javits Center). For some reason, it was the only hotel in the immediate area that was under 300 bucks (government rate). Why the hotel offered a great deal (pays for your cab ride from Penn Station), that was the onlything good about the property. My friend and I got a queen-bed room which was TINY even by New York standards. And, trust me, I stay in NYC at least a half-dozen times a year for business and pleasure. The closet had only enough room for two shirts and the room was so small you actually rubbed up against the art on the walls when you climbed in and out of bed. The restroom offered barely enough room to use the facilities and close the door (no leg room). The continental breakfast was included in the room rate and was ok, but it was MURDER trying to get a cab. Luckily, there is a subway stop adjacent to the property, but even it wasn't convenient because it wasn't the line we needed to get to midtown. I wanted to like the Park South, but it was probably my worst stay ever in The Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Non responsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: stokester
Reviews.Content: Was given a tiny room and figured that was New York. Found out a colleague was staying in a bigger, much nicer room for ten dollars more. I asked why I wasn't given that option and the girl at the front desk lied that my colleague said it was her first time in NY so wanted to upgrade her... then said there was nothing she could do for me. Complained to the manager but he didn't seem to care. Boutique hotels may seem hipper or cooler but at least the big name hotels treat you much better and respond to a complaint properly for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the City”
Reviews.Author: mcfiddle
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place near our daughter's apartment and took a chance on Park South-- it was $199 on Quikbooks, when we arrived they had my price at $209 but instantly adjusted it when I asked about it. The room was smallish but comfortable, shower was great, free breakfast was excellent, NYTimes delivered to door each day (except Sunday), getting ice delivered to the room took awhile but the fridge kept it frozen so we only had to do this twice. Rooms were clean and staff was excellent-- lots of little restaurants near by...and easy access to the 6 Subway...plus lots of cabs... Grand Central within a few blocks, Madison Park and the Shake Shack within in a couple of blocks...we had a terrific stay-- will go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBeth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Park South Hotel for five nights (May 16-21) and we loved it. this hotel is everything we wanted and although we had read great reviews before booking, we were still plesently surprised. Our room was really not that small despite what we had read and the bed was huge. Flat screen tv, power shower, alarm clock, complimentary newspapers, shampoo, conditioner, bath robe and hair dryer ( what more could a girl ask for. Breakfast was simple but nice alhough the restaurant in which it was served can get crowded, even at 7am!! Our only complaint was that housekeeping would knock on the bedroom door between 8:30 -9:00am so if you dont want to be disturbed make sure you put the sign up!!! The location of the hotel was really great, and the subway is only a few steps away. We will def stay here again if returning to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rocketmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South over Memorial Day weekend and can't recommend it enough. The rooms are great, the beds comfortable, and the hotel staff pitch-perfect. If you're traveling with kids --- or if you want something approximating a suite --- then you may want to inquire about their room numbers ending in 01 and 03 (as they share an alcove which can be locked off from the hallway).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Streetwalkers Scare You”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this excellent gem for three nights in mid-May. I was in town for the Subway Series and to visit friends, and as a former New Yorker I found this hotel to be an excellent jumping off point for my activities. Yes, there are prostitutes outside. Lest I thought I was mistaken the first night, they showed up again the next. But they would not serve as a deterrent to my recommendation, and indeed I have already booked another stay there next month. For the rate I got on a discount travel site, $244 per night for Thursday thru Saturday (a lot of places go up on the weekends, this one doesn't), I found the Park South to be a good value, compared with other NYC hotels I have stayed at during the last few years. First off, my plane didn't arrive at JFK until midnight, and I had no trouble with my room being held for late arrival. I checked in quickly around 1 a.m. and found the lights very dim in the lobby and candles flickering on the side tables. The desk clerk said that management likes it that way at night, but he did turn the lights up enough so that I could see what I was signing. I had a queen-sized bed, and true, while the room was typicaly NYC-small, with the obligatory view of the building next door, it wasn't as small as some I've encountered, where you could barely pass between the bed and the wall. The room was spotless, with two telephones, a TV-DVD combination, a Sony Dream Machine clock radio, a mini-fridge, safe, ironing board & iron, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower gel & two sizes of soap), hair dryer and bathrobe. The latter is a great touch. The bathroom linens were thick and of a high quality. It was also very quiet, although the doors of the other rooms tend to slam, so that got to be annoying. There was a very small closet area with three or four drawers built-in below. If you're staying for more than a few days and want to hang up a lot of stuff it's not going to be sufficient. It was helpful, though, that there was also a coatrack by the front door. My room also had a desk with the second phone. In the morning I had both USA Today and the NY Times outside my door. I never ate at the continental breakfast, which is served in the Black Duck restaurant off the lobby, but I did stick my head in. It seemed to have a decent selection of fresh fruit, danish, breads, cereal, juice, coffee and tea. I stayed on the second floor, which held a darling alcove overlooking the lobby with two chairs and a lending library. There was also a selection of DVDs available to borrow at the front desk, along with an ever present huge bowl of Hershey's Minatures. I did use the business center, located on the lower lobby, which was convenient for printing out my boarding pass before my return flight. The only minor complaint I would have about that is that a staff member has to escort you and let you in, but I do believe it is open 24 hours. My first night back there was turndown service with two chocolates on the pillow, but for some reason that did not happen the next night. Housekeeping was a bit spotty in terms of resupplying towels and keeping them at the same amounts as there were upon check-in, but when I called down to say we'd been left no face cloths within five minutes there was a knock on my door with additional ones. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check-out was equally quick, although it took the bellhop a while to find the bags we had checked with him, and he actually had us come into the closet with him to find them. Overall, though, I was more than pleased and quite happy to find this place. It was very convenient to have the 6 train on the corner at Park Avenue, as well as a 24-hour Duane Reade (drugstore). There's also a 24-hour McDonald's, for those so inclined, and a nice bagel shop a couple of doors up, as well as a bodega on the corner of Lexington. I'm wishing I had discovered this place long ago when I was staying at other hotels in the city. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: magoo7
Reviews.Content: When looking for a place to stay for one night, had a hard time finding something reasonable. This hotel was great,the room was totally clean, the staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good. I would stay there anytime I come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alex71Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and loved it. The bed was HUGE and incredibly comfortable. The hotel does a free DVD rental service which is a great way to chill out for a couple of hours in between full on sight seeing and a night out on the town. The bowl of Hershey's chocolates in the lobby make you feel instantly welcome and with an excellent curry house next door and the fantastic Penelope's up the road on Lexington for brunch, this is a brilliant location, within a stone's throw of the Chrylser and the Empire State. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends as a great place to stay in New York. It is art deco in style and feel and the staff are warm and friendly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a great city...”
Reviews.Author: mrlunch
Reviews.Content: Decided to find a cheap hotel room on-line for a last minute New York trip. The Park South Hotel came up as a "three star hotel" available at a great $170 rate. After staying there, I'm not sure I agree with 3 stars (maybe 2.5) but nevertheless, I was happy with the room & service I got for <$200. For the price I got a nice, quiet queen sized bed, free wi-fi, and a free continental breakfast each morning. The green line was also just a half block from the front door! If I needed to stay in New York City again for less than $200, I'd gladly stay at the Park South again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mid range hotel (u won't find better in NY!)”
Reviews.Author: Travellinbelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay. Could not have asked for a nicer room but did get a complimentary free upgrade and was told other rooms were smaller, so nice of the front desk to do this. The cleanliness is of a really high standard with crisp cotton sheets, beautiful fresh towels and nice little toiletries. You also get a free newspaper every morning. This hotel really lays on a lot of special touches such as free complimentary breakfast between 7-11am, which is fantastic - a selection of yummy fresh pastries, real orange juice, hot drinks and all is a buffet style eat as much as you like. There is also a permanently stocked bowel of hersheys chocolates on the front desk! If you take a laptop you get free Internet access, otherwise there is a really nice business centre in the basement that you can ask to use. One street down on E 27th is a really nice restaurant called Blue Smoke, which has a Jazz venue underneath it but the hotel also has jazz on a Friday and Saturday. The subway is on the corner of the street and there is a Duane Reade (convenience store) with entrance on Park South. There's a DVD library that you can use, so ask to see the list at the front desk. Also a small gym. Finally, have read some other reviews which comment on the staff not being friendly. This was definitely NOT my experience and one of the porters was really helpful with my constant questions about public transport. He recommended the PATH train (pick up at 23rd or 14th) which takes you to a shopping centre in New Jersey called Newport! Really great hotel and comes highly recommended as a good central base for going up or down town. You can literally walk all over New York from here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katywales
Reviews.Content: I visited the Park South Hotel in December 2006 for a Christmas Shopping trip. The hotel was fantastic, lovely big room, large beds with plenty of towels and dressing gowns. The staff couldnt be more helpful from giving us resaurant recommendations to telling us how far tourist spots were away to booking our helicoptor ride. The hotel is centrally located, with everything within walking distance, with some very nice restaurants situated nearby. The hotels bar and restaurant was fantastic and we had a lovely meal on the last night there. I would recommend anyone to stay in this hotel as they offer fantastic weekend and holiday rates, are in a great area and have great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Better Light!”
Reviews.Author: Treblehook
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, regular rooms are small, I had a superior room on ground floor which was nice, clean and roomy. The elevators are extremely small. Rooms are dark, need more lights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LittleEmma1978
Reviews.Content: The Park South hotel on 28th Street, New York, is ideally located for anyone wanting to take in the sights and sounds of the city. A stone's throw from a subway station it's easy to get to both above ground and below. The subway line takes you right through the heart of the city - plus it's easy to walk almost anywhere in Manhattan. For the price (I paid US$215 before tax) it's a great hotel. Rooms are not huge or particularly charasmatic, but plenty of space to navigate the bed and you don't feel too cramped in. Most, though not all, rooms have a (quite small) bath tub, and the complimentary toiletries are very nice. The bed was comfortable, and there was very little noise from outside or other guests. The TV reception was a little fuzzy, but I didn't go to New York to watch TV, so that didn't really bother me. Breakfast was a continental selection of meats/cheeses, breads, croissants, cereal, fruit and yogurt, tea/coffee/juice. All perfectly edible and good enough to set you up for the morning. Weekdays there are complimentary papers left outside your door. There is a apparently a business centre and fitness room in th ebasement, though I couldn't actually find them. I am sure if I'd asked there would have shown me. Staff were friendly and helpful, and there is a left luggage service if you need to check out way in advance of your onward journey. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for travellers who want a fairly decent base camp, but don't want to pay ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: loch2
Reviews.Content: Ok so we were upgraded to a Junior Suite - but the room was BIG, very comfortable, huge bed, good bed linen, large sofa, coffee table etc. Service was acceptable. Our only complaint was one bath robe instead of two!! Now that's not bad! Was great to have breakfast thrown in and the subway station a 1 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueTraveler
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice little hotel and a great value. It is not fancy but the rooms are in good shape and the service is good. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred hotel when I stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: RWC99
Reviews.Content: I have become a fan of this little hotel in NYC, having stayed there 3 times over the last 6 months while I'm in NYC for business! For the very reasonable price you pay (around $200 for a standard queen room, if you book early enough), you get a really clean room, firm bed, excellent towels & toiletries, free (wired) high speed internet, morning newspaper, & TV w/ DVD player! The price is extremely reasonable for a hotel off of Park Avenue in NYC. Extra perks include the Black Duck restaurant (amazing food, typical snooty NYC service...think of it as part of the "NYC charm"), and the fantastic Copper Chimney (India food) next door. The front desk staff has always been cheerful and friendly. I think some guests may mistake the New Yorker charm as "attitude" or "surlyness" - to that I say, loosen up! Can say enough good things about this hotel. One minor thing is they sell out quickly (smaller property) and I've had to go to much pricier hotels ($300+/night) because I booked too late!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1spartanfan
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel for the price. Very tiny room but good location, pleasant staff and great breakfast. We travel to NYC about every 4 weeks and would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst service”
Reviews.Author: motutoopua
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel seems to have attitude problems. Front desk and all other staff very unhelpful and somewhat indifferent during my 3 week stay, but what could one expect staying in such a 2-star category hotel of this class. I happened to be on a long business trip and this was the contracted hotel, otherwise I would have left after one night. The worst came right after check out -- as soon as they charged my credit card and got their money for a 21-night stay (a good sum deserving at least a 'thank you for your stay' type of thing but no), they became even ruder by the instant. I told them that I left something and needed to go back up to quickly fetch it. The receptionist who had checked me out practically screamed at me "What you mean you didn't clear out your stuff before check-out??? -- if you go back up housekeeping will be all over you!" were there exact words. After much obvious fuss, they said that they will need to take a copy of my passport before they can let me back up (they should already have one on file from when I checked in) as if I were going back up to steal something (had I wanted to steal their towel or ashtray, I very well could have done so before proceeding to check out!). They finally let me back up but had another staff follow me up and accompany me while I grab my bag! The absolute worst hotel with absolutely the worst staff whom probably never received proper training on how to deal with simple guests' request. I will never step back into this hotel and advise anyone planning to stay here to expect to face the very rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: carlesp
Reviews.Content: Rooms not very spacious , although very clean. Good Bathroom with nice products. The thing is that if you get an inner room you hear the air conditiong machinery. My girlfriend and I slept with earplugs and no problem (except the 1st night due to jet lag). Location is good, as there's an underground right at the corner. Breakfast is very nice. Staff is not very nice. I

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SCRKJCK
Reviews.Content: Hello, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel for 2 nights from Dec 26 - 28th. Booked on Quickbook - 1 qeen for $149/night. Very clean hotel, nice room (bit small, only half a closet really). We were onlty there for 2 nights so it was not an issue. The only complaints - the room was warm even with the heat off and did not have a view. I was very pleased with the hotel for the price we paid. We arrived at 1:15 pm and got to the room within a few minutes of check in I asked for a room away from elevator and they front desk was very accomadating. I'm a light sleeper so noise bothers me. I always use earplugs in hotels no matter where I'm staying. I bought a pair at the drug store around the corner. The hotel offers discounting parking down the streeet at 20/day. Subway 1/2 block was very convient. Lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. Breakfast was good. No complaints. The place looks like it's brand new. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good breakfast & bar, noisy room by elevator”
Reviews.Author: inSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Park South Hotel and really liked it. The location was pretty good and the subway stop was 1/2 block away. Breakfast was very good with warm, fresh bagels alongside sliced meats and cheeses. We had a glass of wine one night in the bar, which was great. Hotel staff was helpful each time we spoke with them, so I am lost on the post about the unfriendly staff. The only problem we had was that our room (#201) was right by the elevator, so it was noisy. We thought it was the pipes making noise for the first couple of nights, then realized it was the elevator. We were so tired after jam-packed days exploring that it did not bother us while sleeping. I simply would not stay in any room ajacent to the elevator. Overall, nice place, and we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BuckyM
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an old world European feel. The subway is close by, the prices reasonable, the rooms large in comparison to Midtown/Times Square, lots of good restaurants in the area, great service, cool bar that doubles as a free European style complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning. I go to NYC at least twice a year for work and although this is a little bit of a trek it is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: pboropixie
Reviews.Content: We recently visited this hotel twice - once for four nights and then again for just one night - and were very pleased with it. One the first visit we were in a queen size room which is quite small. I would recommend getting a king size room, which we were upgraded to on our second visit. However, the rooms are well appointed and the bathrooms are lovely. The price we paid included an excellent breakfast of bagels, meat/cheeses, pastries, cereals, fruit, tea/coffee and juices. This was a real bonus as we were expecting to have to go out for breakfast each day. The business centre offers free internet access. I notice a few reviews with negative comments regarding staff. Our experience couldn't have been more different. All the staff that we dealt with were very friendly and helpful, even when we were checking out at 2.15 AM. If I were to complain about anything, it would be that the bar was not open late enough. We arrived at 11.30 PM and it had already shut.

Reviews.Title: “Worst staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Foss4
Reviews.Content: First impressions were good. The entrance to the hotel is very smart and the corridors/ rooms are all tastefully decorated. Breakfast was included in the rate and was very good -lots of choice and very good quality. We were there at 7am though, I don't know if things are as good later in the morning. The thing that spolit our stay was the off hand attitiude and rudeness of the staff at reception. Anytime I made any enquiry, I was made to feel unwelcome. When I enquired if tea/coffee was available in the hotel, I was told to use a deli down the road, but worst of all was the complete disinterest by reception when my pyjamas disappeared from my room. I probably wouldn't choose to stay here again unless the room rate was so good, I couldn't refuse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NickFisher
Reviews.Content: If booking this hotel, avoid room 108 at all costs. This room backs onto an extremely noisy A/C unit and is just off the foyer, so has people passing constantly. We slept in this room for one night and had to be moved for the the second night of our trip. We were offered no other compensation, despite voicing our dis-satisfaction and this in a city that prides itself in going above and beyond when it comes to customer service. The reception staff at this hotel are extremley rude and are not helpful at all. Infact, these were the only rude New Yorkers we came across. Great location and a good continental breakfast. Rooms clean although small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank2802
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. Superior Room was small but ours had two double beds. Internal View facing a wall which made the room dark even in sunlight. Closet very small and inadequate. Upside was the clean modern bathroom, TV with DVD player (200+ DVD's to select from), and the continental breakfast (good choice and included in the room rate.) Subway nearby and transport required to most of the sightseeing attractions. We used cabs most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and value for New York”
Reviews.Author: OrlaM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at beginning of October and had booked a superior queen. We were pleasantly surprised by our room - it was large and well furnished. It had 2 double beds with good quality bed linen. There was a fridge, coffeemaker, safe and TV with DVD. There was also free wireless internet - however hanging space was reduced to make room for desk. (There was also free computer access in the basement including use of a printer) Bathroom was small but clean and with great range of good quality toiletries , plenty of towels and a bathrobe. We had room service one night from Black Duck and found food excellent. Breakfast was adequate, with a good variety of breads - nothing exciting but saved bother of going out to look for somewhere to eat. Hotel was pleasantly decorated with prints of old New York. There was a small library above lobby with books about New York and DVDs could be borrowed from reception. Staff were unobtrusive but efficient and stored cases on last day without any problem. Location : right beside subway and close to Park Avenue. However you did need to use subway, bus or cab as location meant it was quite far from main shopping areas and attractions. It meant that journeys involving a change of train could take quite a while. It was too far too walk all the time as it was uphill towards midtown. Conclusion - good small hotel with all the amenities (and more) of some the larger more expensive hotels, but a bit far from the main tourist areas. Good value for New York

Reviews.Title: “Large Room for NY”
Reviews.Author: RMatthews
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in the Park South Hotel and it has positives and negatives. The positives are that the rooms are on average larger than other rooms I have stayed in NY. They also offer free internet (with a cable) and rooms are clean to a decent standard. On a negative side the area where the hotel is situated is not that great. The street is dirty and their are hawkers on the street if you arrive via Park Avenue. This can be a bit disconcerting and a bit intimidating if you are not used to living in a big city. One strange thing is the breakfast. Its a fairly limited choice with cereals and some pastries but they put all of the cooked meats and cheese on top of each other on the same plate. For vegetarians this is not good and if you ask for cheese etc which is not been with the meat they give you an odd look. Overall if you are looking for a hotel outside of Times Square which has larger rooms and is clean then this is okay but it has no wow factor of some of the larger hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: cfhalliday
Reviews.Content: With hindsight we wished that we had spent the full 10 days of our visit to New York in this hotel. We stayed here for the first 5 days and the remainder at the Milford Plaza (regretfully). Our room (Room 511) was a small double on the side of the hotel. No view, but that meant no traffic noise either. The adjacent Black Duck Restaurant was the venue for breakfast and/or dinner. Breakfast was continental buffet and plenty of it! Clever how they lit the restaurant in the evening with not much more than candles in small glass tumblers. It gave a classy feel to the place together with the live jazz on Friday and Saturday nights. We had dinner on two occasions and were well impressed with the standard of the food. Bed sheets were changed daily, free newspaper and internet access, helpful staff....I could go on. Only criticism was the lack of closet space in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: TorontoToo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its pluses and minuses and in the end, I'd say it met my expectations for the price range. On the plus side: very clean, recently renovated rooms, comfortable beds, quiet (and my room did overlook rooftops but not noisy at all), air conditioning worked well, luxury toiletries, good location On the minus side: Superior Queen room is TINY, no full length closet - just hooks on the wall and a half length pantry like cupboard, coffee makers on request only, only furniture for sitting is the desk chair or the bed - if you use the desk chair no one else can get around the room without you getting up - unless they cross over the bed!, housekeeping always forgot something - toiletries, towels, facecloths . . . front desk staff unapologetic and cool. Service was below average, no friendly welcome, no concierge. Ok for a short non-business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good value hotel for NYC”
Reviews.Author: maxmissie
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Park South Hotel in June 2006. We paid around $200/night for a queen size room (this is a double by UK standards) and were not disappointed. The rooms were a good size, very clean, with a decent shower and nice toiletries. If you are looking for somewhere merely to sleep and are not planning to spend too much time in your room then the size of the room is perfectly fine. The room was nicely decorated and the bed very comfy. We had an aircon unit which whilst a little noisy (more irritating probably to those of use who are not used to getting air con units in hotel rooms!) kept the room cool. The continental breakfast was great, plenty to choose from. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The hotel is well located in midtown, a 10 minute walk from the Empire State Building, with a subway station at the end of the block which we made great use of. I would definitely recommend use of the subway, it is cheap and very easy to use and saves a lot of time and energy, especially if you only have a few days in NYC. The only downside to the hotel was that the first room we had (can't remember the room number but it was on the same floor as the reception desk and quite near to the reception) was located right next to the generators so it was very noisy. I asked reception if we could move rooms but there were none available (we had arrived at 9.30pm and it was the last room left). However they did say that they would move us to a quieter room the next day and that they would move our bags if we left them in the room. I was a little sceptical but lo and behold the next day on returning to the hotel we had been moved to the same size room a couple of floors up. We could still here the generators but I'm guessing you could probably here them from most rooms anyway. So I was very impressed by this and generally the quality of the hotel for the price. I would definitely recommend it to anyone on a similar budget as it appears that most hotels of a similar quality in NYC are a lot more expensive than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a more reasonable price than most!”
Reviews.Author: Fishndoc
Reviews.Content: A family of four adults stayed at this hotel for three nights in August, 2006. The room ( a double-double) was a more generous size than expected and had big windows, but the bathroom was a bit small. The hotel looks newly remodeled, however there was a slight musty smell when first entering the room. Overall, everything was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Since we stayed during a 100+ degree heat wave, I was concerned about the air conditioning but it worked great....got as cold as we midwesterners like it! An added plus was the inclusion of a better than average continental breakfast, coffee maker in the room, and a small empty fridge for our use free of charge. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for us...steps away from Park Avenue and the subway. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yoursandmine
Reviews.Content: The Park South Hotel in New York city on 28th street has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. They claim to offer a 24-hour cancellation option prior to arrival. However, when I called at 8:30pm the evening before, they were adamant that it was ‘too late” (according to the person on the phone, I had to call be before 3pm for it to apply). And so we are being charged. I explained (accurately so) that I was never told that I have to call before 3pm…just 24 hours prior to arrival…and I’m not arriving until 9pm on the day of check in!!! He said, “too bad.” I asked to speak with the manager and he/she was not in but could call tomorrow… which is definitely less than 24 hours. I asked for the manager’s name and he wouldn’t give me one. It sad, that this is how the Park South Hotel in New York makes their money. On travelers who never stay at the hotel!!! Lowest ratings ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very responsive”
Reviews.Author: MemberFromBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my partner and teenage son. While room was very small, it was clean and beds were great. Spotless bathroom (I'm picky) was also very small. We are small people so didn't care. Since I am allergic to feathers, I asked for a replacement for down duvet, and they came immediately and remade the whole bed, as it had a featherbed (I didn't realize this and would have slept on it- which would have made me sick). The staff was lovely. Continental breakfast was also nice; a great value. We paid $207 for three adults through Quikbook.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: adventuretraveler1
Reviews.Content: Good, clean quiet hotel at a decent price ($175) Stayed here 4 days- only problem was that internet access was a little spotty, but not a big deal. Continental b-fast was boring, but most are. Staff was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Above Average”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from this hotel and thought it was very good. I have stayed at fancier places, but this hotel did the trick for a quick weekend. My friend and I shared a room with two double beds and had plenty of space. Although there was no dresser, there was a small closet with some built in drawers we were able to use. Otherwise, we just left our things in our suitcase, which was fine for the couple of days we were there. The room looked as though it had been recently remodeled: the beds had wonderful duvets and plenty of pillows, and the bathroom had beautiful white tile everywhere, new fixtures and pretty crimson walls. Each night, there was a turn down service where the maid would come and turn down the bed, fluff the pillows, put a velveteen bag of chocolates on your pillows, and draw the shades. (It was wonderful after a day of pounding the streets of the city to come back to that). The daily breakfast was fantastic--many types of bagels, english muffins, toast, granola bars, nutri-grain bars, croissants, danishes, muffins, cold cuts, cheeses, cereals, yogurts, boiled eggs, fresh fruit (whole bananas, oranges and apples), juices, milk and coffees. You could not leave hungry if you tried! The staff was very helpful and accommodating to our needs. The hotel also has a lovely bar and restaurant--The Black Duck--which has been well reviewed in Zagat Survey. The neighborhood, while not my favorite in NYC, was good. Cafe 28 is only a couple of blocks away--has a great salad and food bar, as well as bakery and gourmet items. There were several interesting looking Indian restaurants nearby, although we didn't try any. The 4, 5, 6 is very close to the hotel and the N, Q, R, W subway is a few blocks down 28th. A great value for under $200/night. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Experience at Park South”
Reviews.Author: dcabill
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a good three-night stay at the Park South Hotel. I was quite happy with the hotel in pretty much all respects. The hotel has a stylish, minimalistic decor without being over the top. Size of the room was fine, especially for NYC. Location was good esp if you enjoy the Gramercy Park/Murray Hill area. Tons of restaurants within a block--many Indian (hence the nickname, "Curry Hill."). Subway 1/2 block away. Free continental breakfast was great (and till 11:30 in the morning)! I do agree with some reviewers that the front desk clerks are very no-nonsense; they were def on the "cool" side. Still, I had no problems. Includes small fitness center and free computer/Internet access in the small business center on the lower level. And very nice bathroom soaps/shampoos too. Got a good price on Quikbook (under $200/night). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP, BUT NOT WORTH THE LOW PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this Gramecy Park hotel over Memorial Day week-end 2006. It was a last minute get away, and we wanted to be frugal in this very expensive city. That was my primary motivation behind my decision to book this hotel. We paid $185 a night which is extremely reasonable for Manhattan. After our stay at the Park South Hotel, I wish I had spent more money for a better hotel. The room was unbelievably small even for New York City. We peered around the room attempting to locate the closet, finally realizing there was none. We left most of our clothes in the suitcases and hung up what we were wearing that day on hooks extending from the wall. It was past midnight when we arrived after the usual New York airport delays, and both of us were a bit hungry. Knowing that we were in the city that never sleeps, we asked the person at the tiny front desk in the ersatz lobby what restaurant might be open at that hour, and he warmly and helpfully told us to walk down Third Avenue and see what was open. Thanks. Unfortunately, there was not one place serving food after 1:00 A.M. on a Friday night in this section of Manhattan. We eventually went to a 24 hour grocer and bought munchies to eat. Although the bathroom had a great shower with a "rainfall" shower head, it was miniscule with no place to put your toiletries. We also used our suitcases to store toilet articles. The bathroom was not particularly clean, and there were some frightening looking stains on the wall. The air-conditioning in the room worked when we first arrived, but it seemed as if the hotel decided to turn it off at night. Thus, the room was very uncomfortable to sleep in. Ambien did help us get some rest. We tried to use the work out room in the morning, only to discover it had only one treadmill, one step master, and one weight machine. My wife allowed me to usurp the treadmill, and I did work out. However, there was no air-conditioning in this basement room, and I almost passed out from heat exhaustion. On the positive side, the hotel restaurant was cute and had live music. The subway was a block away, and a visitor could get where they had to go quickly. However, if we were more inclined to take the time, my wife and I would have switched hotels. Yet, with three days in the city, we did not want to waste our holiday looking for another hotel. I cannot recommend the Park South Hotel. Bright colors, nice towels and a good shower head do not excuse ridiculously tiny rooms, no closets, lack of service, and a general grunginess. The Park South Hotel is one step up from a basic hotel that might suffice if you are 20 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and then some”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Paulb
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night stay at the Park South Hotel in Murray Hill: we'd recommend it in a heart beat. For $182 a night (which is a great price for NYC) we had a big room, two double beds. The beds were excellent, as were the linens and bath products. The breakfast that was included was by far and away the best we have ever encountered for a continental breakfast: it included hard boiled eggs, a selection of meats and cheeses, yummy pastries, fresh fruit and more, as well as two dedicated staff who kept refilling throughout the morning. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The only downsides were a lack of closet space and the location is a bit off the beaten path: we did discover, though, that you could walk a couple of blocks west and jump on a direct train to Times Square and the theatre district. Oh! And the hotel air conditioning worked amazingly well, which was important since it was the first heatwave of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfy beds, friendly staff, yummy breakfast!!...”
Reviews.Author: FootballNut
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to NY and stayed at the Park South Hotel for seven nights. It was really convenient for getting around Manhattan. There is a subway line within yards of the hotel which means you don't have to worry about cabs. The hotel staff were friendly and made us feel really welcome and provided us with advice about getting the best deals from excursions. We had a small problem with our toilet, in that it got blocked, but the staff immediately upgraded us to a larger room for the rest of our stay. The rooms were kept really clean and the air conditioning was pretty good. The breakfasts were also good. Great selections of bagels, croissants, pastries, muffins, fruit, cereals, tea, coffee and fruit juices. Plus, if you're a chocaholic, they keep a huge bowl of little chocolates down at reception, which is a much appreciated energy-boost after you've been walking around the city. If we were to visit NY again, we would have no hesitations in returning here!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sorcs
Reviews.Content: Group of four girls on a shopping trip to NYC so location was important - this was a good central hotel. It's quite near the Empire State building so that's a good landmark when you're trying to make your way home!
