Breakfast was included the price - eventhough it's only Continental (no cooked pancakes or the likes), there was a massive amount of food to choose from - bagels, different types of bread, cereal, yoghurts, tea, coffee, etc, etc.. The rooms were very clean and were always nice and tidy when we got home in the evening (no mean feat given the amount of shopping bags that were mounting up over the days). There is a lovely little bar/restaurant open in the evening with cocktails reduced during 'happy hour' so it was often a nice way to relax in the evening before heading out for dinner. Didn't eat in the restaurant so can't say what that was like. Overall, would very much recommend this hotel as a great base for your stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you enjoy being insulted and humiliated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the room is adequate for the money and the location is good, the customer service is non-existent and in fact, the employees are rude and outright insulting. On the morning I checked out, I requested a copy of my bill. The front desk associate, told me that not only could I not receive a copy of the bill, that I could not even review it. This was important tome as it was a business trip and I had to submit expenses. The employee continued to argue with me, then ignored me. I decided to leave and let my accounting dpeartment follow-up on the billing later. As I walked about two to three feet away from the front desk, the employee loudly said, “Stupid b*%^$^.” I turned around, walked back to the desk, and said I was shocked by what I heard. I tried to maintain a calm demeanor, given this was in front of a crowded lobby of guests, and I was very embarrassed by the amount of attention. The employee said she was not talking to me and became belligerent. She repeated that she could say whatever she wanted as she was not speaking to me. Clearly, she was not in a good frame of mind and I insisted on speaking with the hotel manager. The hotel sales manager came to the front desk and made the situation more embarassing by standing next to the employee and asking what the problem was (again, in front of a large group of guests). She said she would handle the situation. I should add that the day prior to this, I asked to borrow an umbrella and was told to go the corner store and buy one. I will not be returning to the Park South Hotel. This is unfortunate as the hotel room itself was fairly decent but as the prior reviewer mentioned, there are plenty of hotels in New York with good customer sevrice.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in Room (Four Times)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had mice in my room FOUR times. They moved me to another room to have the room exterminated, when I moved back in; there was a mouse crawling on my table (usually during the night time.) The mouse was trying to get into that little bag of chocolate that Park South hotel used to leave on your bed. They no longer p;ut the chocolate on the bed simply because of the mice. I switched rooms about 5 times and had to sleep at a different hotel for one night. The front desk people aren't that nice. You only get a bigger room if you stay for a long period of time. So if you stay for a weekend, I suggest sleeping somewhere else. The whole staff could not believe that this happened to me four times. After the fourth time, Marcello Munoz who is the general manager stopped replying to my issues. The reason why this occurred so many times to me was because my company put me there for one full month. Some of the promises that the general manager promised me (compensation) was not fulfilled. I am very unhappy there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjslatt
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and comfortable room at an excellent price. The restaurant downstairs was very good. Only stayed for 1 night, so I can't comment on it's location. The room wasn't as small as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: curious101
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, clean, helpful officers, good breakfast with tons of choices, You can even borrow DVD and there is internet room. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: oxybill
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel in a travel magazine, and after reading all of the positive reviews I decided to book our stay in the Park South. My husband and I (with our two daughters) spent four days and three nights at the Park South--and it was as wonderful as we had expected. There appeared ro be a problem with our reservation when we arrived--but it was immediately taken care of and the rest of the stay was without any glitches. The room was a nice size, and VERY clean and well kept. Yes, the bathroom is small, but that has been our experience with the nonchain, unique NYC hotels. But really--it wasn't that big of a deal! And the bathroom was kept really clean, too--which IS a big deal! This hotel is a great find, and I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in more of a neighborhood area, and way from the bustle of the usual main areas of the city. And everything is in walkining distance, so you sacrifice none of the convenience of being near the main avenues. There is also a wonderful breakfast buffet every morning which is a great touch, and much appreciated so that we were able to start our day in a leisurely fashion. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “A room without a view..but who cares when everything else is near perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mrwtoronto
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise !!! This hotel is great value. I have no criticism. The check-in and check-out was pleasant and efficient. The room was well appointed and maintained and a reasonable size (for nyc) with room for 2 double beds. I had asked for a quiet room which, in nyc, means a room in the back facing another wall of windows..but that's ok because it was very quiet and I slept like a log in the very comfortable bed. The bathroom was a nice size with lots of towels and soap etc and a bathrobe. Internet connection is provided in the room. When I had a problem with my laptop accessing the internet I phoned the front desk and within minutes got a call from an IT person who talked me through the problem and fixed the problem. The breakfast was very good with lots of variety of juice, bagels, muffins, fruit, coissant and cold cereal all set out in a very bright cheery restaurant on the main floor. Newspapers are left at your door in the morning. Finally I had been concerned about being somewhat out of the way from the midtown theatres and upper manhatten sites I usually attend. No problem !! The 28th Street green line station is one-half block away and gives easy quick access to Times Square atc. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trepid_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel calls itself 4-star, but it's not all that you'd expect an AA-rated 4-star hotel to be in the UK. That said, it's very comfortable, staff are friendly, it's excellently situated between Mid-town and Gramercy and couldn't be closer to the local trains of the 6 line. Don't expect a large room, as they are small, but well appointed and nicely supplied. Cupbaord space is minimal but at least contains a safe and iron with ironing board. The fre continental breakfast is plentiful and varied and well worth taking advantage of. Broadband internet access is free -- just ask to borrow a lead from reception, as is 24-hour use of the business centre in the basement -- printers and photocopier available free of charge (doorman will let you in). All staff friendly and helpful. The doorman/bellhop will let you leave a back even after you've checked out and will book you a limo/car to JFK (handy via the midtown tunnel close-by) at a little more than the cost of a taxi (much less at traffic-heavy times of day) and in much greater comfort than a cab. All in all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EEBostonian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I also just stayed in room 708 (see other recent review) -- and yes, the room IS small! However, we didn't mind the size because the room and hotel are so great in all other respects: the decor and amenities are modern, stylish, and clean; the staff was courteous and professional; the continental breakfast was fresh and delicious; and the location is terrific -- 1/2 block from the subway and surrounded by amazing Indian & Southeast Asian restaurants (try Chennai Garden)! We would happily stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trusted Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at The Park South Hotel. While there I used the hotel room safe. Today someone called telling me I had forgetten my jewelry, credit cards, and other money inside the safe!!!! This was not costume jewelry, nor was it an insignificant amount of cash!! They called, told me they had everything that I had left and arrangements were mde to send all next day air!! AMAZING!! While it was not only a nice small hotel, close to New York City's garment district, the rooms were adequate in size and newly furnished.Also a free European breakfast each day that lasted until 10 am each day. This hotel is a gem, location great. Between midtown and Gramercy Park. Thank you Park South for being in the top of all hotels to call a guest and report valuables that were left! Karen V.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Kat2006
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from spending 3 nights at the Park South Hotel. We were both very impressed with the hotel and had a wonderful experience. We were booked in a Standard Queen room on the 7th floor. The room was small and had a stand-up shower not a bath but we were made aware of this when we reserved so no surprises or complaints. For those who want something more spacious there are superior sized rooms for an additional $80 or so. Everything, inside and outside of our room was kept very clean and our bed was comfortable. Cable tv, in-room iron and safe and nice bath products were a bonus. We didn't have a problem at all with temperature control as some other reviewers did and found the heating easy to adjust and maintain. Breakfast, that was included with our booking, was a cold buffet with enough variety that it sustained us until late afternoon. Location is great, close to Park Avenue but on a quiet street with a subway stop at the corner. All this for under $150 US ! We will definitely stay at the Park South again on our next visit and highly recommend it to others travelling to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: redhead73
Reviews.Content: Other than the size of the rooms, the Park South Hotel compromises absolutely NOTHING! I stayed for 3 nights, and the service was impeccable! You can jump on the 6 train, and be anywhere in a matter of minutes - very convenient! I, also, ate dinner and consumed a few cocktails at the hotel's Black Duck. It is phenomenal! I highly recommend both spots for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Escape!”
Reviews.Author: kevnbren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we found a great deal, price was best around. We will return because this is a real gem. The rooms were small, yes, but very functional and immacuately clean! The bathroom was spotless with thick, luxury towels and amenities. The small restaurant was great, very romantic with the live jazz band and a glass of wine. The free breakfast was awesome with plenty of everything, the deli meats and cheese were excellent, as were the muffins and danishes! The only complaint we had was that our room was stifling hot at night. We had the window cracked and the unit on a/c coolest setting. It was in the 30's outside, and we could not for the life of us figure out where the heat was coming from! We called the front desk and they immediately brought up a fan which helped immensely. There was no noise from traffic below (even with the window cracked). The subway station was on the same block. We ate at the Copper Chimney for dinner and had Indian food for the first time! We had a wonderful time here and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC for a week stay every other month or so, and am always looking for the next cool, hip hotel with reasonable rates (Hotel on Rivington, The Maritime, etc.). I decided to stay at the Park South with a little reservation (I hadn't heard anything good or bad about it). I was pleasantly surprised with my choice. This not the hippest or trendiest hotel in NYC, but the "scene" that also accompanies those hotels isn't present either...which can be a very good thing. The location is convenient just off Park Ave. S. in the Union Square area, but the hotel is tucked about a block into a quiet street. The rooms where sizable for NYC, and very, very clean...my bathroom was spotless. The room decor is very basic and non-hip, but nice all the same. The staff was nice enough, though upon check in I noticed they gave me a third floor....street facing room. I asked if traffic noise was a problem, and if so could I be moved to a higher floor. The staff responded by saying "this is New York City, so you should expect all that comes with it"....no offer to move, or consideration of my issue. That is the reason I'm not giving the hotel an excellent rating. The room ended up being quiet by the way. Anyway, a good hotel that doesn't seem to be "on the radar" of many trendy travelers...yet. I would characterize it as a nice boutique Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I got a package deal that was fantastic. Check with the hotel. The Rest/Bar and ambiance is very NY and friendly. Food is great and the continental breakfast includes the usual, but also has an array of cold cuts. The room was very comfortable with Cali products. Great Location. Out of the hub bub of midtown. This place is a find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Loisstella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park South for 3 nights. I was visiting NY for a mix of business and pleasure and stay in town about 3 times a year. This was my first time at the Park South. Rooms were large (for Manhattan standards anyway). Nice compforters. Clean bathroom. Free internet access and business centre - definitelly a bonus. Free newspapers and good breakfast. No street noise, so apart form jetlag nothing was keeping us up. It's not the cheapest place I've ever stayed at but the quality is definitelly above average! Location is fine - close to everything and the subway station is very close. Great for business travelers as well as tourists. I have recommended it to friends who have alreayd booked their stay there. The weirdest thing though...kept getting electric shocks in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for beginners”
Reviews.Author: SuzSteve
Reviews.Content: Much comparison shopping (prior to being acquainted with this site) resulted in reserving at this hotel for December 2005. Situated between Park and Lexington, 1/2 block from subway station, this is an ideal location for those not well-acquainted with Manhattan. We easily walked to Broadway to catch the subway downtown, and uptown to Grand Central. Many ethnic restaurants close-by. Street noise was minimal, sleep was not disturbed by traffic. Definitely designed for the business traveler (but thick with tourists), hotel staff had varying degrees of desire to help and there does not appear to be a concierge. So, don't expect to have your hand held-independent travelers with basic NY questions will fare well. Breakfast was adequate to start the day and ran late. (Better bagels two doors down!) Our room was huge by NY standards but precious space lost with large telephone and fax. Bath was beautiful and very metro, but small. In-room ironing board was helpful but I would have like to have had a luggage rack. Bed was confortable. The worst thing was trying to keep the temperature regulated; we went from too hot to too cold within an hour. We did not eat in the restaurant (were out every night!). Have recommended this hotel to family and would stay there again. Try to get the larger room. We were just happy to be in such a nice place during the holidays, didn't ask for a view, but you could try. Daily newspaper nice touch, gym nothing to brag about (but we walked miles everyday, so who cares?) Definitely good combination of price, location, amenities, and room quality. Definite YES.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Elyn
Reviews.Content: A great value. We (a group of four) were upgraded to a Superior Double Double, which was roomy by NY standards and had an actual view of the street. (Standard rooms are typically small, but otherwise fine.) The room was quiet and clean, beds extremely comfortable, bathroom immaculate. Rooms are furnished in a simple modern style. The free breakfast buffet is a handy feature, with pastries, cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and cold cuts served in the pleasant adjoining restaurant. (If you're particular about your coffee, though, you might want to get it elsewhere.) The location is very convenient, walkable to lots of places and half a block from east side subway. There are good neighborhood Indian restaurants within a few block radius and a great little Indian gourmet store, Kalustyan's, around the corner on Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: jeannine1101
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in New York. We wanted to stay close to my sister's apartment and this was definitely the closest, moderately priced hotel for many blocks. The hotel's facade is just OK. It is right in Little India. When we got there I thought it would be noisy all night, but it was fine. We did have to turn the fan up the next night because it was a little noisier, but overall, nothing to complain about. Clean, comfortable room. Tiny bathroom - but once again very very clean. Small TV and an even smaller closet (could not fit anything full length in there)but it's NYC. What do you want for less than $200 a night?! We were also upgraded and told our breakfast was included, which was a surprise. The staff were pleasant and we got an email both before we got there asking if they could help and one to follow up on our stay. So overall, very good value for a clean place to sleep. Not the Ritz Carlton, but if you are concerned about cleanliness and safety...plus a moderately priced experience...this is good. Also - behind the hotel is BLUE SMOKE. A GREAT barbeque place! An added benefit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park South”
Reviews.Author: Upland99
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Park South in October. We booked on the web and were guided by Trip Advisor. The Hotel was fantastic, we had an excellet room, very good service and ejoyed the facility of the 'Black Duck' restaurant. To our delight there was live Jazz in the bar Friday and Saturday nights. Would definately recommend this hotel as a great place to stay when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. The outside leaves a little something to be desired but hey, you are in New York. The neighborhood was exactly what I wanted, it was convenient to everything and the staff was charming. They were kind enough to book reservations at a local mexican place that was delicious. I will stay here again. The rooms are small but this is a boutique hotel in NYC and I've paid more for less in SFO. . . Certainly worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “stay away at all costs”
Reviews.Author: rayd68
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just got back from a nigt at the Park south Hotel. Let me tell you im not the complaining type, but this hotel deserves all i give it. For one thing there was no door man to help with luggage or open the door.Extremely hard to carry kids and luggage in. Then there is no valet and you have to walk blocks back to the hotel which is not fun when weather is bad. Then I was greeted by the receptionist with a "YES". Not friendly at all. We then proceeded to our room with no offer of help.I was told I had a good room and arrived to a closet size room with prison like decor.A bathroom so small even for one person. The comforter was stained and smelled. A tv that was pathetic in size. I went to the gym they had in basement a 12'x12' closet with 2 out of the 4 pieces of equipment broken. On check out was not asked how my stay was and not thanked for my business. Overall this place is a Hostel with zero class. Ive stayed at 10 to 15 other hotels in the city this was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the website!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkbeachball
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Park South, we had a Executive Double - room 807, and it was just as it looks in the picture on the website, wich I was very impressed with as usually websites can be deciving. We were overlooking the Crystler Building wich was impressive at night. Black Duck bar was great, very friendly staff and good martinis , they had a lovey fire going and a beatiful xmas tree - all looked very pretty. Didint have a meal there but did have some bar snacks which were good. Breakfast was great, nice english muffins and rasin toast. Only bad thing was teh lack of hot water in the morning on the 8th floor, I just had my showers in the evening instead. Good hotel. No problems and only 10 blocks walk to the main areas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Srini
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park South with my wife and son during 2nd and 3rd Nov and it was really a fantastic place to stay at. Contrary to the experience of other travellers, we had very fast checkin. In fact the room was registered as we entered the hotel and they also received some messages for us. Probably if you give flght details in advance they do this arrangement. They also upgraded my room to superior double. The room space is very generous for Manhattan and service is excellent. The room was spot lessly clean. We only had the complimentary B/F and it is quite OK. Icing on the ckae was when we ordered for a limo for transfer to La Guardia , we got a Stretch Limo for ordinary limo's price. Though it was emberrassing to get doen at the airport....

Reviews.Title: “Cute and great location”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue_traveller
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the amenities and the food at the Black Duck during our recent stay at Park South. The rooms were cozy and had just enough space, but limited closets and mirrors. Bring some DVDs - our room came with a player. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Reasonable parking. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend again”
Reviews.Author: cooldude00
Reviews.Content: chose this hotel for my stay last wk based on reviews from this site and was not disappointed (1) rooms were always cleaned everyday (except one but was remedied immediately upon discussion with the hotel) (2) 100 yards away from the subway which was most convenient (3) good choice of breakfast though continental (4) staff were always on hand to help (5) room though small was good enough (had a superior double double) would recommend again

Reviews.Title: “Small but Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific little hotel with a lot of good ammenities in a great location. I just returned from a business trip and stayed on for the weekend when my husband joined me and we spent time with friends who live in the city. --The rooms are not only clean but up-to-date --The hotel is relatively small but it is extremely quiet which is an anomaly in NYC --The water pressure is good --Continental breakfast is really quite nice --The business center has 3 computers with email/printer access --They even have a small workout room Yes the rooms are small, but they are small in Manhattan unless you are staying at the Waldorf or Pierre. Even then you can get the infamous "rooms with views of brick walls and airshafts". I hate to say this but if you are in NYC and you are hanging out in your hotel room for more than sleep you are really missing the point. New Yorkers are always out because their apt's are small and there is no end to the fun things to do in the city (night and day). This is a good hotel -- it is a clean, quiet safe place to sleep with a few nice bonuses like the 6 - Subway at the corner, trust me this is extremely useful. I would stay at the Park South for certain next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “small room, but good value”
Reviews.Author: Furious_Jam
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, even uncomfortably small. The small size meant that there was little storage space and no spot for a coffee maker or a fridge. As a result, you find yourself tripping over your suitcases a lot and constantly going down to the corner deli for coffee or a cold drink. That being said, the majority of NYC hotel rooms are tiny, and you could pay a lot more without getting that much additional space in return. I think the room size was a fair value. Beyond room size, we were very happy with all other aspects of our stay. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is clean. And there’s a large continental breakfast available downstairs everyday at no extra charge. But the best feature of the hotel is location. A typical NYC tourist might frown on the location because it’s not next to any major attractions. But experienced subway riders will appreciate staying virtually on top of the Lexington line, which allows quick access to Greenwich Village, Chinatown, Little Italy, Grand Central (with a shuttle to Times Square), the Met, and Central Park. St. Patrick’s and Rockefeller Center are also only a few blocks from the Lex line. Overall, if you can find a room here for around $200 a night, I would recommend reserving it for your NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tinniest of Rooms”
Reviews.Author: abproperty
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight stay at the Park South Hotel expedia. I called the hotel directly and confirmed my reservation a few days before my stay on October 24, 2005, and they had my reservation no problem. I checked into the hotel at 4:00 PM, check-in went quick and smooth. Went directly to my room on the 6th floor, opened the door and bumped into the bed. It was by far the smallest room I have stayed in New York City. I did find the room very clean, but if my wife was with me, we would have been bumping into each other. The bathroom was very clean, however, had a smell which seemed to be a seweage type smell, but I could not be certain. The bathroom was so small that I had to shut the door to use the shower. Television was a 19 inch, had HBO, but not movies on demand which I like. Bed clock had a alarm which I used with no problem. A continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant is included in the price of the room, it was simple, but good enough, with bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice and coffee. Quick and easy. I checked out after breakfast with no trouble. While I found the hotel to be convenienct to my business location, nor did I experience any problems with the hotel, I would not stay there again because for the price I paid I expected a larger room than I received.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, solid location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park South three nights last week. Friendly front desk staff and doormen. Excellent complimentary breakfast. Tastefully decorated room. Hotel is very close to great restaurants (check the Murray Hill/Union Square section of Time Out NY's Web site for suggestions) and the 6 line. Because no room was available here on Saturday night, we had to book a room at the nearby Shelburne Murray Hill; I wasn't as impressed. I would definitely stay at the Park South again.

Reviews.Title: “crazy manager”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have book a room in this PARK SOUTH HOTEL through internet, and make the confirmation to the manager whether he receive it. At the beginning, everything is ok., but one day, he cancel by my booking with no reason, and cheat me that it is cancelled by the agent, and i check with the travel agent that it is cancel by the manager in this hotel, the travel agent also very surprise why the manager cancel it with no reason and blame the the guest cancel it? this event disturb my whole plan and make another option very urgently.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LanceC99
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel from Oct 12-16th, 2005 while visiting NYC for theater and fun. We would definitely come back. The location is good with the #6 subway stop near the corner and the theater district just a short cab ride away. Dont miss the good Sushi restaurant, the excellent Italian Wine bar and good jazz at the Jazz Standard, all three are just around the block on 27th. Our room was clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Our standard room was small and did not have the view like the deluxe room they show on their website, but hey it's NYC and we were mainly there at night to sleep. We learned the building was only converted to the hotel about 4 years ago so most everything still has a new (and nice) feel. The room was quiet and we did not hear anyone else above or around us. Our toilet did clog one night but they had someone up to snake the drain in 10 minutes. It was a situation easily resolved. The front desk staff and porter staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is simple but enough to get you out the door to the day's activity where you can think about a nice lunch. For the price ($200 via Price line) I think this was a good deal. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JorvikWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park South Hotel in Mid-September and found this to be good value hotel with a very convenient location. The free breakfast was a big bonus and was great quality too. The hotel decor was smart and contemporary and proved a relaxing place to stay for our vacation. Value for money was excellent and I would certainly recommend a stay here. There is an underground station two minutes walk from the hotel which gave great access to the city. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by and the hotel is close to the Chrysler Building, Empire State, Grand Central and Macys. On the downside, we found housekeeping somewhat lazy and the room was not always as clean as it could have been and storage is very limited. Be prepared to live out of your suitcase if you are here for more than a few days. Tip: Book a twin double room as we did for the same price as a standard double, you get much more floorspace in your room. Well worth a look at.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Find”
Reviews.Author: jhembree
Reviews.Content: We ended our month-long vacation in NYC and as we are frequent visitors of this vibrant city, we wanted to find a hotel that was moderately priced. The Park South Hotel is in Mid-Town South and although it's not directly located in the happening spots, the half-block walk to the 6 subway line was very convenient for us. First of all, don't be put off by the look of the lobby. It's rather depressing because of the lack of light and decor (definitely needs a remodeling). I highly recommend any of the rooms facing East 28th, floors 6 to 8. Be very specific and adamant in requesting a view room; I called twice prior to arrival and was willing to wait for an available room the day we arrived (they will hold your luggage until the room is ready). It's worth it-- we got a view of the Chrylser Building, room 707. It was a clean, very comfortable room with large windows, high ceilings and surprisingly quiet. Non-existant closet space so be prepared to store your suitcases in the room corners. Adequate bathroom with toiletries. Housekeeping services were erratic; one day we didn't receive bath towels, but a call down to the front desk quickly solved the problem. They have a strange turndown service time-- between 6:00 to 6:30, which I consider really early. If you ask them to return in say, 15 minutes, no one comes. Extremely slow elevators; there are 2 but they're small. Fantastic continental breakfast (bagels, pastries, cereals, etc.) in the room price; it's communal in the hotel restaurant (between 8:00-11:00). You also get the NY Times delivered to your door in the mornings. For the price it's a good stay, but don't look to be pampered here.

Reviews.Title: “A cute boutique”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think my fellow Londoners who said 'This is not a boutique hotel' are a bit confused. True, it is not a hip hotel. It's a lot more traditional and less self-conscious than the Hudson or Muse. But it is everything a boutique should be: quirky, personal, intriguing, and with nice little extras thrown in. It has a library of books and a library of DVDs. High-speed internet is included, as is a continental breakfast. It's also in a likeable neighbourhood (who can dislike Park Avenue?) and the rooms have a very good square-foot-per-dollar ratio for Manhattan. I would certainly use it again. And as for moving to the W instead ... well that may be hip, but it's a chain hotel! Personally I prefer an unhip boutique to even the hippest chain. (I am writing this from the lobby, having just checked out - did I mention the helpful staff?)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 5 night stay at the Park South Hotel, and couldnt fault it. The staff were very friendly, from check in to check out, and they were always willing to give information, and answer any questions. The room I was in (510) was quite small, but as I was a single traveller it was not a problem. The room was very clean, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was nice, and the power shower was excellent. The buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurany had a wide choice of things to eat & drink, and never ran out of anything, as staff were always on hand to stock it up. The location is pretty good as well, as you are on the 6 subway line, which is 2 minutes from the hotel, which takes you just about anywhere you want to go. It was safe walking about at any time of the day or night, and there are a few 24 hour stores close by if you need anything. All in all, it was a pleasure to stay here, and when I return to New York I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: mescobar
Reviews.Content: My two girl friends and I stayed here because of the location, and we were very happy with the quality of the hotel too. It was very clean and inviting. The continental breakfast (included) was the best I have had for selection. I had something different each morning. I liked the decor in our room, and the beds were quite comfortable. Conveniences outside the hotel include a drug store, bakery, small market, many Indian restaurants, McDonalds and the #6 green line subway a few steps down the street. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Orbitz or Expedia and reviewed the hotel's website. I felt like I was getting a really good deal and, of course, had a bit of concern as to why. However, upon arrival I was very pleasantly surprised. It really is a great little hotel with a nice bar and restaurant (although I just had a couple of drinks there, no dinner), a computer room/office, and very nice, helpful staff. I had a single queen room although I swear the bed seemed more like a full. But, it was a comfortable bed. The room and bathroom were quite small though and so our luggage and stuff kind of took over because there wasn't really anywhere to put it. But, heck, it is right in the middle of Manhattan, a block from the subway and is central to everything. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: kernal74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and over all well maintained. A block from the subway makes getting around even easier. My only complaint is there is a no pet policy! Will always stay here when I dont have my dog!

Reviews.Title: “Nice personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Jas0nCheryl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good, but not fantastic area. It is a block away from the subway station and within close proximity to Empire State Building. Other large attractions are a short walk away. We arrived early in the morning, 5th July and stayed for 2 nights. The receptionist gave us a free upgrade as she said the rooms that can be booked online are quite small. Room: The room was a decent size, clean and well decorated. It contained a fax machine, telephone with voicemail, computer data ports and a room safe. The bed was very comfortable and large. Our room overlooked the road with a car park opposite. The television reception wasn't very good, but I remembered seeing on the internet a mention of free DVD's for hire. At reception they have a list of all the DVD's available for use, some were recent releases, apparently they even have a variety of children's DVD's. There isn't any schedule in the room about the how to retrieve voicemail or hire of DVD's, you need to ask at reception. The bed was turned down in the evening with chocolates on the pillows. Bathroom: Nice variety of bath products, clean, fresh towels, a hairdryer, one bathrobe, a coffeemaker and coffee and clean glasses. The bathroom was compact but clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast: We were offered breakfast as soon as we checked in as we arrived very early in the morning. Continental breakfast was well presented and a good variety. There was cereal, 2 varieties of milk, 3 varieties of juice, fruit, cheese and ham platter, croissants, bagels, muffins, breads, even poptarts. Tea and coffee. The breakfast is complimentary, which saves a lot of money and is served in the diningroom. Staff: Receptionists were very helpful and polite, chocolates were available on the front desk. The doorman was always ready with a helping hand and a smile. We needed to leave our suitcases stored in the hotel on our last day as we were only leaving that evening. As soon as I sat down with my luggage in reception the doorman had wisked my cases away and given me receipts for them. He also recognised us when we returned to the hotel later that day and instantly fetched all our luggage without even seeing the receipt s- good memory. Overall, we had a lovely stay, no complaints, we were impressed with the rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tigerfeet
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. I was really happy that we chose that one. immaculately clean. Staff were friendly If I had one complaint it was the paper cups at breakfast breakfast was great would definately stay there again and would recommend to anyone going to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: alsur
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Park South with 3 friends. At check-in, they gave us a free upgrade, but found out it wasn't 2 doubles like we reserved. But they quickly changed our rooms, and we ended up with 2 doubles, on the ground floor, just a few steps away from the hotel's restaurant/jazz club. The room was cute, bedding was super comfy, and the bathroom was small but nicely remodeled with great water pressure. We only had one small window in the corner looking into a small maintenance courtyard, so it was like we didn't have a window at all. The air conditioner was noisy at times, but that's the way those units are and we all still slept fine. The room was very clean and housekeeping cleaned everything up (including our dirty wine glasses and chocolate wrappers). The free DVDs and breakfast were a nice touch. The only other complaint would be that it was right by the lobby so we could hear the live jazz music from the restaurant. Luckily we didn't go to sleep until late anyway so it wasn't a problem. On business trips to NY I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Marriott and Millenium Hilton, all way downtown. Obviously this wasn't the Ritz, but I was still very pleased with the room and convenient location. We could walk to Union Square or take the subway right on the corner. And it was so close to the train station, it was a cheap cab ride. I've stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania by the train station and payed the same price as here, but this is by far, was so much better. You can't beat the $170/night price.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Time Out Guide to New York wrote that this hotel was a small 4 star boutique hotel that has recently been refurbished. When we arrived we were utterly dissapointed. The hotel is situated in a noisy street opposite some curry restaurants. The foyer was dark and very tired looking with just some worn out looking sofas and a dying rubber plant for decoration. When we had checked in we went up to our double room along some very brown dark corridors. The room itself was tiny and narrow, there were two beds and a small dirty window. The bathroom was even smaller with none of the products one would expect from a "boutique hotel". We were utterly dissapointed and left immediately (we had booked in for 7 nights). Even though I lost one nights board we just had to leave. We had the good fortune to find the W Hotel on Lexington Avenue - a true Boutique Hotel (Bliss Products, Lovely showers) everything one would expect from a wonderful city like New York!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 11 night stay at the Park South Hotel and had a very good experience. Our room was spacious for New York - a king executive - and although we only had one chair at the beginning, housekeeping provided us with the extra chair and small table as shown in the picture on the hotel website. Sandra at the front desk was responsible for this - she was so friendly and helpful, as was Jesus (pronounced Hey-soos) who arranged our return ride to LAG. We also requested a full sized ironing board since we were staying for so long and this was provided immediately as well. The closet was small but there were hooks by the door and if you hang your long things on hangers and then hang these on the hooks, it works. The room was very clean and smelled good and the bathroom was spotless (and I am a picky person who notices these things). Toiletries like shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and lotion are provided as well as a white robe, which was handy. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well every night. The a/c was loud but not enough to keep my husband awake and I use ear plugs anyway. We loved all the extras like the chocolates at the front desk (we ate many), the free videos (we watched several) and the breakfast which is every bit as wonderful as the reviews say and served until 11:00 for late risers. Also, we did not see any sign of gang activity and we were out some nights as late as 11:30 p.m. We took the subway everywhere and appreciated that it was so handy. There are scores of restaurants of every nature and kind close to the hotel, especially on Lexington and Third Avenues. My only disappointment was that we did not have a view of the Chrysler Building as shown on the Website but we probably wouldn't have had time to look at it much anyway. In any event, we certainly recommend this hotel and would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June 15, 2005 I stayed at this hotel with a friend for 3 nights in a room with double beds. The room was emaculate and furnished beautifully. Although small, as expected, it was extremely comfortable and very quiet. The temperature was in the high 80's and we were able to keep the room nice and cool. The beds were very cozy and the bathroom was clean. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The continental breakfast was incredible and was provided in a beautiful setting. Although Murray Hill is not directly near the theater district, the subway access is only steps away. I feel that this hotel is an incredible value and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! My new favourite!”
Reviews.Author: LorelaiLii
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a four-night stay at the Park South, and I'm already prepared to return! Starting from check-in: I e-mailed the hotel that I would be arriving on the red-eye flight. I came by the hotel, prepared to drop my bags and see the City until the 3:00 p.m. check-in. Amazingly, they had my room ready for me! And, it was exactly the room I had hoped for when I made my reservation requests, right down to the extra pillows and the view. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We seriously felt as though we were at home in Gramercy Park. Insider tip: instead of apples in the lobby, the Park South has a gi-normous bowl of chocolates always filled and ready for the rejuvenating nosh. Everyone mentions the room size (my exec double-double was generously-sized and comfortable); the a/c (effective and quiet); the beds (wonderful Sertas with down comforters). Housekeeping was efficient, but as another review said, not so good about the coffee maker or the tumblers and cups. The pillow chocolates were amazing, though, and made up for a little oversight. Here's a huge bonus: the "continental breakfast" is fantastic! Luncheon meats, cheeses, boiled eggs, yogurt, in addition to standard and specialty breads, pastries and cereal. The restaurant serves fantastic food at supper, as well. The area is convenient to everything and the nearby subway stop is great. The seedy element that was discussed in another review was completely non-existent on our stay (we felt comfortable walking in the area at all hours of the day and night), except for some "professionals" on Saturday night. The Park South is my new favourite!

Reviews.Title: “A great base in NY”
Reviews.Author: hersoton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights in April 2005. In my perfect world I had been looking for something closer to midtown/central park - but in fact this hotel proved to be in the perfect location. Situated at 28th and Park, it is less than one minutes walk from the greenline subway which runs the length of Manhatten Island. If you prefer to walk, its five minutes walk from the Flatiron Building, around 10-15 minutes walk from the Empire State and around 20 mins walk to north to Grand Central Station or south to Greenwich Village. The hotel itself is described as a 'boutique hotel' and rooms are certainly compact. However, the room has just about enough storage space. View from window non-existant (other brick walls) but only to be expected in NY unless you are up a tower block. Beds, furnishings and bathroom all excellent. The size of the hotel means limited public rooms but there is great bar/resturant called 'The Black Duck' which also serves complimentary breakfast (seemingly irrespective of how you book). This is excellent - huge choice of bread, d-i-y toast, bagels, English muffins, cereal, hardboiled eggs, cold meats, yoghurts and tea/coffee. The whole system was very 'laid back', so that although there was no coffee maker in the room it was easy to pop down and collect early morning tea/coffee in the takeaway cups provided, and return for breakfast later! There is a pleasant if slightly dark reception area, the highlight of which is the bowl on the reception desk which is filled not with the usual tired apples or oranges, but with minature Hershey's chocolates! There is also complimentary internet access (including printers) in the basement, which is invaluable. The only real complaint we had was the noise coming into through the (shut) bedroom window from the hotels airconditioning/heating units, which was very loud and made me glad to have hung onto my airline earplugs. If you need perfect peace to sleep ask for a high or an externally facing room. All in all though a very good choice of hotel which, whilst not cheap, does represent good value for money in the heart of NY.

Reviews.Title: “great place for business”
Reviews.Author: fnaughton
Reviews.Content: i spent five nights in the Park South over April/May 2005, and found it to be really good value for money. The room was small, but immaculate, with a fair-sized bathroom. Receptionists and porters were friendly and helpful all the time. There are free DVDs available from reception if you want them, and in the basement is a complete free business centre, with high-speed internet access, printing and so on. Really useful. Breakfast was good - a bit low on fruit (lots of apples and bananas) but lots and lots of cheese, muffins, breads, bagles, etc. And free newspapers are also a nice thing And the location is great - twenty yards from the subway, surrounded by great Indian restaurants (and a McDonalds up the road if you really need one!), easy walk to places like the UN, Empire State, etc. I'll definitely stay here again. Oh, and I booked with quikbook, and had no problems with the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Cat4158
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms directly with the hotel internet site- an oversize king and a double double. We chose the package that included Broadway tickets, a meal in the Black Duck and a free drink at the bar. The rooms were spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable and spacious enough for our needs. Storage space was limited but ample for our four night stay. The Black Duck served good food - they even prepared a special vegetarian meal. The complimentary breakfast was ample with a great selection of pastries, muffins, cereals, cheese, meat, fruit and eggs. Our theatre tickets were first class with seats in the Orchestra stalls - market value $100 per seat. The hotel is close to the subway line making getting around fairly simple. A huge added bonuus was the reduction they gave in the rate I'd already booked saving us almost $200. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Hammers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the big Apple and stayed seven nights at The Park South which is located very close to the subway at Lexington Ave. Line 6 gives easy access to Uptown;Shops, Central Park etc and Downtown, into little Italy and further south into the Financial District. The Hotel is cosy, clean, well run, with a good mix of guests from Europe, Asia and the USA. The Breaky and free newspaper was a big bonus and set you up for a day exploring the Big Apple. About 5.00 in the evening, the Hotel bar comes alive for Happy hour or two and buzzys most of the evening especially at weekends, when a Jazz band plays live in one corner. The menu was tastefull and adequate, however the local area is peppered with lots of good priced establishments, for those with a spicey palate. Some of the rooms can seem small but in the city that never sleeps we had no problem despite the general noise of NY. If you want to stay close, but not on top of the action, this is a great choice of Hotel. Rated eight out of ten on all major pointers. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location!”
Reviews.Author: OCTravelMom
Reviews.Content: Rooms are "cozy" but very clean, nicely appointed and well maintained... only negatives: heater/fan were noisy and view out our window was of a brick wall...there are no closets to hang your clothes in...our "08" room was slightly larger than our friends' "09" room next door...complimentary continental b-fast was surprisingly ample: cold cut & cheese platter, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, assorted cold cereals, bagels, muffins, breads, fresh fruit, juices & coffee served in the restaurant downstairs until 11 a.m.! fitness room adequate...staff was courteous and helpful! ...#6 subway and Les Halles bistro are 1/2 block away! ...check their website for weekend specials... OVERALL AN EXCELLENT VALUE FOR NEW YORK CITY!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: livery
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here last weekend and were impressed. It is in a good location, easy to get around the city on foot from here. Go for a double double to get a bit of extra space. Room and bathroom very clean and well stocked with hairdryer, toiletries, bathrobe & plenty of towels. Breakfast was a help-yourself affair with oodles of cerals, bagals, toast, tea, coffee & juices. If we were going back we would stay again without a doubt.

HotelInfo.Name: Park South Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 124 East 28th Street, New York City, NY 10016
